82.Bakhtiari Nejad: And indeed, I am very forgiving to anyone who repents and believes and does good, and then remains guided.”

83.Bakhtiari Nejad: And (God said:) “Moses, what made you rush ahead of your people?”

84.Bakhtiari Nejad: He said: “They are close on my footsteps, and I rushed to You to please You my Lord.”

85.Bakhtiari Nejad: He (God) said: “Indeed We have tested your people after you, and the Sumeri misguided them.”

86.Bakhtiari Nejad: So, Moses returned to his people, angry and sorrowful. He said: “My people, didn't your Lord promise you a good promise? Was the promise too long for you or did you want the anger of your Lord to come down upon you that you broke (your) promise to me?”

87.Bakhtiari Nejad: They said: “We did not break (our) promise to you on purpose, but we were made to carry a load of ornament from (Pharaoh’s) people, so we threw it (into fire) same as the Sumeri threw.”

88.Bakhtiari Nejad: Then he brought out (of the fire) a body of a calf for them which had a sound, so they said: “This is your god and god of Moses, but he (Moses) has forgotten.”

89.Bakhtiari Nejad: Did they not see that it does not respond to them a word, and it does not have power of any harm or any benefit for them?

90.Bakhtiari Nejad: And certainly, Aaron had told them previously: “My people, you are only being tested by it, and indeed your Lord is the beneficent, so follow me and obey my order.”

91.Bakhtiari Nejad: They said: “We never stop being devoted to it until Moses returns to us.”

92.Bakhtiari Nejad: He (Moses) said: “Aaron, what kept you back when you saw them losing the (right) path,

93.Bakhtiari Nejad: that you did not follow me? Did you disobey my order?”

94.Bakhtiari Nejad: He (Aaron) said: “Son of my mother, do not grab me by my beard nor by my head, I was afraid that you say: “You made division between children of Israel, and you disregarded my word.””

95.Bakhtiari Nejad: He (Moses) said: “Sumeri, what is that you wanted to do?”

96.Bakhtiari Nejad: He (Sumeri) said: “I saw something that they did not see, so I grabbed a handful from the messenger's track/artifact and threw it (in the fire), and that is how my soul/mind seduced me.”

97.Bakhtiari Nejad: He (Moses) said: “So go away, and (punishment) for you in this life is to say do not touch me (to whoever that comes close to you), and indeed it is a promise for you that will never be broken, and look at your god, the one that you remained devoted to it, as we shall burn it then we shall totally spread it out into the sea.”

98.Bakhtiari Nejad: Your god is only God, the One that there is no god except Him. His knowledge includes everything.

99.Bakhtiari Nejad: That is how We tell you of the news of what has passed. And We have given you a reminder (Quran) from Us.

100.Bakhtiari Nejad: Whoever stays away from it (Quran), then indeed he will carry a burden on the Resurrection Day.

101.Bakhtiari Nejad: They remain in that (state) forever, and it is a bad load for them on the Resurrection Day.

102.Bakhtiari Nejad: The day when the horn is blown, on that day We gather the guilty ones, having cyanosis (or lead-color eyes).

103.Bakhtiari Nejad: They whisper among themselves: “You only stayed (dead) ten days.”

104.Bakhtiari Nejad: We know better what they say when the most perceptive among them says: “You only stayed (dead) one day.”

105.Bakhtiari Nejad: And they ask you about the mountains (on that day), say: “My Lord completely pulverizes them,

106.Bakhtiari Nejad: then He leaves them as a flat plain,

107.Bakhtiari Nejad: you would not see any curve or bump in it.”

108.Bakhtiari Nejad: On that day, they follow the caller without deviating from him, and the voices will be lowered for the beneficent and you only hear but a murmur.

109.Bakhtiari Nejad: On that day mediation will not (have any) benefit, except from someone whom the beneficent has permitted him and He approves of his saying.

110.Bakhtiari Nejad: He knows what is in front of them and what is behind them, and they do not comprehend His knowledge.

111.Bakhtiari Nejad: And the faces will be humbled (and lowered) before the eternal living (God), and anyone who carries wrongdoing has failed.

112.Bakhtiari Nejad: And whoever does good and he is a believer has no fear of injustice or holding back (his reward).

113.Bakhtiari Nejad: And that is how We sent down an Arabic Quran and in it We explained in various ways about the threat (of punishment), so that they may be cautious (of God), or it may cause them remembrance (and they take notice).

114.Bakhtiari Nejad: So, God, the true king is highest (and above all). And do not rush to read the Quran before its revelation to you is completed, and say: “My Lord, increase my knowledge.”

115.Bakhtiari Nejad: We have certainly instructed Adam in the past, but he forgot, and We did not find any determination in him.

116.Bakhtiari Nejad: And (remember) when We said to the angels: “Be humble to Adam.” then they (all) humbled except Iblis (Satan) who refused.

117.Bakhtiari Nejad: Then We said: “Adam, indeed this is an enemy for you and for your wife, so do not let him drive you both out of the garden, so that you become unhappy.

118.Bakhtiari Nejad: Indeed, you will not be hungry nor naked in there,

119.Bakhtiari Nejad: and you will not be thirsty nor suffer from sun’s heat (or sunburn) in there.”

120.Bakhtiari Nejad: But Satan seduced him, he said: “Adam, should I lead you to the tree of eternity (and immortality) and to a kingdom that does not deteriorate?”

121.Bakhtiari Nejad: So, they both ate from it, then their shame (their private parts) appeared to them, and they began to put patches of leaves of the paradise over themselves (to cover their genitals). Adam disobeyed his Lord, so he erred.

122.Bakhtiari Nejad: Then his Lord chose him, and He turned to him (in mercy) and guided him.

123.Bakhtiari Nejad: He said: “Go down from it both of you together. Some of you will be enemies of the others. And when guidance comes to you from Me, then anyone who follows My guidance will not lose (the right path) and he will not be unhappy,

124.Bakhtiari Nejad: and whoever stays away from My reminder then indeed he will have a hard life and We will gather him as a blind on the Resurrection Day.”

125.Bakhtiari Nejad: He will say: “My Lord, why did you gather me as a blind, while I could see (before)?”

126.Bakhtiari Nejad: He (God) says: “Same way as My signs came to you and you forgot them, and like that you will be forgotten today.”

127.Bakhtiari Nejad: And that is how We pay back anyone who is excessive and does not believe in his Lord’s signs, and certainly the punishment of the Hereafter is more severe and more lasting.

128.Bakhtiari Nejad: Is it not a guide for them that how many generations before them We destroyed, which they are (now) walking in their habitat? Indeed, there are signs in that for the people of intellect.

129.Bakhtiari Nejad: And if it was not for a word that was previously issued from your Lord and for a finite time, it (the punishment) would have been necessary.

130.Bakhtiari Nejad: So be patient about what they say, and glorify your Lord with His praise before rising of the sun and before its setting and glorify Him during hours of the night and on both sides of the day, that you may be content (and pleased).

131.Bakhtiari Nejad: Do not stretch out your eyes to (and be dazzled by) what We made some group among them enjoy, (it is) beauty of this world’s life so that We test them with it, while the provision of your Lord is better and more lasting.

132.Bakhtiari Nejad: And instruct your family to mandatory prayer and persist on it. We do not ask you for provision, We provide for you, and the (good) ending is for those who are cautious (of God).

133.Bakhtiari Nejad: And they say: “Why does he not bring us a sign from his Lord?” Didn't a clear evidence come to them in what is in the previous scriptures?

134.Bakhtiari Nejad: And if We had destroyed them by punishment before that (sending the prophet), they would have certainly said: “Our Lord, why did you not send us a messenger, so we follow Your signs before we are humiliated and disgraced?”

135.Bakhtiari Nejad: Say: “Everyone is waiting, so you wait (too), and you are going to know who are the followers of the even (and the right) path and who are guided.”

1.Bakhtiari Nejad: Reckoning of people is getting close, and they turn away in negligence.

2.Bakhtiari Nejad: Whenever a new reminder comes to them from their Lord, they listen to it while they play (and joke around).

3.Bakhtiari Nejad: Their hearts are preoccupied, and those who do wrong keep the private talk secret (saying:) “Is this but a human being like you? Do you give in to the magic while you see (and realize)?”

4.Bakhtiari Nejad: He (Muhammad) said: “My Lord knows (all) the words (that are spoken) in the skies and the earth, and He hears all and knows all.”

5.Bakhtiari Nejad: But they said: “Confused dreams, or he made it up, or he is a poet, so he should bring us a miracle like it was sent to the earlier (prophets).”

6.Bakhtiari Nejad: We destroyed any town before them that did not believe, so will they believe?

7.Bakhtiari Nejad: We did not send (any messenger/prophet) before you except men whom We revealed to them, so ask the people of the reminder (people of the book) if you do not know.

8.Bakhtiari Nejad: And We did not make them bodies that do not eat food, and they were not immortals.

9.Bakhtiari Nejad: Then We fulfilled the promise (We made) to them and saved them and anyone We wanted, and We destroyed the excessive ones.

10.Bakhtiari Nejad: We have certainly sent down a book to you in which there is your mention/reminder, do you not understand?

11.Bakhtiari Nejad: And We crushed many towns that were wrongdoers, and We gave rise to other people after them.

12.Bakhtiari Nejad: And when they felt Our punishment, they immediately ran away from it.

13.Bakhtiari Nejad: Do not run away, and return to whatever luxury you were given and to your homes, so that you may be questioned.

14.Bakhtiari Nejad: They said: “Woe to us, we were wrongdoers.”

15.Bakhtiari Nejad: And that their calling did not stop until We made them extinct as a mowed-down field.

16.Bakhtiari Nejad: And We did not create the skies and the earth and what is between them to play around.

17.Bakhtiari Nejad: If We wanted to take a hobby, We would have taken it from what is with Us, if We were doers.

18.Bakhtiari Nejad: No, but We throw the truth over the falsehood, and it destroys it, and then it dies out. And woe to you for what you describe.

19.Bakhtiari Nejad: And everyone in the skies and the earth belongs to Him, and those with Him are not arrogant about serving Him, and they do not get tired.

20.Bakhtiari Nejad: They glorify (Him) night and day, and they do not slack off.

21.Bakhtiari Nejad: Or have they taken gods from the earth that they (can) raise (the dead)?

22.Bakhtiari Nejad: If there were gods in them (in the skies and the earth) besides God, they would have certainly corrupted them both. God, the Lord of the dominion, is flawless about what they describe.

23.Bakhtiari Nejad: He is not questioned about what He does, while they will be questioned.

24.Bakhtiari Nejad: Or have they taken gods besides Him? Say: “Bring your proof. This is the message of those with me and the message of those before me.” But most of them do not know the truth and they turn away.

25.Bakhtiari Nejad: We did not send any messenger before you unless We revealed to him that there is no god except Me, so serve Me (alone).

26.Bakhtiari Nejad: And they say: “The beneficent has taken (the angles as) child.” He is flawless, rather they are His honored servants.

27.Bakhtiari Nejad: They (the angels) do not get ahead of Him in speech, and they do according to His commands.

28.Bakhtiari Nejad: He knows what is in front of them and what is behind them, and they (the angels) do not mediate except for someone He approves, and they are afraid of His awe.

29.Bakhtiari Nejad: And if any of them says: “I am god besides Him,” then We will punish that (person) with hell, that is how We punish the wrongdoers.

30.Bakhtiari Nejad: Or do those who disbelieve not see that the skies and the earth were joined together (as a single entity), then We separated them, and We made every living thing from the water? Do they not believe?

31.Bakhtiari Nejad: And We placed firm mountains in the earth, so that it does not shake them (as much), and We placed wide roadways in it so that they may be guided (and find their way).

32.Bakhtiari Nejad: And We made the skies a protecting roof, and yet they turn away from its signs.

33.Bakhtiari Nejad: And He is the One Who created the night and the day, and the sun and the moon each one floating (and moving) in an orbit.

34.Bakhtiari Nejad: And We did not make any human being immortal before you, so if you die then would they be the immortals?

35.Bakhtiari Nejad: Every person tastes death, and We test you with the bad and the good as a trial, and you are returned to Us.

36.Bakhtiari Nejad: And when those who disbelieve see you, they only take you as a joke (saying:) “Is this the one who mentions your gods (and rejects them)?” While they are disbelievers in the mention of the beneficent.

37.Bakhtiari Nejad: The human being is created from rush (and is in a hurry by nature). I am going to show you My signs, so do not ask Me to rush (them).

38.Bakhtiari Nejad: And they say: “When is this promise, if you are truthful?”

39.Bakhtiari Nejad: If those who disbelieve knew of the time that they will not be able to keep the fire away from their faces and from their backs and they will not be helped (then they would not say such things).

40.Bakhtiari Nejad: No, but it (punishment) comes to them suddenly and stuns them and they cannot repel it and they are not given any delays.

41.Bakhtiari Nejad: And messengers before you were certainly ridiculed, then those who laughed at them were surrounded by what they were ridiculing (the punishment).

42.Bakhtiari Nejad: Say: “Who protects you at night and day from the beneficent?” Yet they turn away from remembering their Lord.

43.Bakhtiari Nejad: Or do they have gods that defend them against Us? They cannot help themselves and they are not defended/protected from Us.

44.Bakhtiari Nejad: No, but We gave these and their fathers enjoyment until life lasted long for them (and they had a long life). Do they not see that We come to the earth and reduce it from its sides? So, are they the winners?

45.Bakhtiari Nejad: Say: “I only warn you with the revelation.” But the deaf do not hear the call when they are warned.

46.Bakhtiari Nejad: And if a blast of your Lord’s punishment touches them, they shall say: “Woe to us, indeed we were wrongdoers.”

47.Bakhtiari Nejad: And We will set up the scales of justice on the Resurrection Day, then no person will be wronged a bit, and even if it is the weight of a mustard seed, We bring it (into account), and We are sufficient for accounting.

48.Bakhtiari Nejad: And We have certainly given Moses and Aaron the criterion (of good and bad) and a light and a reminder for those who are cautious (of God),

49.Bakhtiari Nejad: those who fear their Lord in secret, and they are in awe of the Hour (Resurrection).

50.Bakhtiari Nejad: And this (Quran) is a blessed reminder that We have sent it down. So, do you deny it?

51.Bakhtiari Nejad: And We had certainly given Abraham his good sense in the past, and We knew him well.

52.Bakhtiari Nejad: When he said to his father and his people: “What are these statues that you are devoted to them?”

53.Bakhtiari Nejad: They said: “We found our fathers serving them.”

54.Bakhtiari Nejad: He said: “You and your fathers have certainly been in an obvious error.”

55.Bakhtiari Nejad: They said: “Did you bring us the truth or are you playing around?”

56.Bakhtiari Nejad: He said: “No, but your Lord is the Lord of the skies and the earth, the One Who created them, and I am of those who testify to that.”

57.Bakhtiari Nejad: And by God, I shall plan for your statues after you turn back going away.

58.Bakhtiari Nejad: So, he made them into small pieces except the biggest one of them, so that they may return to him.

59.Bakhtiari Nejad: They said: “Who did this to our gods? Indeed, he is of the wrongdoers.”

60.Bakhtiari Nejad: They said: “We heard a young man mentioning them, he is called Abraham.”

61.Bakhtiari Nejad: They said: “Then bring him before the people’s eyes, so that they may testify.”

62.Bakhtiari Nejad: They said: “Abraham, did you do this to our gods?”

63.Bakhtiari Nejad: He said: “No, but this biggest of them did this, so ask them if they would talk.”

64.Bakhtiari Nejad: So, they turned to themselves and said: “Indeed you yourselves are the wrongdoers.”

65.Bakhtiari Nejad: Then they were turned on their heads (in shame or in defiance saying:) “You certainly know that these do not talk.”

66.Bakhtiari Nejad: He said: “Do you serve something besides God that does not benefit you at all and it does not harm you?

67.Bakhtiari Nejad: Ugh (yuck) to you and to what you serve besides God. Do you not understand?”

68.Bakhtiari Nejad: They said: “Burn him and help your gods if you are doers.”

69.Bakhtiari Nejad: We said: “Fire, be cool and safe for Abraham.”

70.Bakhtiari Nejad: And they intended a plot against him, so We made them the worst losers.

71.Bakhtiari Nejad: And We saved him and Lot (and took them) to the land that We blessed it for humankind.

72.Bakhtiari Nejad: And We gave him Isaac, and in addition Jacob, and We made all of them righteous.

73.Bakhtiari Nejad: And We made them leaders who guided (others) by Our command, and We revealed to them to do good and perform mandatory prayer and give to mandatory charity, and they were Our servants.

74.Bakhtiari Nejad: And Lot, We gave him wisdom and knowledge and We saved him from the town that did the awful (things). They were bad people and disobedient.

75.Bakhtiari Nejad: And We admitted him into Our mercy, indeed he was of the righteous.

76.Bakhtiari Nejad: And (remember) Noah when he called out in the past, so We answered him, and We saved him and his family from the great disaster.

77.Bakhtiari Nejad: And We helped him against the people who denied Our signs. Indeed, they were bad people, so We drowned them all.

78.Bakhtiari Nejad: And (remember) David and Solomon when they judged about the field that people’s sheep grazed in it during the night, and We were witnesses to their judgment.

79.Bakhtiari Nejad: We made Solomon understand it (how to judge/rule). And We gave each one wisdom and knowledge. And We brought the mountains and the birds under David’s control, glorifying (Us). And We are doers (of it).

80.Bakhtiari Nejad: And We taught him making of armored coats for you in order to protect you from each other's violence (in your wars), so will you be thankful?

81.Bakhtiari Nejad: And for Solomon (We brought under his control) the gusting wind which by his command blows to the land which We blessed it. And We are knowledgeable of everything.

82.Bakhtiari Nejad: And some of the devils would dive for him and would do other work besides that and We were their guardians.

83.Bakhtiari Nejad: And Job, when he called out to his Lord: “Indeed harm has touched me (and I am sick), and you are the most merciful of merciful ones.”

84.Bakhtiari Nejad: So, We answered him, and We removed what was harming him, and We gave him his family, and the like of them with them (We doubled the size of his family), as a mercy from Us and a reminder to Our servants.

85.Bakhtiari Nejad: And Ishmael and Idris (Enoch) and Zul-kifl (man of the responsibility), they were all persevering (and patient).

86.Bakhtiari Nejad: And We admitted them into Our mercy, indeed they were of the righteous.

87.Bakhtiari Nejad: And (remember) Zun-nun (man of the fish, Jonah), when he left in anger, and he assumed that We will never be hard on him. Then he cried out from the darkness that there is no god except You, You are flawless (glory to You), indeed I was of the wrongdoers.

88.Bakhtiari Nejad: So, We answered him and We saved him from sorrow (and misery), and that is how We save the believers.

89.Bakhtiari Nejad: And (remember) Zachariah, when he called out to his Lord: “My Lord, do not leave me alone (without child), you are the best of inheritors.”

90.Bakhtiari Nejad: So, We answered him, and We gave him Yahya (John the Baptist) and We set his wife right for him (so she can bear a child). Indeed, they were quick in doing good, and they would call on Us with hope and in awe, and they were humble before Us.

91.Bakhtiari Nejad: And she (Mary), who guarded her private part, then We blew from Our breath of life (or spirit) into her, and We made her and her son a sign for humankind.

92.Bakhtiari Nejad: Indeed, this is your community (of faith), a single community and I am your Lord so serve Me (alone).

93.Bakhtiari Nejad: And they cut up their affair (in religion) between them, they all will return to Us.

94.Bakhtiari Nejad: So, anyone who does good and is a believer, then there is no rejection for his efforts and We are writers for him.

95.Bakhtiari Nejad: And it is forbidden to (people of) a town that We destroyed it (to return), they shall not return,

96.Bakhtiari Nejad: until (the barrier of) Ya’juj and Ma’juj (Gog and Magog) is opened, and they come down from every peak.

97.Bakhtiari Nejad: And the true promise is getting close, then when the eyes of those who disbelieved gaze (they would say:) “Woe to us, we were definitely ignorant of this, rather we were wrongdoers.”

98.Bakhtiari Nejad: (They will be told:) “Indeed you and whatever you served besides God are fuel for hell, and you will arrive (in it).

99.Bakhtiari Nejad: If these were (true) gods, they would not have arrived in there, and all of you will remain in there forever.”

100.Bakhtiari Nejad: They have moaning (and groaning) in there and they will not hear (anything) in it.

101.Bakhtiari Nejad: Indeed, those whom the good had come to them from Us (they were guided and did good deeds), they are removed far from it.

102.Bakhtiari Nejad: They will not hear its faint sound, and they will remain forever in whatever their souls desire.

103.Bakhtiari Nejad: The great terror (of hell) will not make them sad, and the angels will meet them (saying:) “This is your day which you were promised.”

104.Bakhtiari Nejad: On the day when We roll up the sky like rolling the scrolls for writing, as We began the first creation, We will repeat it. A promise that is Our responsibility. Indeed, We are doers (of this).

105.Bakhtiari Nejad: And We have certainly written in the Psalms after the reminder (Torah): “My righteous servants will inherit the earth.”

106.Bakhtiari Nejad: Indeed, there is a message in this for people who are servants (of God).

107.Bakhtiari Nejad: And We only sent you as a mercy for humankind.

108.Bakhtiari Nejad: Say: “Indeed it is revealed to me that your god is the One god, so are you submitters (to Him)?”

109.Bakhtiari Nejad: So, if they turn away, then say: “I have announced to you equally, and I do not know whether what you are promised is near or far.”

110.Bakhtiari Nejad: Indeed, He knows the words (you speak) openly and He knows what you hide.

111.Bakhtiari Nejad: And I do not know, it may be a test for you and an enjoyment for a while.

112.Bakhtiari Nejad: He (Muhammad) said: “My Lord, judge (between us) in truth, and Our Lord is the beneficent whose help is asked for against what you describe.”

1.Bakhtiari Nejad: People, be cautious of your Lord. Indeed, earthquake of the Hour is an awful thing.

2.Bakhtiari Nejad: On the day you see it, every nursing mother forgets about what she nurses, and every pregnant female drops her load (and miscarries), and you see the people intoxicated while they are not intoxicated, but God’s punishment is severe.

3.Bakhtiari Nejad: And some people argue about God without any knowledge and follow every rebellious devil.

4.Bakhtiari Nejad: It is prescribed against him (Satan) that anyone who takes him as a friend, then he misguides him and guides him to punishment of the burning fire.

5.Bakhtiari Nejad: People, if you are in doubt about the Resurrection, then (consider that) indeed We created you from dust, then from fertilized egg (zygote), then from a (dangling, clinging, and leach like) blood clot, then from a piece of chewed flesh (embryo) formed and unformed in order to clarify for you (that We are capable of everything). And We settle what We want in the wombs for a limited period, then We bring you out as a baby, then you reach your full maturity (and strength), and some of you die and some of you are returned to the lowest part of life, so that they do not know anything after knowing (and they forget what they knew). And you see the earth barren (and lifeless), then when We send down the rain on it, it revives and grows and produces all kinds of beautiful (plants).

6.Bakhtiari Nejad: That is because God is the truth, and He gives life to the dead, and He is capable of everything.

7.Bakhtiari Nejad: And the Hour (Resurrection) is coming, there is no doubt about it, and God raises those in the graves.

8.Bakhtiari Nejad: And some people argue about God without any knowledge or any guidance or any enlightening book.

9.Bakhtiari Nejad: Twisting his neck (being arrogant) to misguide (people) away from God’s way. He will have humiliation in this world, and We will make him taste punishment of the burning on the Resurrection Day.

10.Bakhtiari Nejad: (He will be told:) “This is for what your hands have sent ahead, and God is not unjust to His servants.”

11.Bakhtiari Nejad: And some people serve God on edge (doubtfully), so if any good happens to him, he is content with it, and if misfortune happens to him, he turns on his face (returns to his old ways) losing the world and the Hereafter. That is the clear loss.

12.Bakhtiari Nejad: He calls on other than God, something (or someone) that does not harm him and does not benefit him. That is the major error.

13.Bakhtiari Nejad: He calls on someone whose harm is closer (and more likely) than his benefit, certainly a miserable supporter (and friend) and certainly a miserable companion.

14.Bakhtiari Nejad: Indeed, God admits those who believe and do good to gardens which rivers flow through them. Indeed, God does what He wants.

15.Bakhtiari Nejad: If anyone thinks that God never helps him (Muhammad) in this world and the Hereafter, then let him stretch a rope to the ceiling (and hang himself with it), then let him cut it off and see whether his plan gets rid of what angers him.

16.Bakhtiari Nejad: And that is how We sent it down as clear signs, and that God guides anyone He wants.

17.Bakhtiari Nejad: Indeed, God judges between those who believe (in Quran), and the Jews and the Sabians and the Christians and the Zoroastrians, and those who associated (partners with God) on the Resurrection Day. Indeed, God is witness over everything.

18.Bakhtiari Nejad: Do you not see that it is God that everyone in the skies and everyone on the earth, and the sun and the moon and the stars, and the mountains and the trees, and the animals and many people humble themselves before Him? And many deserve the punishment, and whomever God humiliates then he has no one to honor him. Indeed, God does what He wants.

19.Bakhtiari Nejad: These are two opposing parties (believers and disbelievers) who argue about their Lord. So, clothes of fire are cut for those who disbelieve, and boiling water will be poured over their heads.

20.Bakhtiari Nejad: Everything in their stomachs and their skins are melted with it,

21.Bakhtiari Nejad: and clubs of iron are for them.

22.Bakhtiari Nejad: Whenever they want to get out of there because of grief (and misery), they are returned into it, and (are told:) “Taste the burning punishment.”

23.Bakhtiari Nejad: Indeed, God admits those who believe and do good into the gardens that rivers flow through them, and they will be decorated with bracelets of gold and pearls in there, and their clothes will be of silk in there.

24.Bakhtiari Nejad: And they will be guided to the good words (praising God), and they will be guided to the path of the praiseworthy (paradise).

25.Bakhtiari Nejad: Indeed, those who disbelieve and obstruct God's way and the Sacred Mosque, which We made it equal for the people whether (those who are) the resident in it or the visitors, and anyone who wants to deviate in there with wrongdoing, We make them taste from a painful punishment.

26.Bakhtiari Nejad: And (remember) when We put up Abraham at the site of the house (saying:) “Do not associate anything (as partner) with Me, and cleanse My house for those who go around (it) and those who stand (in prayer) and those who bow down humbly.”

27.Bakhtiari Nejad: And announce the Hajj (pilgrimage) to people, they will come to you on foot and on every lean camel (or any other ride), coming from every distant area,

28.Bakhtiari Nejad: so that they witness the benefits (provided) for them, and to mention God’s name on specified days over what He provided for them from the livestock animals, so eat from them and feed the suffering poor.

29.Bakhtiari Nejad: Then they should do away with their dirtiness (by cleansing themselves) and fulfill their pledges and go around the ancient house (Ka’aba).

30.Bakhtiari Nejad: That is (the Hajj pilgrimage), and whoever honors God’s requirements (and restrictions), then it is better for him in his Lord's view. And the livestock are made lawful for you except what is read to you. So, avoid the filth of the idols, and avoid false words (and lies),

31.Bakhtiari Nejad: being monotheist for God, not associating (any partner) with Him. Whoever associates (any partner) with God, then it is as if he falls from the sky and the birds snatch him, or the wind blows him to a remote place.

32.Bakhtiari Nejad: That is how it is, and whoever honors God’s rituals then indeed it is from self control of the hearts.

33.Bakhtiari Nejad: There are benefits in that (the livestock) for you for a limited period then their lawful place (of sacrifice) is at the ancient house (Ka’aba).

34.Bakhtiari Nejad: And for every community (of faith) We made a ritual (of sacrifice) so that they mention God’s name over what He provided them from the livestock animals. Your god is the One god, so submit to Him and give good news to those who humble themselves,

35.Bakhtiari Nejad: those whose hearts are scared when God is mentioned, and they are patient about what happens to them, and they perform mandatory prayer, and they spend (in God's way) from what We have provided for them.

36.Bakhtiari Nejad: And We made the fat camel/cow as part of God's rituals (of pilgrimage) for you. There is goodness in them for you, so mention God’s name on them as they are lined up, then when they fall (on the ground) on their sides, eat from them and feed the poor and the beggar. That is how We put them under your control (and in your service), so you may be thankful.

37.Bakhtiari Nejad: Their meat and their blood would never reach God, but your self control reaches Him. That is how He put them under your control (and in your service) so that you magnify God because He guided you, and give good news to the good doers.

38.Bakhtiari Nejad: Indeed, God defends those who believe. Indeed, God does not like any ungrateful traitor.

39.Bakhtiari Nejad: (Fighting) is permitted for those who are attacked (and war is waged against them), because they are wronged, and God is certainly able to help them (to victory),

40.Bakhtiari Nejad: those who have been unjustly driven out of their homes only because they said: “Our Lord is God.” If God had not repelled some people by others, certainly (many) monasteries, churches, synagogues and mosques in which God’s name is mentioned often, would have been demolished. And God shall help anyone who helps Him. Indeed, God is strong and powerful.

41.Bakhtiari Nejad: (They are) those who, if We make them powerful on the earth, perform mandatory prayer and give to mandatory charity and instruct to the acceptable (and right) and prohibit from the unacceptable (and wrong). And outcome of all affairs belongs to God.

42.Bakhtiari Nejad: And if they deny you, people of Noah and Aad and Thamud also denied (their prophets) before them,

43.Bakhtiari Nejad: and (so did) people of Abraham and people of Lot,

44.Bakhtiari Nejad: and inhabitants of Midian (people of Shu'aib/Jethro), and Moses was also denied, so I gave the disbelievers a break then I took them, so how was My rejection (and punishment)?

45.Bakhtiari Nejad: And how many towns did We destroy while it was wrongdoer, so it (was ruined and) fell on its roofs and (having) abandoned wells and towering castles.

46.Bakhtiari Nejad: Have they not traveled in the land, so that they have hearts to understand with it or ears to hear with it (to understand and hear the truth)? Indeed, the eyes are not blind, but the hearts which are in the chests are blind.

47.Bakhtiari Nejad: They ask you to hurry up with the punishment, while God never breaks His promise. And indeed, a day with your Lord is like a thousand years of what you count.

48.Bakhtiari Nejad: And how many towns did I give it a break while it was wrongdoer? Then I took it (destroyed it), and the final return is to Me.

49.Bakhtiari Nejad: Say: “People, I am only a clear warner for you.

50.Bakhtiari Nejad: So those who believe and do good, they have forgiveness and an honorable provision,

51.Bakhtiari Nejad: and those who try to disable (and to discredit) Our signs, they are inhabitants of the hellfire.”

52.Bakhtiari Nejad: And We did not send any messenger or prophet before you, unless when he wished (something) Satan threw (temptation) in his wish, but God eliminates anything that Satan throws, then God affirms His signs. God is knowledgeable and wise.

53.Bakhtiari Nejad: So that He makes whatever Satan throws as a test for those who have a disease in their hearts and their hearts are hardened, and indeed the wrongdoers are in extreme opposition (to the truth).

54.Bakhtiari Nejad: And so that those who were given knowledge know that it (Quran) is the truth from your Lord, so they believe in it and their hearts are humbled (and compliant) before it. And God certainly guides those who believe to a straight path.

55.Bakhtiari Nejad: Those who disbelieve do not stop to be in doubt about it until the Hour suddenly comes to them or the punishment of a barren (and hopeless) day comes to them.

56.Bakhtiari Nejad: On that day, the rule belongs to God, He judges between them, then those who believed and did good will be in gardens of delight.

57.Bakhtiari Nejad: And those who disbelieved and denied Our signs, then they will have a humiliating punishment.

58.Bakhtiari Nejad: And those who migrated in God's way, then they were killed or died, God shall provide them with a good provision, and indeed God is the best of providers.

59.Bakhtiari Nejad: He shall admit them to a place that they would be pleased with it. Indeed, God is knowledgeable and patient.

60.Bakhtiari Nejad: That is how it is. Whoever punishes the same as what he was made to suffer, then if he is wronged (again), God shall help him. Indeed, God is pardoning and forgiving.

61.Bakhtiari Nejad: That is because God makes the night pass through the day and makes the day pass through the night, and that God hears and sees all.

62.Bakhtiari Nejad: That is because God is the truth and whatever they call on besides Him, it is the falsehood, and God is the superior, the great.

63.Bakhtiari Nejad: Do you not see that God sends down the rain from the sky then the earth becomes green? God is nice and well-informed.

64.Bakhtiari Nejad: Everything in the skies and on the earth belongs to Him, and indeed God is the rich (without need) and the praiseworthy.

65.Bakhtiari Nejad: Have you not considered that God brought what is on the earth under your control (and in your service), and the ships sail through the sea by His command? And He keeps the sky from falling on the earth except by His permission. God is certainly gentle and merciful to the people.

66.Bakhtiari Nejad: And He is the One Who gives you life, then makes you die then brings you back to life. Indeed, the human being is ungrateful.

67.Bakhtiari Nejad: For every community (of faith) We made ritual to perform it, so they should not dispute with you about the matter (of rituals). And invite (people) to your Lord, indeed you are on the right guidance.

68.Bakhtiari Nejad: And if they argue with you, then say: “God knows best what you do.”

69.Bakhtiari Nejad: God will judge between you on the Resurrection Day regarding what you used to disagree about.

70.Bakhtiari Nejad: Do you not know that God knows whatever is in the skies and the earth? Indeed that is (recorded) in a book, indeed that is easy for God.

71.Bakhtiari Nejad: And they serve besides God something that He did not send down a reason for it and they do not have any knowledge of it. There is no helper for the wrongdoers.

72.Bakhtiari Nejad: And when Our clear signs are read to them, you notice the denial on the faces of those who disbelieve, they are about to assault those who read them Our signs. Say: “Should I tell you about worse than this? The fire that God promised it to those who disbelieve, and it is the bad destination.”

73.Bakhtiari Nejad: People, an example was given, so listen to it: “Indeed those you call on besides God never create a fly even if they get together for it, and if the fly takes anything away from them, they cannot get it back from it. The seeker and the sought are weak.”

74.Bakhtiari Nejad: They do not value God His true worth. Indeed, God is strong and powerful.

75.Bakhtiari Nejad: God chooses messengers from the angels and from the people. Indeed, God hears all and sees all.

76.Bakhtiari Nejad: He knows what is in front of them and what is behind them, and all affairs are returned to God.

77.Bakhtiari Nejad: You who believe, bow down and be humble (and prostrate) and serve your Lord and do good, so that you may succeed.

78.Bakhtiari Nejad: And try hard in God's way, a trying that He deserves. He chose you, and He did not impose any difficulty on you in the way of life (religion). This is the faith of your father Abraham. He named you Muslims (the submitted ones) in the past and in this, so that the messenger will be a witness over you, and you will be witnesses over the people, so perform mandatory prayer and give to mandatory charity and hold on to God, He is your protector, what an excellent protector and excellent helper.

1.Bakhtiari Nejad: The believers have succeeded,

2.Bakhtiari Nejad: those who are humble in their prayer,

3.Bakhtiari Nejad: and who stay away from useless (acts and talks),

4.Bakhtiari Nejad: and who do their mandatory charity,

5.Bakhtiari Nejad: and who guard their private parts,

6.Bakhtiari Nejad: except with their spouses or what they own, then indeed they are blameless,

7.Bakhtiari Nejad: and anyone who looks for beyond this, then they are those who exceed the limits,

8.Bakhtiari Nejad: and those who observe their trusts and their promise,

9.Bakhtiari Nejad: and who guard their mandatory prayers,

10.Bakhtiari Nejad: they are the inheritors,

11.Bakhtiari Nejad: those who inherit the paradise remaining in there forever.

12.Bakhtiari Nejad: And We have certainly created human being from extract of clay.

13.Bakhtiari Nejad: Then We placed him as a fertilized egg (zygote) in a safe quarter (the womb).

14.Bakhtiari Nejad: Then We made the fertilized egg into a (dangling, clinging, and leach like) blood clot, then We made the clot into a (piece of) chewed flesh, then We made the chewed flesh into bones, then We covered the bones with flesh, then We turned it into another creation. So blessed is God, the best of creators.

15.Bakhtiari Nejad: Then you certainly die after that.

16.Bakhtiari Nejad: Then you shall be raised on the Resurrection Day.

17.Bakhtiari Nejad: And We have certainly created seven paths/levels (of the skies) above you, and We are not neglectful of the creation.

18.Bakhtiari Nejad: And We send down rain from the sky in proper amount, then We make it settle in the earth, and indeed We are able to take it away.

19.Bakhtiari Nejad: And We produce gardens of date palms and grapes for you with it, and there are plenty of fruits in them that you eat from them.

20.Bakhtiari Nejad: And a tree (of olive) that comes out of Mount Sinai producing oil and sauce/dip for those who eat.

21.Bakhtiari Nejad: And there is a lesson for you in livestock, We give you drink from what is in their bellies, and there are many other benefits for you in them, and you also eat from them,

22.Bakhtiari Nejad: and you are carried on them and on the ships.

23.Bakhtiari Nejad: And We certainly sent Noah to his people, and he said: “My people, serve God, you have no god other than Him, will you not be cautious (of God)?”

24.Bakhtiari Nejad: The leaders of those who disbelieved among his people said: “He is only a human being like you who wants to be superior over you, and if God wanted He would have sent down angels, we did not hear of this among our forefathers,

25.Bakhtiari Nejad: he is only a man that there is madness in him, so put up with him for a while.”

26.Bakhtiari Nejad: He said: “My Lord, help me because they deny me.”

27.Bakhtiari Nejad: So We revealed to him: “Build the Ark under Our eyes and Our revelation, and when Our command comes and the oven erupts (with water), then put two of every kind (a male and a female) and your family in it except anyone among them whom the word is already issued against him, and do not talk to me about those who did wrong for they will be drowned.

28.Bakhtiari Nejad: And when you and those with you settle on the Ark, then say: “All praise belongs to God, the One Who saved us from the wrongdoing people.”

29.Bakhtiari Nejad: And say: “My Lord, make me land in a blessed landing place, you are the best of those who make (people) land.””

30.Bakhtiari Nejad: Indeed, there are signs in that, and indeed We put (people) to test.

31.Bakhtiari Nejad: Then We gave rise to another generation after them (people of Aad).

32.Bakhtiari Nejad: And We sent them a messenger (Hud) from among themselves (saying:) “Serve God, you have no god other than Him, will you not be cautious (of God)?”

33.Bakhtiari Nejad: And the leaders of his people, those who disbelieved and denied the meeting of the Hereafter and We made them comfortable in this world’s life said: “This is only a human being like you, he eats from what you eat from it and he drinks from what you drink,

34.Bakhtiari Nejad: and if you obey a human being like yourselves, then you are certainly losers.

35.Bakhtiari Nejad: Does he promise you that when you die and you become dust and bones, that you are brought out (and resurrected)?

36.Bakhtiari Nejad: What you are promised is far, far (from the truth),

37.Bakhtiari Nejad: there is nothing except our life of this world, we die and we live (and world goes on), and we will not be raised.

38.Bakhtiari Nejad: He is only a man that makes up a lie (and attributes it) to God, and we do not believe him.”

39.Bakhtiari Nejad: He said: “My Lord, help me because they deny me.”

40.Bakhtiari Nejad: He (God) said: “They shall become sorry in a short while.”

41.Bakhtiari Nejad: Then the awful blast rightfully took them, and We made them into debris. So, away with the wrongdoing people.

42.Bakhtiari Nejad: Then We gave rise to other generations after them.

43.Bakhtiari Nejad: No community (of faith) advances its appointed time, nor can they delay it.

44.Bakhtiari Nejad: Then We sent Our messengers one after the other, every time a messenger came to a community, they denied him. So, We made them follow each other (to destruction), and We made them stories (for people). So, away with people who do not believe.

45.Bakhtiari Nejad: Then We sent Moses and his brother Aaron with Our signs and clear power

46.Bakhtiari Nejad: to Pharaoh and his assembly, but they acted arrogantly, and they were bossy people.

47.Bakhtiari Nejad: They said: “Should we believe in two human beings like us while their people are our servants?”

48.Bakhtiari Nejad: So, they denied them both, then they became of the destroyed ones.

49.Bakhtiari Nejad: And We certainly gave Moses the book, so that they may be guided.

50.Bakhtiari Nejad: And We made son of Mary and his mother a sign, and We sheltered them both on a hilltop having an accommodation and a spring (of running water).

51.Bakhtiari Nejad: Messengers, eat from the good things and do good, indeed I know well what you do.

52.Bakhtiari Nejad: And indeed, this is your community, a single community, and I am your Lord so be cautious of Me.

53.Bakhtiari Nejad: But they cut up their affair between them (their religion) into pieces (becoming) as different groups, each party happy with what they have.

54.Bakhtiari Nejad: So, leave them in their overwhelming ignorance for a while.

55.Bakhtiari Nejad: Do they think that what We supplied them from wealth and children,

56.Bakhtiari Nejad: (is because) We are rushing good things for them? No, they do not realize.

57.Bakhtiari Nejad: Indeed, those who are fearful of the awe of their Lord

58.Bakhtiari Nejad: and who believe in their Lord’s signs

59.Bakhtiari Nejad: and who do not associate (partners) with their Lord

60.Bakhtiari Nejad: and who give from what they are given, and their hearts tremble because (they know that) they will return to their Lord,

61.Bakhtiari Nejad: (they are) those who rush in (doing) good, and they are ahead in (doing) that.

62.Bakhtiari Nejad: We do not task anyone beyond its capability, and there is a book with Us that speaks the truth, and they will not be wronged.

63.Bakhtiari Nejad: No, but their hearts are in overwhelming ignorance regarding this (truth), and they have deeds (that are) other than that, which they are doers of them.

64.Bakhtiari Nejad: Until We take their rich ones with the punishment, then they cry out for help.

65.Bakhtiari Nejad: Do not cry out for help today, indeed you will not be helped by Us.

66.Bakhtiari Nejad: My signs were read to you, but you used to turn back on your heels (to your old ways).

67.Bakhtiari Nejad: Being arrogant about it, talking nonsense (about My signs) in nightly conversation.

68.Bakhtiari Nejad: Do they not think about the words (of Quran), or has something come to them that had not come to their forefathers?

69.Bakhtiari Nejad: Or do they not recognize their messenger, so they reject him?

70.Bakhtiari Nejad: Or do they say there is madness in him? No, but he brought them the truth, and most of them dislike the truth.

71.Bakhtiari Nejad: And if the truth had followed their desires, then the skies and the earth and everyone in them would have certainly corrupted/perished. No, but We brought them their mention/reminder, but they turn away from their mention/reminder.

72.Bakhtiari Nejad: Or do you ask them for any payment? Payment from your Lord is better, and He is the best of providers.

73.Bakhtiari Nejad: And you certainly invite them to a straight path.

74.Bakhtiari Nejad: Indeed, those who do not believe in the Hereafter are deviators from the (right) path.

75.Bakhtiari Nejad: And if We have mercy on them and remove what is with them from harm, they will persist in their rebellion, blindly wandering.

76.Bakhtiari Nejad: And We have certainly taken them with the punishment, but they did not comply with their Lord, and they did not humbly plead.

77.Bakhtiari Nejad: Until when We opened a door having a severe punishment for them, then they became hopeless in it.

78.Bakhtiari Nejad: And He is the One Who made the hearing and the sight and the hearts for you. You give little thanks.

79.Bakhtiari Nejad: And He is the One Who multiplied (and spread) you on the earth, and you will be gathered to Him.

80.Bakhtiari Nejad: And He is the One Who gives life and causes death, and the alternation of night and day belongs to Him. Do you not understand?

81.Bakhtiari Nejad: No, but they say the same as what the earlier ones said.

82.Bakhtiari Nejad: They said: “Will we be raised when we die and become dust and bones?

83.Bakhtiari Nejad: We and our fathers have certainly been promised this in the past. This is only stories of the earlier ones.”

84.Bakhtiari Nejad: Say: “To whom belongs the earth and everyone in it, if you knew?”

85.Bakhtiari Nejad: They are going to say: “God.” Say: “Do you not take notice?”

86.Bakhtiari Nejad: Say: “Who is the Lord of the seven skies and the Lord of the great dominion?”

87.Bakhtiari Nejad: They are going to say: “God.” Say: “Will you not be cautious (of God)?”

88.Bakhtiari Nejad: Say: “In whose hand is the rule of everything? He shelters and no one is sheltered against him, if you knew.”

89.Bakhtiari Nejad: They are going to say: “God.” Say: “So, how are you bewitched?”

90.Bakhtiari Nejad: No, We have brought them the truth, and they are certainly liars.

91.Bakhtiari Nejad: God did not take a child and there is no god with Him, (if there was) then every god would have taken away what it had created, and some of them would have overcome the others. God is flawless about what they describe.

92.Bakhtiari Nejad: (God is) knower of the unseen and the visible, and He is above what they associate (with Him).

93.Bakhtiari Nejad: Say: “My Lord, I wish You would show me what they are promised.

94.Bakhtiari Nejad: My Lord, do not make me of the wrongdoing people.”

95.Bakhtiari Nejad: And We are certainly able to show you what We have promised them.

96.Bakhtiari Nejad: Repel (and respond to) badness with something that is better. We know better about what they describe.

97.Bakhtiari Nejad: And say: “My Lord, I seek Your protection from seductions of the devils,

98.Bakhtiari Nejad: and my Lord, I seek your protection from them being in my presence.”

99.Bakhtiari Nejad: Until when death comes to one of them, he says: “My Lord, send me back,

100.Bakhtiari Nejad: so that I do good in what I left behind (and neglected).” No way, indeed it is only a word that he says. And there is a separator behind them until the day they are raised.

101.Bakhtiari Nejad: So, when the horn is blown, then there is no relationship between them on that day, and they do not ask each other.

102.Bakhtiari Nejad: So those whose scales are heavy, they are the successful ones.

103.Bakhtiari Nejad: And those whose scales are light, then they are those who have lost themselves (their souls), remaining in hell forever.

104.Bakhtiari Nejad: The fire burns their faces, and they frown in it.

105.Bakhtiari Nejad: Were not My signs read to you, and you were denying them?

106.Bakhtiari Nejad: They say: “Our Lord, our misfortune overcame us, and we were misguided people.

107.Bakhtiari Nejad: Our Lord, bring us out of it (the fire), and if we return (to disbelief) then indeed we are wrongdoers.”

108.Bakhtiari Nejad: He (God) will say: “Go away, into it and do not talk to Me.

109.Bakhtiari Nejad: Indeed, there was a group of My servants who used to say: “Our Lord, we believe, so forgive us and have mercy on us, and You are the best of the merciful ones.”

110.Bakhtiari Nejad: But you took them as a joke (and ridiculed them) until they made you forget remembering Me and you used to laugh at them.

111.Bakhtiari Nejad: Indeed, I have rewarded them today because of their perseverance (and patience), indeed they are the triumphant ones.”

112.Bakhtiari Nejad: He (God) will say: “How many years did you stay in the earth (in the grave)?”

113.Bakhtiari Nejad: They will say: “We stayed for a day or part of a day, so ask those who count.”

114.Bakhtiari Nejad: He will say: “You only stayed a little while, if only you knew.

115.Bakhtiari Nejad: Did you think that We created you uselessly (without a purpose), and you are not returned to Us?”

116.Bakhtiari Nejad: High (above all) is God, the true king, there is no God except Him, the Lord of the honorable dominion.

117.Bakhtiari Nejad: And whoever calls on any other god with God without having any proof for it, then indeed his reckoning is with his Lord. Indeed, the disbelievers will not succeed.

118.Bakhtiari Nejad: And say: “My Lord, forgive and have mercy, and You are the best of the merciful ones.”

1.Bakhtiari Nejad: (This is) a chapter which We have sent it down and made it mandatory and We have sent down clear verses in it, so that you may take notice.

2.Bakhtiari Nejad: Flog each female adulterer/fornicator and male adulterer/fornicator one hundred lashes, and do not let pity for them take you away from God’s law if you believe in God and the Last Day, and a group of the believers should witness their punishment.

3.Bakhtiari Nejad: The male adulterer/fornicator should only marry a female adulterer/fornicator or a female idolater, and the female adulterer/fornicator should only get married to a male adulterer/fornicator or a male idolater, and that is forbidden to the believers.

4.Bakhtiari Nejad: And those who accuse chaste women, and do not bring four witnesses, then flog them eighty lashes and do not ever accept their testimony, and they are the disobedient ones.

5.Bakhtiari Nejad: Except those who repent and straighten out after that, then indeed God is forgiving and merciful.

6.Bakhtiari Nejad: And those who accuse their spouses, and there is not any witnesses for them except themselves, then their individual testimony (is acceptable) if they testify four times (swearing) by God that he is certainly of the truthful ones.

7.Bakhtiari Nejad: And the fifth (oath) that God’s curse be on him if he is of the liars.

8.Bakhtiari Nejad: And it will prevent the punishment from her if she testifies four times (swearing) by God that indeed he is of the liars.

9.Bakhtiari Nejad: And the fifth (oath) that God’s anger be on her if he is of the truthful ones.

10.Bakhtiari Nejad: And if it was not for God’s grace and mercy on you (you would be in trouble). God is the acceptor of repentance and wise.

11.Bakhtiari Nejad: Those who brought the lie (and accusation) were a group of you. Do not think that it (the accusation) is bad for you, but it is good for you. For every one of them earned a share of the sin, and the one among them who had greatest (share) of it, will have a great punishment.

12.Bakhtiari Nejad: Why when you heard it, the believing men and the believing women did not think well of themselves, and they did not say: “This is an obvious lie.”

13.Bakhtiari Nejad: Why did they not bring four witnesses for it? So, when they did not bring the witnesses, then they are the liars in God’s view.

14.Bakhtiari Nejad: And if it was not for God’s grace and mercy on you in this world and in the Hereafter, a great punishment would have touched you because of what you engaged in.

15.Bakhtiari Nejad: When you receive it (the accusation) through each others’ tongues and you say with your mouths what you have no knowledge of it, and you think it is insignificant, while it is significant in God's view.

16.Bakhtiari Nejad: And why when you heard it, you did not say: “It is not for us to speak of this, You are flawless (glory to You), this is a great false accusation.”

17.Bakhtiari Nejad: God advises you that do not ever repeat anything like it if you are believers.

18.Bakhtiari Nejad: And God clarifies the signs for you, and God is knowledgeable and wise.

19.Bakhtiari Nejad: Indeed, those who like to spread indecency among those who believe will have a painful punishment in this world and the Hereafter, and God knows and you do not know.

20.Bakhtiari Nejad: And if it was not for God’s grace and mercy on you, (you would be in trouble) and indeed God is gentle and merciful.

21.Bakhtiari Nejad: You who believe, do not follow Satan's footsteps, and whoever follows Satan's footsteps (should know that), indeed he instructs to indecency and to unacceptable (and wrong). And if it was not for God’s grace and mercy on you, none of you would ever be purified (absolved), but God purifies anyone He wants. God hears all and knows all.

22.Bakhtiari Nejad: And those who have grace and abundance (of wealth) should not swear that they would not give to the relatives (and close ones), and the needy, and the migrants in God’s way, and they should excuse and overlook. Do you not like God to forgive you? God is forgiving and merciful.

23.Bakhtiari Nejad: Those who accuse the unaware chaste believing women are cursed in this world and the Hereafter and they will have a great punishment,

24.Bakhtiari Nejad: on the day when their tongues and their hands and their feet testify against them for what they used to do,

25.Bakhtiari Nejad: on that day God pays them back in full their rightful dues, and they will know that God is the obvious truth.

26.Bakhtiari Nejad: Bad women are for bad men and bad men are for bad women, and good women are for good men and good men are for good women. They are clear of what they say (about them), they will have forgiveness and honorable provision.

27.Bakhtiari Nejad: You who believe, do not enter houses except your (own) houses until you have asked permission and have greeted their residents. That is better for you, so that you may take notice.

28.Bakhtiari Nejad: And if you do not find anyone in it, then do not enter it until permission is given to you, and if you are told to go back, then (do not enter and) go back, as that is purer (and better) for you. And God knows well what you do.

29.Bakhtiari Nejad: There is no blame on you if you enter vacant houses in which you have goods. God knows what you disclose and what you hide.

30.Bakhtiari Nejad: Tell the believing men to lower their eyes (and do not look lustfully) and guard their private parts. That is purer (and better) for them. God is well aware of what they do.

31.Bakhtiari Nejad: And tell the believing women to lower their eyes (and do not look lustfully) and guard their private parts, and they should not show their beauty except what is apparent of it, and they should put their scarves over their breasts, and they should not show their beauty except to their husbands or their fathers or their father in-law or their sons or their husbands' sons or their brothers or their brothers' sons or their sisters' sons or their women (companions) or those whom their right hands own or the male dependents with no desire (of women) or children who do not know about the private parts of women, and they should not stomp their feet to expose what they hide from their beauty. And all you believers repent to God, so that you may be successful.

32.Bakhtiari Nejad: And marry off the singles among you and the righteous among your male and female servants. If they are poor, God enriches them from His grace, and God is bountiful and knowledgeable.

33.Bakhtiari Nejad: And those who do not find (any way) to marry, should abstain (from sex) until God enriches them from His bounty. And those among what your right hands own who ask for the certificate (of freedom), then write it for them if you know any good in them, and give them some of God’s possession that He gave you. And do not force your maids into prostitution looking for gain of this world’s life, if they want to be chaste. And if anyone forces them, then after their compulsion God is forgiving and merciful (to them).

34.Bakhtiari Nejad: And We have certainly sent down to you clear (and clarifying) verses, and example of those who passed away before you, and an advice for those who are cautious (of God).

35.Bakhtiari Nejad: God is the light of the skies and the earth. Example of His light is like a lamp holder, in it is a lamp, the lamp is in a glass, the glass is as if it is a brilliant star (which is) lit by (the oil of) a blessed olive tree, that is neither on the east nor the west (so it gets sunlight equally all day), and its oil almost glows (by itself) even though fire has not touched it. Light upon light, God guides whom He wants to His light. And God gives the examples for the people, and God knows everything.

36.Bakhtiari Nejad: (This light is) in the houses that God has permitted His name to be raised and to be mentioned in it, and He is glorified in it in the mornings and the afternoons.

37.Bakhtiari Nejad: Men whom neither business nor trade (selling and buying) distracts them from remembering God and performing mandatory prayer and giving to mandatory charity, and they are afraid of a day in which the hearts and the eyes will turnabout (from agitation),

38.Bakhtiari Nejad: so that God rewards them better than what they did, and gives them more out of His grace. And God provides for anyone He wants without any limit.

39.Bakhtiari Nejad: Those who disbelieve, their works are like a mirage in a desert that a thirsty person imagines it as water until he gets to it and finds it to be nothing, and he finds God with him, and He pays back his account (in full), and God is quick in reckoning.

40.Bakhtiari Nejad: Or like darkness in a deep sea covered by a wave, over which is a wave with a cloud on top of it. Darkness, one on top of the other (such that) when he brings out his hand, he almost does not see it, and anyone who God did not put a light for him, then there is no light for him.

41.Bakhtiari Nejad: Do you not see that everyone in the skies and the earth and the birds with their wings outspread glorify God, each one knows its prayer and its glorification? God knows well what they do.

42.Bakhtiari Nejad: And the rule of the skies and the earth belongs to God, and the final return is to God.

43.Bakhtiari Nejad: Do you not see that God gently drives the clouds, then joins them together then makes them a pile, then you see the raindrops come out from within it, and He sends down hail that are within the mountains (of clouds) from the sky, then He strikes anyone He wants with it, and turns it away from anyone He wants, and the flash of its lightning almost takes away the sight (and blinds people)?

44.Bakhtiari Nejad: God alternates night and day. Indeed, there is a lesson in that for those who have insight.

45.Bakhtiari Nejad: And God created all creatures from water, and some of them walk on their bellies and some of them walk on two legs and some of them walk on four. God creates what He wants. Indeed, God is capable of everything.

46.Bakhtiari Nejad: We have certainly sent down clarifying verses, and God guides anyone He wants to a straight path.

47.Bakhtiari Nejad: And they say: “We have believed in God and the messenger, and we have obeyed.” Then some of them turn away after that, and they are not believers.

48.Bakhtiari Nejad: And when they are invited so that God and His messenger judge between them, suddenly some of them turn away.

49.Bakhtiari Nejad: And if the truth is for them (they are right), they come to him obediently.

50.Bakhtiari Nejad: Is there a disease in their hearts, or do they doubt, or are they afraid that God and His messenger deal unfairly about them? No, but they are the wrongdoers.

51.Bakhtiari Nejad: Indeed, word of the believers, when they are invited to God and His messenger to judge between them, is to say: “We hear and we obey.” And they are the successful ones.

52.Bakhtiari Nejad: And whoever obeys God and His messenger and fears (the punishment of) God and is cautious of Him, then they are the triumphant ones.

53.Bakhtiari Nejad: They solemnly swear by God that if you order them, they shall go out (and fight), say: “Do not swear, reasonable obedience (is enough), indeed God is well aware of what you do.”

54.Bakhtiari Nejad: Say: “Obey God and obey the messenger.” But if you turn away, he is only responsible for what he is charged with and you are responsible for what you are charged with, and if you obey him you are guided. And the messenger's responsibility is only clearly delivering (the message).

55.Bakhtiari Nejad: God has promised those who believe among you and do good that He shall make them successors (of power) on the earth as He made those before them successors, and He shall strengthen their way of life (religion) for them which He has approved for them, and afterward He shall replace their fear with security. (And then) they will serve Me (alone) and not associate anything with Me, and whoever disbelieves after that, they are the disobedient ones.

56.Bakhtiari Nejad: And perform mandatory prayer and give to mandatory charity and obey the messenger so that you may receive mercy.

57.Bakhtiari Nejad: Do not think that those who disbelieve weaken/escape (God) on the earth. Their housing will be the fire, certainly a miserable destination.

58.Bakhtiari Nejad: You who believe, those whom your right hands own and those (children) among you who have not reached puberty should ask your permission at three times (before coming to your rooms). Before morning mandatory prayer, and when you put off your clothes during noon time, and after evening mandatory prayer. (These are) three times of privacy for you. There is no blame on you or on them to circulate around you and each other at other times. That is how God clarifies the signs for you, and God is knowledgeable and wise.

59.Bakhtiari Nejad: And when your children reach puberty, then they should ask permission (at all times) as those before them asked for permission. That is how God clarifies His signs for you, and God is knowledgeable and wise.

60.Bakhtiari Nejad: And the women past menopause who do not expect a marriage, then there is no blame on them if they put off their clothes without displaying their beauty. And if they avoid that, it is better for them. God hears all and knows all.

61.Bakhtiari Nejad: There is no blame on the blind and no blame on the lame (crippled) and no blame on the sick and not on yourselves if you eat in your houses or your fathers’ houses or your mothers’ houses or your brothers’ houses or your sisters’ houses or your paternal uncles’ houses or your paternal aunts’ houses or your maternal uncles’ houses or your maternal aunts’ houses or whatever (houses that) you have its keys or (house of) your friend. There is no blame on you if you eat together or separately. So, when you enter any houses then greet each other, a blessed and pure greeting from God. That is how God clarifies the signs for you that you may understand.

62.Bakhtiari Nejad: The believers are only those who believe in God and His messenger, and when they are with him on a public matter, they do not go away until they ask his permission. Indeed, those who ask your permission, they are those who believe in God and His messenger. So, when they ask your permission for (taking care of) some of their affairs, then give permission to any one of them whom you want and ask God for their forgiveness. Indeed, God is forgiving and merciful

63.Bakhtiari Nejad: Do not consider the messenger’s call among you as a call from each other. God certainly knows those among you who slip away hiding (behind others). So, those who oppose His/his order should beware of a disaster happening to them or a painful punishment happening to them.

64.Bakhtiari Nejad: No doubt, everything in the skies and the earth belongs to God, He knows what you are up to it (and your intentions), and He will tell them of what they did on the day when they are returned to Him. God knows everything.

1.Bakhtiari Nejad: Blessed is the One Who sent down the criterion to His servant, to be a warning for humankind,

2.Bakhtiari Nejad: the One that the rule of the skies and the earth belongs to Him, and He did not take a child and there is no partner for Him in the rule and He created everything and determined its measure (and proportion).

3.Bakhtiari Nejad: And they took gods other than Him that do not create anything and they (themselves) are created, and they have no power to harm nor benefit themselves, and they have no power over death and life and resurrection.

4.Bakhtiari Nejad: And those who disbelieve say: “This (Quran) is only a lie that he has made up and other people have helped him with it.” They have certainly committed a wrongdoing and a lie.

5.Bakhtiari Nejad: And they say: “(These are) stories of the earlier ones that he has copied it and it is dictated to him morning and afternoon.”

6.Bakhtiari Nejad: Say: “The One Who knows the secret of the skies and the earth sent it down. Indeed, He is forgiving and merciful.”

7.Bakhtiari Nejad: And they say: “What is with this messenger that he eats food and he walks in the markets (and streets), why has an angel not sent down to him to be a warner with him,

8.Bakhtiari Nejad: or a treasure is not given to him, or there is no garden for him to eat from it?” And the wrongdoers say: “You are only following a bewitched man.”

9.Bakhtiari Nejad: See how they gave examples about you, they are lost and they cannot find a way.

10.Bakhtiari Nejad: Blessed is the One Who gives you better than that if He wants, gardens which rivers flow through them and He gives you palaces.

11.Bakhtiari Nejad: No, but they denied the Hour and We have prepared a burning fire for anyone who denies the Hour.

12.Bakhtiari Nejad: When it (hell) sees them from a far place, they hear it raging and roaring.

13.Bakhtiari Nejad: And when they are thrown into a tight place of it, chained together, there they call for death.

14.Bakhtiari Nejad: (They will be told:) “Today, do not call for death once but call for death many times.”

15.Bakhtiari Nejad: Say: “Is this better or the eternal garden that is promised to those who are cautious (of God)? It (the garden) is a reward and a destination for them.

16.Bakhtiari Nejad: They will have whatever they want in there, remaining forever. This is a promise that is your Lord’s responsibility.”

17.Bakhtiari Nejad: And the day when He gathers them and whatever they served besides God, and He will say: “Did you misguide My servants, these (people), or did they lose the way?”

18.Bakhtiari Nejad: They (those whom you serve besides God) will say: “You are flawless (glory to You), it is not appropriate for us to take any protectors other than You, but You gave them and their fathers joy (and comfort) until they forgot the reminder and they became doomed people.”

19.Bakhtiari Nejad: So, they (those whom you serve besides God) will deny you in what you say, therefore you will not be able to turn away (the punishment) or get any help. And whoever does wrong among you, We will make him taste a great punishment.

20.Bakhtiari Nejad: And We did not send any of the messengers before you unless they ate food and walked in the markets, and We have made some of you a test for the others, will you persevere? And your Lord sees all.

21.Bakhtiari Nejad: And those who do not expect to meet Us say: “Why have angels not been sent down to us, or why do we not see our Lord?” They are indeed arrogant about themselves, and they disobeyed, a great disobedience.

22.Bakhtiari Nejad: The day when they see the angels, there is no good news for the guilty ones on that day, and they (the angels) will say: “A forbidden ban (that you receive God's mercy).”

23.Bakhtiari Nejad: And We turn to whatever work they did, and We make it scattered dust.

24.Bakhtiari Nejad: On that day, inhabitants of the garden have a good place to stay and a better relaxing place.

25.Bakhtiari Nejad: The day when the sky with the clouds splits apart and the angels are sent down in a great descent,

26.Bakhtiari Nejad: on that day the true rule belongs to the beneficent, and it is a difficult day for the disbelievers.

27.Bakhtiari Nejad: And the day the wrongdoer bites his hands saying: “I wish I had taken the way along with the messenger,

28.Bakhtiari Nejad: woe to me, I wish I had not taken so and so as a friend,

29.Bakhtiari Nejad: he has certainly led me away from the reminder after it came to me, Satan is a deserter of the human being (as he declares himself clear of the human being).”

30.Bakhtiari Nejad: And the messenger says: “My Lord, indeed my people made this Quran abandoned.”

31.Bakhtiari Nejad: And like that, for every messenger We made an enemy from the guilty ones. And your Lord is enough as a guide and a helper.

32.Bakhtiari Nejad: And those who disbelieve say: “Why was not the Quran sent down to him all at once?” It is like that, so that We strengthen your heart with it, and We have recited it to you distinctly (slowly and thoughtfully).

33.Bakhtiari Nejad: And they do not give you an example (or question) unless We bring you the truth and the best explanation (of it).

34.Bakhtiari Nejad: Those who will be gathered on their faces into hell, they will be in the worst position and far lost from the (right) way.

35.Bakhtiari Nejad: And We have certainly given Moses the book and appointed his brother Aaron with him as his minister.

36.Bakhtiari Nejad: Then We said: “You both go to the people who denied Our signs.” Then We destroyed them, a total destruction.

37.Bakhtiari Nejad: And We drowned people of Noah when they denied the messengers and We made them a sign for the people, and We have prepared a painful punishment for the wrongdoers.

38.Bakhtiari Nejad: And (We also destroyed) Aad and Thamud and inhabitants of the Rass (the well) and many generations between them.

39.Bakhtiari Nejad: And to each one We gave examples (as warnings), and We destroyed them all, a total destruction.

40.Bakhtiari Nejad: And they have certainly come upon the town that the bad rain was rained on. Did they not use to see it? No, but they do not expect resurrection.

41.Bakhtiari Nejad: And when they see you, they only take you as a joke (saying:) “Is this the one whom God sent as a messenger?

42.Bakhtiari Nejad: He (Muhammad) almost led us away from our gods, if we had not persevered in them.” They will know who is more lost from the (right) way when they see the punishment.

43.Bakhtiari Nejad: Have you seen the one who has taken his desire as his god? Will you be his advocate?

44.Bakhtiari Nejad: Or do you think that most of them listen or understand? They are like animals. No, but they are more lost from the (right) way.

45.Bakhtiari Nejad: Do you not see how your Lord makes the shadow longer, and if He wanted, He would have made it stand still, and We made the sun its guide.

46.Bakhtiari Nejad: Then We pull it toward Ourselves, an easy pull.

47.Bakhtiari Nejad: And He is the One Who made the night a cover for you, and sleep as rest, and He made the day as a rising (and to work).

48.Bakhtiari Nejad: And He is the One Who sends the winds as good news before His mercy, and We send down pure water from the sky,

49.Bakhtiari Nejad: in order to bring the dead land back to life with it, and make Our creation of many livestock and human beings drink it.

50.Bakhtiari Nejad: And We have certainly explained it to them in various ways so that they may take notice, but most people refuse to be anything except ungrateful (and disbeliever).

51.Bakhtiari Nejad: And if We wanted, We would have raised a warner in every town.

52.Bakhtiari Nejad: So, do not obey the disbelievers, and try hard against them with it (Quran), a great try.

53.Bakhtiari Nejad: And He is the One Who merged the two seas, this one sweet and drinkable and that one salty and bitter, and He placed a boundary and a forbidden ban between them.

54.Bakhtiari Nejad: And He is the One Who created a human being from the water, then He made him blood relative and marriage relative. Your Lord is capable.

55.Bakhtiari Nejad: And they serve something besides God that does not benefit them and does not harm them, and the disbeliever is a supporter (of others) against his Lord.

56.Bakhtiari Nejad: We have sent you only as a giver of good news and a warner.

57.Bakhtiari Nejad: Say: “I do not ask you for any wage for it, except that someone may want to take a path to his Lord.”

58.Bakhtiari Nejad: And put your trust in the One Who lives and does not die, and glorify Him with His praise, and He is enough to be well informed about His servants' sins.

59.Bakhtiari Nejad: The One Who created the skies and the earth and whatever between them in six stages, then He reigned over the dominion, the beneficent. So, ask about Him from a well-informed one.

60.Bakhtiari Nejad: And when it is said to them: “Be humble before the beneficent” they say: “Who is the beneficent, should we be humble (and prostrate) to what you order us?” And it increases their disgust (and hatred).

61.Bakhtiari Nejad: Blessed is the One Who placed constellations in the sky and placed a lamp (the sun) and a shining moon in it.

62.Bakhtiari Nejad: And He is the One Who made the night and the day follow (each other), for anyone who wants to take notice or wants to be thankful.

63.Bakhtiari Nejad: And servants of the beneficent are those who walk on the earth modestly (and unselfishly), and when the ignorant ones talk to them, they say: “Peace (and well-being)”

64.Bakhtiari Nejad: and those who spend the nights prostrating (showing humbleness) and standing before their Lord,

65.Bakhtiari Nejad: and those who say: “Our Lord, turn the punishment of hell away from us, indeed its punishment is everlasting,

66.Bakhtiari Nejad: it is indeed a bad place of stay and a bad position”

67.Bakhtiari Nejad: and those who when they spend, they are not excessive and they are not stingy, and maintain a proper balance between that,

68.Bakhtiari Nejad: and those who do not call on any other god with God, and they do not kill anyone except justifiably (in due process of law) as God made (life) sacred, and do not commit adultery/fornication, anyone who does that faces the punishment (of his sins),

69.Bakhtiari Nejad: the punishment will be doubled for him on the Resurrection Day, and he remains in there forever disgraced,

70.Bakhtiari Nejad: except anyone who repents and believes and does good, then God changes their bad deeds into good, and God is forgiving and merciful,

71.Bakhtiari Nejad: and whoever repents and does good, indeed he turns to God, a true repentance,

72.Bakhtiari Nejad: and those who do not bear false witness and when they encounter useless (acts and talks) they pass by it honorably,

73.Bakhtiari Nejad: and those who when they are reminded of their Lord’s signs, they do not fall down on them deaf and blind (not listening and seeing the signs),

74.Bakhtiari Nejad: and those who say: “Our Lord, give us delight of the eyes (cheer us up) by our spouses and children, and make us leader of those who are cautious (of God).”

75.Bakhtiari Nejad: They will be rewarded with the chambers (in paradise), for they persevered, and they will be met with welcome and peace (and well-being) in it,

76.Bakhtiari Nejad: remaining in there forever. It is a good place of stay and a good position.

77.Bakhtiari Nejad: Say: “My Lord does not care about you if it was not for your calls. But you have certainly denied (the truth), so there will be an inevitable (punishment).”

1.Bakhtiari Nejad: T. S. M. (Ta. Sin. Mim.)

2.Bakhtiari Nejad: These are verses of the clear (and clarifying) book.

3.Bakhtiari Nejad: You may kill yourself with grief because they do not become believers.

4.Bakhtiari Nejad: If We want, We send down a sign to them from the sky so their necks bend in humility before it.

5.Bakhtiari Nejad: Whenever a new reminder comes to them from the beneficent, they turn away from it.

6.Bakhtiari Nejad: They have denied, so the news of what they used to ridicule is going to come to them.
