7.Bakhtiari Nejad: Or have they not looked at the earth (to see) how many of every kind of splendid plants We grew in it?

8.Bakhtiari Nejad: Indeed, there is a sign in that, and most of them are not believers.

9.Bakhtiari Nejad: And indeed your Lord, He is the powerful and the merciful.

10.Bakhtiari Nejad: And (remember) when your Lord called Moses: “Go to the wrongdoing people,

11.Bakhtiari Nejad: people of Pharaoh, (and ask) why are you not cautious (of God)?”

12.Bakhtiari Nejad: He said: “My Lord, I am afraid that they deny me,

13.Bakhtiari Nejad: and my chest tightens (or I get upset) and my tongue stutters, so send (this message) to Aaron,

14.Bakhtiari Nejad: and they have a charge against me, so I am afraid that they will kill me.”

15.Bakhtiari Nejad: He (God) said: “No way, you two go with Our signs, We are with you, listening,

16.Bakhtiari Nejad: so, you two go to Pharaoh and say: “Indeed we are messengers of the Lord of humankind,

17.Bakhtiari Nejad: send the children of Israel with us.””

18.Bakhtiari Nejad: He (Pharaoh) said: “Did we not bring you up among us as a child, and you stayed among us for years of your life?

19.Bakhtiari Nejad: And you did your deed that you did (and committed murder), and you are of the ungrateful ones.”

20.Bakhtiari Nejad: He (Moses) said: “I did it while I was of the misguided,

21.Bakhtiari Nejad: then I ran away from you because I was afraid of you, then my Lord gave me wisdom and made me of the messengers.

22.Bakhtiari Nejad: And that is a favor that you tell me off about it, that you enslaved children of Israel (and you did not enslave or kill me)?”

23.Bakhtiari Nejad: Pharaoh said: “And what is the Lord of humankind?”

24.Bakhtiari Nejad: He (Moses) said: “The Lord of the skies and the earth and whatever between them, if you are sure.”

25.Bakhtiari Nejad: He said to those around him: “Do you not hear (what he is saying)?”

26.Bakhtiari Nejad: He (Moses) said: “Your Lord and the Lord of your forefathers.”

27.Bakhtiari Nejad: He said (to the others): “Your messenger, the one who was sent to you is certainly crazy.”

28.Bakhtiari Nejad: He (Moses) said: “The Lord of the east and the west and whatever between them, if you understand.”

29.Bakhtiari Nejad: He said: “If you take any god other than me, I shall make you of the prisoners.”

30.Bakhtiari Nejad: He (Moses) said: “Even if I bring you something obvious (and clarifying)?”

31.Bakhtiari Nejad: He said: “Then bring it, if you are of the truthful ones.”

32.Bakhtiari Nejad: So, he threw his cane and it immediately became a visible serpent.

33.Bakhtiari Nejad: And he took out his hand, and it was white to the viewers.

34.Bakhtiari Nejad: He said to the assembly around him: “Indeed this is a knowledgeable (and skillful) magician.

35.Bakhtiari Nejad: He wants to drive you out of your land with his magic, so what do you instruct?”

36.Bakhtiari Nejad: They said: “Put him and his brother off (for a while) and send gatherers to the cities

37.Bakhtiari Nejad: to bring you every skillful magician.”

38.Bakhtiari Nejad: So, the magicians were collected for an appointment on a known day.

39.Bakhtiari Nejad: And people were told: “Would you come together?

40.Bakhtiari Nejad: That we may follow the magicians if they are the winners.”

41.Bakhtiari Nejad: So, when the magicians came, they said to Pharaoh: “Is there a reward for us if we are the winners?”

42.Bakhtiari Nejad: He said: “Yes, then you will certainly be among the close ones.”

43.Bakhtiari Nejad: Moses said to them: “Throw what you are going to throw.”

44.Bakhtiari Nejad: So, they threw their ropes and their canes and they said: “By Pharaoh’s power, we shall be the winners.”

45.Bakhtiari Nejad: Then Moses threw his cane, and it immediately swallowed whatever they had faked.

46.Bakhtiari Nejad: So, the magicians fell, prostrating (and showing humbleness).

47.Bakhtiari Nejad: They said: “We believe in the Lord of humankind,

48.Bakhtiari Nejad: Lord of Moses and Aaron.”

49.Bakhtiari Nejad: He (Pharaoh) said: “Did you believe in him before I give you permission? He is certainly your superior, the one who taught you the magic, and you will certainly know that I shall cut off your hands and feet on opposite sides, and I shall crucify you all.”

50.Bakhtiari Nejad: They said: “No problem, indeed we are returners to our Lord.

51.Bakhtiari Nejad: Indeed, we hope that our Lord will forgive us our mistakes because we are the first of the believers.”

52.Bakhtiari Nejad: And We revealed to Moses: “Travel with My servants by night, indeed you will be followed.”

53.Bakhtiari Nejad: So, Pharaoh sent gatherers to the cities,

54.Bakhtiari Nejad: (saying:) “Indeed these are a small group,

55.Bakhtiari Nejad: and they have certainly angered us

56.Bakhtiari Nejad: and we are all certainly alert (and ready).”

57.Bakhtiari Nejad: So, We drove them out of gardens and springs,

58.Bakhtiari Nejad: and treasures and honorable position.

59.Bakhtiari Nejad: That is how it was, and We left them as inheritance for children of Israel.

60.Bakhtiari Nejad: So, they (Pharaoh’s army) followed them at sunrise.

61.Bakhtiari Nejad: So, when the two crowds saw each other, companions of Moses said: “We shall be caught.”

62.Bakhtiari Nejad: He (Moses) said: “No way, indeed my Lord is with me, He is going to guide me.”

63.Bakhtiari Nejad: And We revealed to Moses: “Strike the sea with your cane.” So, it opened up, and each side became like a great mountain.

64.Bakhtiari Nejad: And We brought the others (Pharaoh’s army) near there.

65.Bakhtiari Nejad: And We saved Moses and those with him altogether.

66.Bakhtiari Nejad: Then We drowned the others.

67.Bakhtiari Nejad: Indeed, there is a sign in that, and most of them are not believers.

68.Bakhtiari Nejad: And indeed, your Lord is the powerful and the merciful.

69.Bakhtiari Nejad: And read Abraham’s story to them.

70.Bakhtiari Nejad: When he said to his father and his people: “What do you serve?”

71.Bakhtiari Nejad: They said: “We serve idols, and we continue to be devoted to them.”

72.Bakhtiari Nejad: He said: “Do they hear you when you call on them?

73.Bakhtiari Nejad: Or do they benefit you or harm you?”

74.Bakhtiari Nejad: They said: “No, but we found our fathers doing like this.”

75.Bakhtiari Nejad: He said: “Have you thought about what you have been serving,

76.Bakhtiari Nejad: you and your forefathers?

77.Bakhtiari Nejad: Indeed, they are my enemies, except the Lord of humankind,

78.Bakhtiari Nejad: the One Who created me, and He guides me,

79.Bakhtiari Nejad: and the One Who gives me food and gives me drink,

80.Bakhtiari Nejad: and when I get sick, He heals me,

81.Bakhtiari Nejad: and the One Who makes me die, then He makes me alive,

82.Bakhtiari Nejad: and the One Who I hope will forgive my mistakes on the Judgment Day.

83.Bakhtiari Nejad: My Lord, give me wisdom and join me with the righteous,

84.Bakhtiari Nejad: and give me a good name on the tongue of the later ones (and future generations),

85.Bakhtiari Nejad: and make me among inheritors of garden of the delight,

86.Bakhtiari Nejad: and forgive my father, indeed he is of the misguided

87.Bakhtiari Nejad: and do not humiliate me on the day they are raised,

88.Bakhtiari Nejad: the day when wealth and children have no benefit,

89.Bakhtiari Nejad: except anyone who brings a sound (and pure) heart to God.”

90.Bakhtiari Nejad: And (on that day) the garden is brought near for those who are cautious (of God),

91.Bakhtiari Nejad: and the hellfire is made apparent to the misled ones.

92.Bakhtiari Nejad: And it is said to them: “Where are what you were serving

93.Bakhtiari Nejad: besides God? Can they help you or help themselves?”

94.Bakhtiari Nejad: So, they and the misled ones are thrown headfirst into it (hellfire)

95.Bakhtiari Nejad: and troops of Iblis (Satan), altogether.

96.Bakhtiari Nejad: And while they dispute about it, they say:

97.Bakhtiari Nejad: “By God, we were in an obvious error,

98.Bakhtiari Nejad: when we made you equal to the Lord of humankind.

99.Bakhtiari Nejad: And no one misguided us except the guilty ones.

100.Bakhtiari Nejad: So, we do not have any mediators

102.Bakhtiari Nejad: And if there was a return for us (to live again), then we would become of the believers.”

103.Bakhtiari Nejad: Indeed, there is a sign in that, and most of them are not believers.

104.Bakhtiari Nejad: And indeed, your Lord is the powerful and the merciful.

105.Bakhtiari Nejad: People of Noah denied the messengers.

106.Bakhtiari Nejad: When their brother Noah said to them: “Why won’t you be cautious (of God)?

107.Bakhtiari Nejad: I am an honest messenger for you.

108.Bakhtiari Nejad: So, be cautious of God and obey me.

109.Bakhtiari Nejad: And I do not ask you for any wage, for my wage is only responsibility of the Lord of humankind.

110.Bakhtiari Nejad: So, be cautious of God and obey me.”

111.Bakhtiari Nejad: They said: “Should we believe in you while the meanest (and the worst) follow you?”

112.Bakhtiari Nejad: He said: “I have no knowledge of what they used to do.

113.Bakhtiari Nejad: Their account is only upon my Lord, if you realize.

114.Bakhtiari Nejad: And I do not drive away the believers.

115.Bakhtiari Nejad: I am only a clear warner.”

116.Bakhtiari Nejad: They said: “Noah, if you do not stop, you shall become among the stoned ones.”

117.Bakhtiari Nejad: He said: “My Lord, indeed my people have denied me,

118.Bakhtiari Nejad: so, judge decisively (or open a space) between me and them, and save me and anyone who is with me of the believers.”

119.Bakhtiari Nejad: So, We saved him and anyone with him in the loaded Ark,

121.Bakhtiari Nejad: Indeed, there is a sign in that, and most of them are not believers.

122.Bakhtiari Nejad: And your Lord is certainly powerful and merciful.

124.Bakhtiari Nejad: when their brother Hud said to them: “Why won’t you be cautious (of God)?

125.Bakhtiari Nejad: I am an honest messenger for you.

126.Bakhtiari Nejad: So, be cautious of God and obey me.

127.Bakhtiari Nejad: And I do not ask you for any wage, for my wage is only responsibility of the Lord of humankind.

128.Bakhtiari Nejad: Do you build a sign on every high place to fool around?

129.Bakhtiari Nejad: And you take up castles that you may live forever?

130.Bakhtiari Nejad: And when you attack, you attack as tyrants?

131.Bakhtiari Nejad: So, be cautious of God and obey me.

132.Bakhtiari Nejad: And be cautious of the One Who helped you with what you know.

133.Bakhtiari Nejad: He helped you with livestock and children

135.Bakhtiari Nejad: Indeed, I am afraid of the punishment of a great day upon you.”

136.Bakhtiari Nejad: They said: “It is the same to us whether you advise or are not of the advisers,

137.Bakhtiari Nejad: this is only the character (way of life) of the earlier ones,

138.Bakhtiari Nejad: and we will not be punished.”

139.Bakhtiari Nejad: So, they denied him, then We destroyed them. Indeed, there is a sign in that, and most of them are not believers.

140.Bakhtiari Nejad: And indeed, your Lord is the powerful and the merciful.

142.Bakhtiari Nejad: when their brother Salih said to them: “Why won’t you be cautious (of God)?

143.Bakhtiari Nejad: I am an honest messenger for you.

144.Bakhtiari Nejad: So, be cautious of God and obey me.

145.Bakhtiari Nejad: And I do not ask you for any wage, for my wage is only responsibility of the Lord of humankind.

146.Bakhtiari Nejad: Would you be left safe (and secure) in what is here?

148.Bakhtiari Nejad: and plantations and date palms with their ripe (and delicious) fruit clusters

149.Bakhtiari Nejad: and houses you skillfully carve out of the mountains.

150.Bakhtiari Nejad: So, be cautious of God and obey me,

151.Bakhtiari Nejad: and do not obey the order of the excessive ones,

152.Bakhtiari Nejad: those who commit corruption on the earth and do not reform.”

153.Bakhtiari Nejad: They said: “You are only of the bewitched ones,

154.Bakhtiari Nejad: you are only a human being like us, so bring a miracle if you are of the truthful ones.”

155.Bakhtiari Nejad: He said: “This is a (female) camel, she has (a portion of) drink, and you have your (portion of) drink, on a specific day.

156.Bakhtiari Nejad: And do not touch her with harm otherwise the punishment of a great day will take you.”

157.Bakhtiari Nejad: So, they killed her, then they became regretful.

158.Bakhtiari Nejad: Then the punishment took them. Indeed, there is a sign in that, and most of them are not believers.

159.Bakhtiari Nejad: And indeed, your Lord is the powerful and the merciful.

160.Bakhtiari Nejad: People of Lot denied the messengers,

161.Bakhtiari Nejad: when their brother Lot said to them: “Why won’t you be cautious (of God)?

162.Bakhtiari Nejad: I am an honest messenger for you.

163.Bakhtiari Nejad: So, be cautious of God and obey me.

164.Bakhtiari Nejad: And I do not ask you for any wage, for my wage is only responsibility of the Lord of humankind.

165.Bakhtiari Nejad: Do you approach the males among humankind,

166.Bakhtiari Nejad: and you leave what your Lord created for you as your wives? No, but you are people who exceed the limits.”

167.Bakhtiari Nejad: They said: “Lot, if you do not stop, you shall be of those driven out.”

168.Bakhtiari Nejad: He said: “Indeed I am of those who despise your action.

169.Bakhtiari Nejad: My Lord, save me and my family from what they do.”

170.Bakhtiari Nejad: So, We saved him and his family altogether,

171.Bakhtiari Nejad: except an old woman (his wife who was) among those staying behind,

173.Bakhtiari Nejad: And We poured down a rain on them, and it was an awful rain on those who were warned.

174.Bakhtiari Nejad: Indeed, there is a sign in that, and most of them are not believers.

175.Bakhtiari Nejad: And indeed, your Lord is the powerful and the merciful.

176.Bakhtiari Nejad: The inhabitants of the woods (people of Midian) denied the messengers,

177.Bakhtiari Nejad: when Shu'aib (Jethro) said to them: “Why won’t you be cautious (of God)?

178.Bakhtiari Nejad: I am an honest messenger for you.

179.Bakhtiari Nejad: So, be cautious of God and obey me.

180.Bakhtiari Nejad: And I do not ask you for any wage, for my wage is only responsibility of the Lord of humankind.

181.Bakhtiari Nejad: Give the full measure, and do not be of those who give less (than due),

183.Bakhtiari Nejad: and do not shortchange people their things and do not do mischief on the earth as corruptors.

184.Bakhtiari Nejad: And be cautious of the One Who created you and the earlier generations.”

185.Bakhtiari Nejad: They said: “Indeed you are of the bewitched ones,

186.Bakhtiari Nejad: you are only a human being like us, and we think you are among the liars.

187.Bakhtiari Nejad: So, make pieces of the sky fall on us, if you are of the truthful ones.”

188.Bakhtiari Nejad: He said: “My Lord knows best what you do.”

189.Bakhtiari Nejad: So, they denied him, then the punishment of a cloudy day (of fire) took them. Indeed, it was the punishment of a great day.

190.Bakhtiari Nejad: Indeed, there is a sign in that, and most of them are not believers.

191.Bakhtiari Nejad: And indeed, your Lord is the powerful and the merciful.

192.Bakhtiari Nejad: And it (Quran) is certainly a revelation by the Lord of humankind.

193.Bakhtiari Nejad: The honest spirit (Gabriel) came down with it

194.Bakhtiari Nejad: to your heart so that you be of the warners,

196.Bakhtiari Nejad: And indeed, it is in the scriptures of the earlier ones.

197.Bakhtiari Nejad: Is it not a sign for them that the knowledgeable children of Israel know it?

198.Bakhtiari Nejad: And if We had sent it down to someone of the non-Arabs,

199.Bakhtiari Nejad: and he had read it to them, they would not have been believers in it.

200.Bakhtiari Nejad: That is how We insert/pass it through the hearts of the guilty ones,

201.Bakhtiari Nejad: they would not believe in it until they see the painful punishment.

202.Bakhtiari Nejad: And it comes to them suddenly while they do not realize.

203.Bakhtiari Nejad: Then they say: “May we be given a delay?”

204.Bakhtiari Nejad: Do they still want to rush Our punishment?

205.Bakhtiari Nejad: Have you considered that if We make them enjoy for some years,

206.Bakhtiari Nejad: then what they were promised (the punishment) comes to them,

207.Bakhtiari Nejad: what they were made to enjoy will not be of any use to them?

208.Bakhtiari Nejad: We did not destroy any town (or population) unless there were warners for it

209.Bakhtiari Nejad: to remind, and We were not unjust.

210.Bakhtiari Nejad: And the devils did not come down with it (Quran).

211.Bakhtiari Nejad: It is not appropriate for them, and they cannot.

212.Bakhtiari Nejad: Indeed, they are blocked from hearing (it).

213.Bakhtiari Nejad: So (Muhammad,) do not call on another god with God, otherwise you become of the punished ones.

215.Bakhtiari Nejad: and lower your wing (and be nice) for anyone who follows you among the believers.

216.Bakhtiari Nejad: And if they disobey you, then say: “I am clear of what you do.”

217.Bakhtiari Nejad: And put your trust in the powerful, the merciful.

218.Bakhtiari Nejad: The One Who sees you when you stand (for prayer)

219.Bakhtiari Nejad: and your movement among those who prostrate (and show humbleness).

220.Bakhtiari Nejad: Indeed, He hears all and knows all.

221.Bakhtiari Nejad: Should I inform you of whom the devils come down on?

222.Bakhtiari Nejad: They come down on every lying sinner,

223.Bakhtiari Nejad: who gives ear (and listens to the devils), and most of them are liars.

224.Bakhtiari Nejad: And the poets, the misled ones (those who lost the right way) follow them.

225.Bakhtiari Nejad: Have you not seen that they drift into every valley (and subject),

226.Bakhtiari Nejad: and they say what they do not do?

227.Bakhtiari Nejad: Except those (poets) who believe and do good and often remember God and help/defend themselves after they are wronged. And those who do wrong are going to know to what return they will return.

1.Bakhtiari Nejad: T. S. (Ta. Sin.) These are verses of the Quran, a clear (and clarifying) book,

2.Bakhtiari Nejad: a guide and good news for the believers,

3.Bakhtiari Nejad: those who perform mandatory prayer and give to mandatory charity and they are certain of the Hereafter.

4.Bakhtiari Nejad: Indeed, those who do not believe in the Hereafter, We beautified their works for them, so they are blindly wandering.

5.Bakhtiari Nejad: They are those who will have the bad punishment and they are the worst losers in the Hereafter.

6.Bakhtiari Nejad: And you certainly receive the Quran from (the One Who is) wise and knowledgeable.

7.Bakhtiari Nejad: (Remember) when Moses said to his family: “I noticed a fire, I am going to bring some news from it, or I bring a burning stick of it so that you may warm yourselves.”

8.Bakhtiari Nejad: So, when he got to it, he was called: “Blessed is He who is in the fire and anyone around it, and glory to God, the Lord of humankind,

9.Bakhtiari Nejad: Moses, indeed it is I, God, the powerful, the wise.

10.Bakhtiari Nejad: Throw down your cane.” So, when he saw it wiggling as if it was a serpent, he turned back running away and he did not look back. (He was told:) “Moses, do not be afraid, indeed the messengers are not afraid before Me,

11.Bakhtiari Nejad: and neither is anyone who did wrong then he changed to goodness after badness, as indeed I am forgiving and merciful.

12.Bakhtiari Nejad: And put your hand into the opening of your shirt, it comes out white without any disease, these are among nine miracles for Pharaoh and his people. Indeed, they are disobedient people.”

13.Bakhtiari Nejad: So, when Our eye-opening miracles came to them, they said: “This is an obvious magic.”

14.Bakhtiari Nejad: And they rejected it wrongfully and arrogantly while their souls were certain of it. So, see what the end of the corruptors was.

15.Bakhtiari Nejad: And We certainly gave David and Solomon knowledge, and they both said: “All praise belongs to God, the One Who preferred us over many of His believing servants.”

16.Bakhtiari Nejad: And Solomon inherited from David, and he said: “People, we were taught the language of the birds, and were given from everything. Indeed, this is the obvious grace.”

17.Bakhtiari Nejad: And his troops of Jinn and humans and the birds were gathered before Solomon, and they were set in rows.

18.Bakhtiari Nejad: Until when they came to the valley of the ants. An ant said: “Ants, get into your nests, so Solomon and his troops do not crush you while they do not realize.”

19.Bakhtiari Nejad: So, he smiled, laughing from her word and said: “My Lord, enable me to thank for Your favor that You favored upon me and upon my parents, and to do good to please You, and admit me among Your righteous servants by Your mercy.”

20.Bakhtiari Nejad: And he inspected the birds, then he said: “What is with me that I do not see the hoopoe, is he absent?

21.Bakhtiari Nejad: I shall punish him, a severe punishment, or I shall slaughter him unless he brings me a clear reason.”

22.Bakhtiari Nejad: So, he (the hoopoe) stayed (away) not too long, then he said: “I found out what you did not know it, and I brought you confirmed news from Sheba.

23.Bakhtiari Nejad: I found that a woman rules them, and she was given from everything and she has a great throne.

24.Bakhtiari Nejad: I found her and her people prostrate (and show humbleness) to the sun instead of God, and Satan beautified their deeds for them, and kept them away from the (right) way, so they are not guided,

25.Bakhtiari Nejad: so, they do not prostrate before God, the One Who brings out the hidden things in the skies and the earth, and He knows what you hide and what you disclose.

26.Bakhtiari Nejad: God, there is no god except Him, the Lord of the great dominion.”

27.Bakhtiari Nejad: He (Solomon) said: “We will see if you told the truth or you are of the liars,

28.Bakhtiari Nejad: go with this letter of mine and deliver it to them, then leave them and see what they return (as answer).”

29.Bakhtiari Nejad: She (the queen of Sheba) said: “Counselors, indeed an honorable letter was delivered to me.

30.Bakhtiari Nejad: It is from Solomon, and it (reads:) “In the name of God, the Beneficent, the Merciful,

31.Bakhtiari Nejad: do not be arrogant against me, and come to me surrendered.””

32.Bakhtiari Nejad: She said: “Counselors, advise me in my affair, for I am not to decide on any matter until you are present (and bear witness).”

33.Bakhtiari Nejad: They said: “We have power and we have great fighting (capabilities), but the command is yours, so see what you command.”

34.Bakhtiari Nejad: She said: “Indeed when the kings enter any town, they ruin it, and they make its most powerful (and respected) people most humiliated, and that is what they do.

35.Bakhtiari Nejad: I am going to send them a gift and see what the messengers return with.”

36.Bakhtiari Nejad: So, when he came to Solomon, he (Solomon) said: “Do you help me with wealth? What God has given me is better than what He gave you, yet you are happy about your gift!

37.Bakhtiari Nejad: Return to them, for we shall come to them with troops that they have no power to face it, and we shall drive them out of there in humiliation while they are subdued.”

38.Bakhtiari Nejad: He said: “Counselors, which one of you brings me her throne before they come to me surrendered?”

39.Bakhtiari Nejad: A cunning Jinn said: “I bring it to you before you get up from your place, and I am certainly strong and honest for it.”

40.Bakhtiari Nejad: Someone who had knowledge of the book said: “I bring it to you before you blink.” So, when he saw it placed before him, he said: “This is from my Lord's grace in order to test me whether I am grateful or ungrateful, and whoever is grateful then he is only grateful for himself, and whoever is ungrateful then indeed my Lord is rich (without need) and noble.”

41.Bakhtiari Nejad: He said: “Disguise her throne for her, so we see if she discovers it, or she is one of those who do not discover.”

42.Bakhtiari Nejad: So, when she came, she was told: “Is your throne like this?” She said: “It is like that, and we were given knowledge before that, and we were surrendered.”

43.Bakhtiari Nejad: And what she used to serve besides God held her off (from the truth). Indeed, she was one of the disbelieving people.

44.Bakhtiari Nejad: She was told: “Enter the palace.” So, when she saw it, she thought it was deep water and she exposed her legs (by pulling up her dress). He said: “It is a palace paved with glasses/crystals.” She said: “My Lord, indeed I did wrong to myself, and I submit with Solomon to God, the Lord of humankind.”

45.Bakhtiari Nejad: And we certainly sent their brother Salih to Thamud (saying:) “Serve God.” Then all of a sudden, they were two groups disputing (with each other).

46.Bakhtiari Nejad: He said: “My people, why do you rush to badness before goodness, why do you not ask forgiveness from God, so that you may receive mercy?”

47.Bakhtiari Nejad: They said: “We consider you and anyone with you as bad omen.” He said: “Your bad omen is from God, but you are a (group of) people being tested.”

48.Bakhtiari Nejad: And they were nine heads of families in the city committing corruption in the land, and would not reform.

49.Bakhtiari Nejad: They said: “(Let us) swear by God that we shall attack (and kill) him and his family at night, then we shall say to his heirs (and friends) that we were not present at the killing of his family, and we are certainly truthful.”

50.Bakhtiari Nejad: They plotted a plot, and We devised a plan, and they do not realize.

51.Bakhtiari Nejad: So, see what the end of their plot was, We destroyed them and their people altogether.

52.Bakhtiari Nejad: These are their houses, fallen down (and ruined) because of what they did wrong. Indeed, there is a sign in that for people who know.

53.Bakhtiari Nejad: And We saved those who believed and were cautious (of God).

54.Bakhtiari Nejad: And (remember) Lot when he said to his people: “Do you commit the indecency while you see (and notice your bad deed)?

55.Bakhtiari Nejad: Do you approach men lustfully instead of women? You are ignorant people.”

56.Bakhtiari Nejad: And the answer of his people was only to say: “Drive Lot’s family out of your town, they are people who pretend to be (or want to remain) pure.”

57.Bakhtiari Nejad: So, We saved him and his family except his wife, whom We destined her among those staying behind.

58.Bakhtiari Nejad: And We poured down a rain (of stone) on them, and it was an awful rain on those who were warned.

59.Bakhtiari Nejad: Say: “All praise belongs to God, and peace (and well-being) upon His servants whom He has chosen. Is God better or what you associate (with Him)?”

60.Bakhtiari Nejad: Or who has created the skies and the earth and sent down rain for you from the sky? So, We grew beautiful (and delightful) gardens with it that you could not grow their trees. Is there a god with God? No, but they are people who set up equals (for God).

61.Bakhtiari Nejad: Or who has made the earth a habitat and placed rivers through it and placed mountains for it and placed a barrier between the two seas? Is there a god with God? No, but most of them do not know.

62.Bakhtiari Nejad: Or who answers the distressed when he prays to Him, and He removes badness and makes you successors (inheritors) on the earth? Is there a god with God? You take little notice.

63.Bakhtiari Nejad: Or who guides you in darkness of the land and the sea and who sends the winds as good news before His mercy? Is there a god with God? God is above what they associate (with Him).

64.Bakhtiari Nejad: Or who has started the creation then brings it back and provides for you from the sky and the earth? Is there a god with God? Say: “Bring your proof if you are truthful.”

65.Bakhtiari Nejad: Say: “No one in the skies and on the earth knows the unseen except God, and they do not realize when they will be raised.”

66.Bakhtiari Nejad: No, but their knowledge falls short about the Hereafter, rather they are in doubt about it, or they are blind about it.

67.Bakhtiari Nejad: And those who disbelieve say: “Are we brought out when we and our fathers have become dust?

68.Bakhtiari Nejad: We and our fathers have certainly been promised this in the past. This is only stories of the earlier ones.”

69.Bakhtiari Nejad: Say: “Travel throughout the earth and see what the end of the guilty ones was.”

70.Bakhtiari Nejad: And do not be sad about them, and do not be troubled from what they plot.

71.Bakhtiari Nejad: And they say: “When is this promise if you are truthful?”

72.Bakhtiari Nejad: Say: “Perhaps, some of what you want to be rushed is right behind you.”

73.Bakhtiari Nejad: And indeed, your Lord is graceful to the people, but most of them do not give thanks.

74.Bakhtiari Nejad: And indeed, your Lord knows what their chests/minds hide and what they disclose,

75.Bakhtiari Nejad: and there is nothing hidden in the skies and on the earth unless it is in a clear book.

76.Bakhtiari Nejad: Indeed, this Quran tells the children of Israel most of what they disagree about.

77.Bakhtiari Nejad: And indeed, it is a guide and a mercy for the believers.

78.Bakhtiari Nejad: Your Lord judges between them with His judgment, and He is the powerful and the knowledgeable.

79.Bakhtiari Nejad: So, put your trust in God, indeed you are on the clear truth.

80.Bakhtiari Nejad: Indeed, you cannot make the dead hear, or make the deaf hear the call when they turn back going away.

81.Bakhtiari Nejad: And you are not a guide to the blind (who does not want to see the truth) about their error. You can only make those listen who believe in Our signs and they are submitted.

82.Bakhtiari Nejad: And when the word (of punishment) happens to them, We bring out a creature from the earth for them, telling them that people were not sure of Our signs.

83.Bakhtiari Nejad: And on the day when We gather from every community a group of those who denied Our signs, and they are set in rows.

84.Bakhtiari Nejad: Until when they come (for judgment), He says: “Did you deny My signs while you did not fully understand them by (your) knowledge, what were you doing?”

85.Bakhtiari Nejad: And the word (of punishment) will happen to them because of what they did wrong, and they will not speak (a word).

86.Bakhtiari Nejad: Did they not see that We made the night in order to rest in it, and the day to see. There are certainly signs in that for people who believe.

87.Bakhtiari Nejad: And on the day the horn is blown, everyone in the skies and everyone on the earth are scared except those whom God wants, and they all come to Him humbled.

88.Bakhtiari Nejad: And you see the mountains, thinking they are motionless while they move as the clouds move. God’s making, the One Who made everything perfect. Indeed, He is well aware of what you do.

89.Bakhtiari Nejad: Anyone who comes with good (deeds), then there is better than that for him, and they are safe from fear on that day.

90.Bakhtiari Nejad: And anyone who comes with bad (deeds), then he is thrown down into the fire on their faces, (and they are told:) “Are you being paid back (for anything) except for what you used to do?”

91.Bakhtiari Nejad: I am ordered to only serve the Lord of this land, the One Who made it sacred, and everything belongs to Him, and I am ordered to be of the submitted ones,

92.Bakhtiari Nejad: and to read the Quran. So, anyone who is guided (to the right path), then he is only guided for himself, and anyone who loses the way then say: “I am only of the warners.”

93.Bakhtiari Nejad: And say: “All praise belongs to God, He is going to show you His signs, so you recognize them, and your Lord is not unaware of what you do.”

1.Bakhtiari Nejad: T. S. M. (Ta. Sin. Mim.)

2.Bakhtiari Nejad: These are the verses of the clear (and clarifying) book.

3.Bakhtiari Nejad: We read to you of the true story of Moses and Pharaoh, for people who believe.

4.Bakhtiari Nejad: Indeed, Pharaoh was high (and mighty) in the land and made his people into sects, weakening a group of them (children of Israel), killing their sons and keeping their women alive. Indeed, he was of the corruptors.

5.Bakhtiari Nejad: And We wanted to do a favor to those who were weak in the land and to make them leaders and to make them the inheritors (of Pharaoh’s power),

6.Bakhtiari Nejad: and to establish them (and give them power) in the land and to show Pharaoh and Haman and their troops what they used to fear.

7.Bakhtiari Nejad: And We revealed to Moses’ mother to nurse him, and when you are afraid for him then throw him in the sea/river and do not be afraid and do not be sad, We bring him back to you and We make him one of the messengers.

8.Bakhtiari Nejad: Then Pharaoh’s family picked him up, so that he would be an enemy and a sorrow for them. Indeed, Pharaoh and Haman and their troops were sinners.

9.Bakhtiari Nejad: And Pharaoh’s wife said: “(He is) joy of the eye for me and for you, do not kill him, perhaps he benefits us, or we take him as a son” and they did not realize (what they were doing).

10.Bakhtiari Nejad: And the heart of Moses’ mother became empty (of grief or patience). She almost exposed him if We had not strengthened her heart in order to be of the believers.

11.Bakhtiari Nejad: And she said to his sister: “Follow him.” So, she watched him from a distance, while they did not realize.

12.Bakhtiari Nejad: And We had previously forbidden the nursing mothers to him, so she (Moses’ sister) said to them: “Should I show you a household to take care of him for you and they are well-wishers for him.”

13.Bakhtiari Nejad: So, We gave him back to his mother to delight her and she would not be sad and so that she knows that God's promise is true, but most of them do not know.

14.Bakhtiari Nejad: And when he reached his maturity and he settled, We gave him wisdom and knowledge. And that is how We reward the good doers.

15.Bakhtiari Nejad: And he entered the city when its people were unaware, then he found two men fighting in there, one from his own sect (children of Israel), and one from his enemy (Egyptian). Then the one from his sect asked for his help against the one from his enemy. So, Moses punched him and killed him. He said: “This was Satan's work; indeed he is obviously a misguiding enemy.”

16.Bakhtiari Nejad: He said: “My Lord, indeed I did wrong to myself, so forgive me.” So, He forgave him. Indeed, He is the forgiving, the merciful.

17.Bakhtiari Nejad: He said: “My Lord, because of what You favored upon me, I will never be a supporter of the guilty ones.”

18.Bakhtiari Nejad: So, he was in the city in the morning, afraid and watchful, then all of a sudden the one who asked for his help yesterday cried out for his help (again). Moses told him: “Indeed you are clearly a troublemaker.”

19.Bakhtiari Nejad: So, when he wanted to attack the one who was enemy of both of them, he said: “Moses, do you want to kill me as you killed a person yesterday? You only want to be a bully on the land, and you do not want to be of those who do what is right.”

20.Bakhtiari Nejad: And a man came to him rushing from the far side of the city, saying: “Moses, indeed the assembly men are conspiring against you to kill you, so get out (immediately), indeed I am of the well-wishers for you.”

21.Bakhtiari Nejad: So, he went out of it, afraid and watchful. He said: “My Lord, save me from the wrongdoing people.”

22.Bakhtiari Nejad: And when he headed toward Midian, he said: “Perhaps my Lord guides me to the right way.”

23.Bakhtiari Nejad: And when he reached Midian’s water, he found a group of people watering (their animals) from it, and he found two women holding back (their animals) away from them. He said: “What do you want?” They said: “We cannot water (our animals) until the shepherds drive (their animals) away, and our father (Shu’aib/Jethro) is a very old man.”

24.Bakhtiari Nejad: So, he watered (their animals) for them, then he went back to the shade and said: “My Lord, indeed I am in need of anything good you send down to me.”

25.Bakhtiari Nejad: Then one of the two women came to him walking bashfully, and said: “My father invites you to pay your wage for watering for us.” So, when he came up to him and told him the story, he said: “Do not be afraid, you are safe from the wrongdoing people.”

26.Bakhtiari Nejad: One of the two women said: “My father, hire him, indeed the best one to hire is the strong and the honest one.”

27.Bakhtiari Nejad: He said: “I want to marry off one of my two daughters to you, on condition that you work for me eight years, and if you complete ten, it is of your own choice, and I do not want to make it difficult for you, God willing, you are going to find me of the righteous.”

28.Bakhtiari Nejad: He (Moses) said: “This is (an agreement) between me and you, whichever of the two periods I complete, there should be no hostility against me, and God is the trustee over what we say.”

29.Bakhtiari Nejad: So, when Moses completed the term and was traveling with his family, he noticed a fire from the side of the mountain (Mount Sinai). He said to his family: “Wait, I noticed a fire, maybe I can bring some news from it, or a piece of fire so you may warm yourselves.”

30.Bakhtiari Nejad: So, when he came up to it, he was called from the tree in a blessed spot on the right side of the valley: “Moses, indeed I am God, the Lord of humankind,

31.Bakhtiari Nejad: throw down your cane.” So, when he saw it moving as if it was a serpent, he turned back running away and he did not look back. (He was told:) “Moses, come close and do not be afraid, indeed you are of the ones in safety.

32.Bakhtiari Nejad: Insert your hand into the opening of your shirt, it comes out white without any disease, and press your arm to yourself (to be free) from fear. These are two proofs from your Lord for Pharaoh and his assembly. They are indeed disobedient people.”

33.Bakhtiari Nejad: He said: “My Lord, I killed one of them so I am afraid that they will kill me,

34.Bakhtiari Nejad: and my brother Aaron, he is more eloquent in language than me, so send him with me as a support to confirm me, indeed I am afraid that they deny me.”

35.Bakhtiari Nejad: He (God) said: “We are going to strengthen your arm with your brother, and We give you both a reason so they would not touch either of you, and because of Our miracles you two and those who follow you will be the winners.”

36.Bakhtiari Nejad: So, when Moses came up to them with Our clear signs, they said: “This is nothing but fabricated magic, and we did not hear of this from our forefathers.”

37.Bakhtiari Nejad: And Moses said: “My Lord knows best who brings the guidance from Him, and who has the final home, indeed the wrongdoers would not succeed.”

38.Bakhtiari Nejad: And Pharaoh said: “Counselors, I do not know of any god for you other than me, so Haman light me a fire for me over the clay (to bake bricks), then make me a palace so I may look at god of Moses, and indeed I think of him as one of the liars.”

39.Bakhtiari Nejad: And he and his troops were unjustifiably arrogant on the land, and they assumed that they would not be returned to Us.

40.Bakhtiari Nejad: So, We took him and his troops, and We threw them into the sea. So, see what the end of the wrongdoers was.

41.Bakhtiari Nejad: And We made them leaders, inviting (people) to the fire, and they will not be helped on the Resurrection Day.

42.Bakhtiari Nejad: And We made a curse follow them in this world, and on the Resurrection Day they are among the ugly ones.

43.Bakhtiari Nejad: And We certainly gave Moses the book, after We had destroyed the earlier generations, as an insight and a guide and a mercy for people, so that they may take notice.

44.Bakhtiari Nejad: And you were not on the western side (of the mountain) when We issued the order to Moses, and you were not of the witnesses.

45.Bakhtiari Nejad: And We created generations (after Moses), and life was lengthened for them. And you were not staying among people of Midian to read Our signs to them, but We are the sender (of messengers).

46.Bakhtiari Nejad: And you were not on the side of the mountain (Mount Sinai) when We called (Moses), but this is a mercy from your Lord to warn a (group of) people whom a warner did not come to them before you, so they may take notice.

47.Bakhtiari Nejad: And if they suffer a tragedy because of what their hands have sent ahead (what they did), then they say: “Our Lord, why did You not send us a messenger, so we follow Your signs and we become of the believers?”

48.Bakhtiari Nejad: Then when the truth came to them from Us, they said: “Why was he not given (miracles) like what Moses was given?” Did they not previously disbelieve in what was given to Moses? They said: “Two magics (Torah and Quran) backing each other up. And they said: “Indeed we are disbelievers to all.”

49.Bakhtiari Nejad: Say: “If you are truthful, then bring a book from God which is a better guide than them, so that I follow it, if you are truthful.”

50.Bakhtiari Nejad: So, if they did not answer you, then know that they only follow their desires (and opinions). And who is more mistaken than someone who follows his desire (and opinion) without guidance from God? Indeed, God does not guide the wrongdoing people.

51.Bakhtiari Nejad: And We have certainly communicated the word to them so they may take notice.

52.Bakhtiari Nejad: Those to whom We gave the book before it, they believe in it.

53.Bakhtiari Nejad: And when it is read to them, they say: “We believe in it, indeed it is the truth from our Lord, indeed we were submitted before it.”

54.Bakhtiari Nejad: They are given their reward twice as much because they are patient and they counter badness with goodness and they spend (in charity) from what We provide them,

55.Bakhtiari Nejad: and when they hear useless (talk) they stay away from it and say: “Our deeds are for us and your deeds are for you, peace (and well-being) upon you, we do not want (to have anything to do with) the ignorant ones.”

56.Bakhtiari Nejad: Indeed, you cannot guide anyone you like, but God guides anyone He wants, and He knows best who the guided ones are.

57.Bakhtiari Nejad: And they say: “If we follow the guidance with you, we will be driven out of our land.” Did We not establish them in a safe sanctuary, to which fruits of everything are brought as provision from Us? But most of them do not know.

58.Bakhtiari Nejad: And how many towns did We destroy that rejoiced (excessively) in their livelihood (and wealth)? So, those are their houses, uninhabited after them, except a few, and We are the inheritors.

59.Bakhtiari Nejad: And your Lord is not destroyer of the towns until He raises a messenger in their center, reading them Our signs. And We are not destroyer of the towns unless their people are wrongdoers.

60.Bakhtiari Nejad: And everything you are given is enjoyment of this world’s life and its decoration (and luxuries), and whatever (reward) is with God is better and more lasting. Do you not understand?

61.Bakhtiari Nejad: Is someone whom We have promised him a good promise and he attains it, the same as someone whom We have made him enjoy the enjoyments of this world’s life, then on the Resurrection Day he is among the summoned ones?

62.Bakhtiari Nejad: On the day He calls them out and He says: “Where are My partners, the ones you were claiming?”

63.Bakhtiari Nejad: Those who deserve the word (of punishment) will say: “Our Lord, these are the ones whom we misled, we misled them as we were misled, we clear ourselves (from them) before You, they were not serving us.”

64.Bakhtiari Nejad: And it will be said: “Call on your partners (of God).” So, they call them, but they do not answer them and they see the punishment, (and they wish) if only they were guided.

65.Bakhtiari Nejad: And on the day He calls them out, then He says: “What did you answer the messengers?”

66.Bakhtiari Nejad: On that day the information is unclear to them, so they do not (even) ask each other.

67.Bakhtiari Nejad: As for anyone who repented and believed and did good, perhaps he will be among the successful ones.

68.Bakhtiari Nejad: And your Lord creates whatever He wants and chooses. There is no choice for them. God is flawless and is above what they associate (with Him).

69.Bakhtiari Nejad: And your Lord knows what their chests/minds hide and what they disclose.

70.Bakhtiari Nejad: And He is God, there is no god except Him, all praise in the first (this life) and the last (the Hereafter) belongs to Him, and the command (and judgment) belongs to Him, and you are returned to Him.

71.Bakhtiari Nejad: Say: “What do you think if God makes the night continuous over you until the Resurrection Day, what god other than God brings you light? Do you not listen?”

72.Bakhtiari Nejad: Say: “What do you think if God makes the day continuous over you until the Resurrection Day, what god other than God brings you the night to rest in it? Do you not see?”

73.Bakhtiari Nejad: And He made the night and the day for you by His mercy in order for you to rest in it and to pursue His bounty, and you may be thankful.

74.Bakhtiari Nejad: On a day when He calls them out, then He says: “Where are My partners, those whom you were claiming?”

75.Bakhtiari Nejad: And We pull out a witness from every group, then We say: “Bring your proof.” Then they will know that the truth belongs to God, and what they used to fabricate has abandoned them.

76.Bakhtiari Nejad: Indeed Qarun (Korah) was among Moses’ people, and he was unjust toward them. And We gave him (so much) of the treasures that their keys were too heavy for a group of strong men. When his people said to him: “Do not be overjoyed, indeed God does not like those who are overjoyed,

77.Bakhtiari Nejad: and pursue the home of the Hereafter by what God has given you, and do not forget your share of this world, and do good as God did good to you, and do not pursue corruption in the land, indeed God does not like the corruptors.”

78.Bakhtiari Nejad: He said: “It was only given to me because of my knowledge.” Did he not know that God has destroyed (many) generations before him that were more powerful than him and more than him in collecting (wealth and manpower)? And the guilty ones will not be questioned about their sins.

79.Bakhtiari Nejad: Then (one day) he came out to his people (dressed) in his jewelry. Those who wanted this world’s life said: “We wish we had the same as what was given to Qarun (Korah), indeed he has a great fortune.”

80.Bakhtiari Nejad: And those who were given knowledge said: “Woe to you, God’s reward for anyone who believes and does good is better, and none gets it except those who persevere.”

81.Bakhtiari Nejad: So, We sank him and his house down into the earth, then he had nobody to help him besides God, and he could not help/defend himself.

82.Bakhtiari Nejad: And those who desired his position in the day before began to say: “Wow, it seems like God increases and decreases the provision for any one of His servants that He wants, and if it was not for God’s favor upon us He would have sunk us down (into the earth), wow, it seems like the disbelievers would not succeed.”

83.Bakhtiari Nejad: That is the home of the Hereafter, We made it for those who do not want superiority or corruption on the earth. And the end belongs to those who are cautious (of God).

84.Bakhtiari Nejad: Anyone who comes with the good (deed) then he will have a better (reward) than that, and anyone who comes with the bad (deed) then those who did bad deed will only be punished for what they used to do.

85.Bakhtiari Nejad: Indeed, the One Who mandated the Quran to you, certainly brings you back to place of return. Say: “My Lord knows best anyone who brought the guidance and anyone who is in obvious error.”

86.Bakhtiari Nejad: And you did not expect (or hope) that the book will be given to you except as a mercy from your Lord, so do not be a supporter for the disbelievers.

87.Bakhtiari Nejad: And do not let them turn you away from God’s signs after it was sent down to you, and invite (people) to your Lord, and do not be of the idolaters.

88.Bakhtiari Nejad: And do not call on another god with God, there is no god except Him. Everything perishes except His essence (and His being). The command (and judgment) belongs to Him, and you are returned to Him.

1.Bakhtiari Nejad: A.L.M. (Alif. Lam. Mim.)

2.Bakhtiari Nejad: Do people think that they are left alone, and they are not tested if they say we believe?

3.Bakhtiari Nejad: And We have tested those before them, so God certainly knows those who are truthful, and He certainly knows the liars.

4.Bakhtiari Nejad: Or do those who do bad deeds think that they outdo us? What a bad judgment they make!

5.Bakhtiari Nejad: Anyone who is hoping to meet God, (should know) that God’s appointed time is certainly coming, and He hears all and He knows all.

6.Bakhtiari Nejad: And anyone who tries (in God's way), indeed tries for himself. Indeed, God does not need any of the beings.

7.Bakhtiari Nejad: And those who believe and do good, We shall remove their bad deeds from them and We shall reward them better than what they were doing.

8.Bakhtiari Nejad: And We instructed the human being to be good to his parents, and if they try to make you associate (partners) with Me something that you have no knowledge of it, then do not obey them (but still be nice to them). Your return is to Me, and I inform you of what you were doing.

9.Bakhtiari Nejad: And those who believe and do good, We shall admit them among the righteous.

10.Bakhtiari Nejad: And some people say: “We believe in God” but when he is harmed in (the way of) God, he considers people’s persecution the same as God’s punishment, and if help (and victory) comes from your Lord they shall say: “Indeed we were with you.” Does not God know better what is in the chests/minds of humankind?

11.Bakhtiari Nejad: And God certainly knows those who believe, and He certainly knows the hypocrites.

12.Bakhtiari Nejad: And those who disbelieve say to those who believe: “Follow our way and we shall carry (and take responsibility for) your sins.” But they are not carriers of the least bit of their sins, they are certainly liars.

13.Bakhtiari Nejad: And they shall carry their loads and loads (of others) with their loads, and on the Resurrection Day they shall be questioned about what they used to fabricate.

14.Bakhtiari Nejad: And We certainly sent Noah to his people, and he stayed (and lived) among them a thousand years less fifty years (or nine hundred fifty years), then the flood took them and they were wrongdoers.

15.Bakhtiari Nejad: Then We saved him and inhabitants of the Ark, and We made it a sign for humankind.

16.Bakhtiari Nejad: And (remember) Abraham when he said to his people: “Serve God and be cautious of Him, that is better for you if you knew.

17.Bakhtiari Nejad: You only serve idols instead of God, and you create a lie. Indeed, those whom you serve other than God do not possess any provision for you, so look for the provision from God and serve Him and be thankful to Him, as you are returned to Him.”

18.Bakhtiari Nejad: And if you deny, groups before you have also denied, and the messenger's responsibility is only delivering (the message) clearly.

19.Bakhtiari Nejad: Have they not considered how God starts the creation and then brings it back? Indeed, that is easy for God.

20.Bakhtiari Nejad: Say: “Travel throughout the earth and see how He started the creation, then God will bring into being another creation (in the Hereafter), God is capable of everything.

21.Bakhtiari Nejad: He punishes anyone He wants and has mercy on anyone He wants, and you are turned over to Him.

22.Bakhtiari Nejad: And you cannot weaken/escape (God) on the earth or in the skies, and there is no protector or helper for you besides God.

23.Bakhtiari Nejad: And those who disbelieve in God's signs and meeting Him (in the Hereafter), they are hopeless of My mercy, and they will have a painful punishment.

24.Bakhtiari Nejad: So, there was no answer from his people except to say: “Kill him or burn him.” So, God saved him from the fire. Indeed, there are signs in that for people who believe.

25.Bakhtiari Nejad: And he said: “You only took idols instead of God because of friendship among yourselves in this world’s life, then on the Resurrection Day some of you will reject the others and some of you curse the others, and the fire will be your housing and you will have no helpers.”

26.Bakhtiari Nejad: Then Lot believed in him, and he (Abraham or Lot) said: “Indeed I am an emigrant to my Lord; indeed He is the powerful and the wise.”

27.Bakhtiari Nejad: And We gave him Isaac and Jacob and We put the prophethood and the book among his descendants, and We gave him his reward in the world, and in the Hereafter, he will certainly be of the righteous.

28.Bakhtiari Nejad: And (remember) Lot when he said to his people: “You certainly commit the indecency that none of humankind have done it before you.

29.Bakhtiari Nejad: Do you approach the males and cut off the way and you commit the unacceptable (and wrong) in your gatherings?” And there was no answer from his people except to say: “Bring us God’s punishment if you are of the truthful.”

30.Bakhtiari Nejad: He said: “My Lord, help me against the corrupting people.”

31.Bakhtiari Nejad: And when Our messengers brought Abraham the good news, they said: “Indeed we are destroyers of this town's people, for its people are wrongdoers.”

32.Bakhtiari Nejad: He said: “Indeed Lot is in it.” They said: “We know better who is in it, we shall save him and his family except his wife who is among those staying behind.”

33.Bakhtiari Nejad: And when Our messengers came to Lot, he was upset about them and he felt uneasy about them, and they said: “Do not be afraid and do not be sad, for we are saviors of you and your family except your wife who is among those staying behind.”

34.Bakhtiari Nejad: Indeed, We will bring down a punishment from the sky on the people of this town because they were disobeying.

35.Bakhtiari Nejad: And We have certainly left part of it as a clear sign for people who understand.

36.Bakhtiari Nejad: And (We sent) their brother Shu'aib (Jethro) to Midian. Then he said: “My people, serve God and expect the Last Day and do not do mischief on the earth as corruptors.”

37.Bakhtiari Nejad: So, they denied him, then the earthquake took them, and they became motionless bodies in their houses.

38.Bakhtiari Nejad: And (We destroyed) Aad and Thamud, and it has become clear to you by their houses. Satan beautified their works for them, turning them away from the (right) way even though they were able to see (the truth).

39.Bakhtiari Nejad: And (We destroyed) Qarun (Korah) and Pharaoh and Haman. And certainly, Moses brought them clear evidences, but they were arrogant on the land, and they were not overtaking (Our punishment).

40.Bakhtiari Nejad: We punished each one for his sin, We sent some of them a sandstorm, and We took some of them with the awful blast, and We sank some of them down into the earth, and We drowned some of them. God was not wrong to them, but they were doing wrong to themselves.

41.Bakhtiari Nejad: The example of those who take protectors/masters besides God is like the spider that makes a house for herself, and indeed the weakest house is the spider’s house, if they knew.

42.Bakhtiari Nejad: Indeed, God knows everything they call on besides Him, and He is the powerful and the wise.

43.Bakhtiari Nejad: And these are examples, We give them for people, and none understand them except the knowledgeable.

44.Bakhtiari Nejad: God created the skies and the earth rightfully. Indeed, there is a sign in that for the believers.

45.Bakhtiari Nejad: Read what is revealed to you from the book and perform mandatory prayer, for indeed mandatory prayer prevents from indecency and unacceptable (and wrong), and certainly God's remembrance is greater, and God knows what you do.

46.Bakhtiari Nejad: And do not argue with people of the book except by what is best (in manner and in reasoning), except those of them who did wrong, and say: “We believe in what was sent down to us and was sent down to you, and our god and your god is one (and the same), and we submit to Him.”

47.Bakhtiari Nejad: And that is how We have sent down the book to you, so those whom We gave them the book believe in it, and some of these are those who believe in it, and no one rejects Our signs except the disbelievers.

48.Bakhtiari Nejad: And you were not reading any book and you did not write any book with your right hand before it (Quran), for in that case those who follow falsehood would have certainly doubted.

49.Bakhtiari Nejad: No, but it (Quran) is clear signs in the chests/minds of those who were given the knowledge, and no one rejects Our signs except the wrongdoers.

50.Bakhtiari Nejad: And they said: “Why was not any miracle sent down to him from his Lord?” Say: “All miracles are with God, and I am only a clear warner.”

51.Bakhtiari Nejad: Or was it not enough for them that We sent down to you the book that is read to them? Indeed, there is a mercy and a reminder in that for people who believe.

52.Bakhtiari Nejad: Say: “God is enough as a witness between me and between you, He knows whatever is in the skies and the earth, and those who believe in the falsehood and disbelieve in God, they are the losers.”

53.Bakhtiari Nejad: They ask you to hurry up with the punishment. If it was not for a finite time, the punishment would have come to them, and it shall come to them suddenly while they do not realize.

54.Bakhtiari Nejad: They ask you to hurry up with the punishment, and hell shall surround the disbelievers.

55.Bakhtiari Nejad: On the day when the punishment covers them from above them and from under their feet, He says: “Taste (the result of) what you were doing.”

56.Bakhtiari Nejad: My servants, those who believe, indeed My earth is vast, so serve Me alone.

57.Bakhtiari Nejad: Every person tastes death, then you are returned to Us.

58.Bakhtiari Nejad: And those who believe and do good, We shall put them up in chambers of the garden which rivers flow through it, remaining in there forever. What an excellent reward for the doers (of good),

59.Bakhtiari Nejad: those who persevered and put their trust in their Lord.

60.Bakhtiari Nejad: And how many creatures do not carry their provision? God provides for them and for you, and He hears all and knows all.

61.Bakhtiari Nejad: And if you ask them: “Who created the skies and the earth and controlled the sun and the moon?” They shall say: “God.” So, how are they deviated (from the truth)?

62.Bakhtiari Nejad: God increases and decreases the provision for anyone He wants among His servants. Indeed, God knows everything.

63.Bakhtiari Nejad: And if you ask them: “Who sends down rain from the sky and with it brings the land back to life after its death?” They shall say: “God.” Say: “All praise belongs to God.” But most of them do not understand.

64.Bakhtiari Nejad: And this world’s life is only an amusement and a play, and indeed the home of the Hereafter is the (real) life, if they knew.

65.Bakhtiari Nejad: So, when they get on the ship, they call on God being sincere (and devoted) to Him in the religion, then when He saves them to the land, all of a sudden they associate (partners with Him),

66.Bakhtiari Nejad: in order to be ungrateful for what We gave them, and to enjoy (for a while), but they will know.

67.Bakhtiari Nejad: Or do they not see that We have made a safe sanctuary (Sacred Mosque), while people are kidnapped from around them? Then, do they believe in falsehood and disbelieve in God’s favor?

68.Bakhtiari Nejad: And who is more wrong than someone who makes up a lie (and attributes it) to God or denies the truth when it comes to him? Is there not a place for the disbelievers in hell?

69.Bakhtiari Nejad: And those who try hard for Us, We shall guide them to Our ways, and God is certainly with the good doers.

1.Bakhtiari Nejad: A.L.M. (Alif. Lam. Mim.)

2.Bakhtiari Nejad: The Romans were defeated

3.Bakhtiari Nejad: in the lowest part of the earth, and they are going to be victorious after their defeat

4.Bakhtiari Nejad: within a few (3 to 9) years. The command (and the judgment) belongs to God, in the past and in the future. And on that day the believers rejoice

5.Bakhtiari Nejad: in God’s help, as He helps anyone He wants, and He is the powerful and the merciful.

6.Bakhtiari Nejad: (This is) God’s promise, and God does not break His promise, but most people do not know.

7.Bakhtiari Nejad: They know the appearance (and facade) of this world’s life while they are negligent of the Hereafter.

8.Bakhtiari Nejad: Have they not thought about themselves? God did not create the skies and the earth and whatever between them except with the truth and (for) a finite time. And indeed most people are disbelievers in meeting their Lord.

9.Bakhtiari Nejad: Have they not traveled throughout the earth to see what the end of those before them was? They were more powerful than them and affected the earth more, and developed it more than they developed it, and their messengers brought them clear evidences. It was not God who wronged them, but they were doing wrong to themselves.

10.Bakhtiari Nejad: Then the end of those who did bad was bad, because they denied God’s signs and they were ridiculing it.

11.Bakhtiari Nejad: God starts the creation then brings it back then you are returned to Him.

12.Bakhtiari Nejad: And on the day when the Hour establishes, the guilty will be hopeless,

13.Bakhtiari Nejad: and there will not be any mediator for them among their partners (of God), and they will become disbelievers in their partners.

14.Bakhtiari Nejad: And on the day when the Hour establishes, on that day they will be divided.

15.Bakhtiari Nejad: As for those who believed and did good, then they will be delighted in a meadow.

16.Bakhtiari Nejad: And as for those who disbelieved and denied Our signs and meeting of the Hereafter, they will be brought into the punishment.

17.Bakhtiari Nejad: So, glorify God when you turn in at the night and when you get up in the morning.

18.Bakhtiari Nejad: And all praise in the skies and the earth and evening and during noon belongs to Him.

19.Bakhtiari Nejad: He brings out the living from the dead and He brings out the dead from the living and He brings the land back to life after its death. And that is how you are brought out (back to life).

20.Bakhtiari Nejad: And among His signs is that He created you from dust, then all of a sudden you are human beings spreading out (on the earth).

21.Bakhtiari Nejad: And among His signs is that He created spouses for you from yourselves to calm down by them, and He put friendship and kindness between you. Indeed, there are signs in that for people who think.

22.Bakhtiari Nejad: And among His signs is the creation of the skies and the earth and the difference of your languages and your colors. Indeed, there are signs in that for humankind.

23.Bakhtiari Nejad: And among His signs is your sleep at night and the day while you pursue His bounty. Indeed, there are signs in that for people who listen.

24.Bakhtiari Nejad: And among His signs (that) He shows you the lightning as a fear and a hope, and He sends down rain from the sky bringing the land back to life with it after its death. Indeed, there are signs in that for people who understand.

25.Bakhtiari Nejad: And among His signs is that by His command the skies and the earth exist, then when He calls you from the earth with a (single) call, you immediately come out.

26.Bakhtiari Nejad: And everyone in the skies and the earth belongs to Him, they are all obedient to Him.

27.Bakhtiari Nejad: He is the One Who starts the creation then brings it back, and that is easier for Him. And the highest attributes in the skies and the earth belong to Him. And He is the powerful and the knowledgeable.

28.Bakhtiari Nejad: He gives you an example of yourselves. Is there among those whom your right hand owns, any partner that you are equal in what we have provided for you, and you are afraid of them as you are afraid of each other? That is how We explain the signs to people who understand.

29.Bakhtiari Nejad: No, but those who do wrong follow their desires without any knowledge. Then who guides anyone whom God has misguided? And there are no helpers for them.

30.Bakhtiari Nejad: So, set your objective/purpose to the true religion (serving God alone), God’s system which He created people based upon it. There is no change in God’s creation. That is the lasting (and right) way of life (religion), but most people do not know.

31.Bakhtiari Nejad: (Be of those) turning to Him (in repentance) and be cautious of Him and perform mandatory prayer and do not be of the idolaters,

32.Bakhtiari Nejad: from those (idolaters) who divide their religion and become sects, every party is happy with what is with them.

33.Bakhtiari Nejad: And when trouble touches people, they call on their Lord turning to Him (in repentance), so when He makes them taste from His mercy, then all of a sudden some of them associate (partners) with their Lord,

34.Bakhtiari Nejad: in order to be ungrateful for what We gave them. So, enjoy (for a while), then you will know.

35.Bakhtiari Nejad: Or have We sent down any reason to them and it speaks of what they were associating with Him?

36.Bakhtiari Nejad: And when We make people taste a mercy, then they are happy with it, and if something bad happens to them because of what their hands sent ahead (and what they did) then they lose hope.

37.Bakhtiari Nejad: Or have they not seen that God increases and decreases the provision for anyone He wants? Indeed, there are signs in that for people who believe.

38.Bakhtiari Nejad: So, give the relatives (and close ones) and the needy and the traveler (in need) their due. That is better for those who want God's pleasure (and His attention), and they are the successful ones.

39.Bakhtiari Nejad: And whatever you give as usury (excessive interest) so that it increases in people’s wealth, it does not increase with God, while whatever you give in mandatory charity, wanting God's pleasure (and His attention), then those are the multiplied ones.

40.Bakhtiari Nejad: God is the One Who created you, then provided for you, then makes you die, then brings you back to life. Is there any of your partners (of God) who can do any of those things? God is flawless and is above what they associate (with Him).

41.Bakhtiari Nejad: The corruption (such as famine, drought and plague) appeared in the land and the sea because of what people’s hands did, so that He makes them taste some of what they did, so they may return.

42.Bakhtiari Nejad: Say: “Travel throughout the earth and see what the end of those before (you) was. Most of them were idolaters.”

43.Bakhtiari Nejad: So, set your course (and purpose) to the lasting (and right) way of life (religion) before a day comes from God that there is no turning back for it, on that day they (people) are separated.

44.Bakhtiari Nejad: Anyone who disbelieves, then his disbelief is against him, and anyone who does good, then they prepare (a good reward) for themselves,

45.Bakhtiari Nejad: so that from His grace He will reward those who believe and do good. Indeed, He does not like the disbelievers.

46.Bakhtiari Nejad: And among His signs is that He sends the winds bringing good news and to make you taste from His mercy, and so that the ships sail by His command and so that you pursue His bounty, and you may be thankful.

47.Bakhtiari Nejad: And before you, We have certainly sent messengers to their people, and they brought them clear evidences. Then We took revenge from those who committed crime. Helping the believers is Our responsibility.

48.Bakhtiari Nejad: God is the One Who sends the winds to stir up (and raise) a cloud, then He spreads it in the sky as He wants, and He makes it into pieces, then you see raindrops coming out from within it, then when He makes it fall on any of His servants that He wants, they become cheerful,

49.Bakhtiari Nejad: even though they were hopeless before it was sent down on them.

50.Bakhtiari Nejad: So, look at the effects of God’s mercy, how He gives life to the land after its death. Indeed, He is giver of life to the dead, and He is capable of everything.

51.Bakhtiari Nejad: And if We send a wind that they see it turn (their crops) yellow, they certainly will become ungrateful after that.

52.Bakhtiari Nejad: And indeed, you cannot make the dead hear and you cannot make the deaf hear the call when they turn back going away.

53.Bakhtiari Nejad: And you are not a guide to the blind (who does not want to see the truth) about their error. You can only make someone listen who believes in Our signs, so they are submitted (to Us).

54.Bakhtiari Nejad: God is the One Who creates you from (a state of) weakness, then He brings about strength after weakness, then He brings about weakness and gray hair (and old age) after strength. He creates what He wants, and He is the knowledgeable and the capable.

55.Bakhtiari Nejad: And on the day when the Hour establishes, the guilty ones swear that they only stayed (dead) for an hour. That is how they were deviating (from the truth).

56.Bakhtiari Nejad: And those who were given knowledge and belief say: “You have certainly stayed until the Resurrection Day according to God’s book (and His mandate), so this is the Resurrection Day, but you did not use to know that.”

57.Bakhtiari Nejad: So, on that day, apology of those who did wrong has no benefit, and they are not allowed to plea (to appease God).

58.Bakhtiari Nejad: And We have certainly given all kinds of example in this Quran for people, and if you bring them a sign (miracle), those who disbelieve shall say: “You are only falsifiers.”

59.Bakhtiari Nejad: That is how God puts a seal on the hearts of those who do not know.

60.Bakhtiari Nejad: So, persevere (and be patient) for God’s promise is indeed true, and do not let those who are uncertain look down upon you.

1.Bakhtiari Nejad: A.L.M. (Alif. Lam. Mim.)

2.Bakhtiari Nejad: These are verses of the wise Book,

3.Bakhtiari Nejad: a guide and a mercy for the good doers,

4.Bakhtiari Nejad: those who perform mandatory prayer and give to mandatory charity and they are certain of the Hereafter.

5.Bakhtiari Nejad: They are on guidance from their Lord, and they are the successful ones.

6.Bakhtiari Nejad: And some people trade the amusing (and baseless) saying in order to misguide (people) from God's way without knowledge, and they take it as a joke. They will have a humiliating punishment.

7.Bakhtiari Nejad: And when Our verses are read to him, he turns away arrogantly as if he did not hear it or as if his ears are hard of hearing, so give him the news of a painful punishment.

8.Bakhtiari Nejad: Indeed, those who believe and do good, the gardens of delight are for them,

9.Bakhtiari Nejad: remaining in there forever. God’s promise is true, and He is the powerful and the knowledgeable.

10.Bakhtiari Nejad: He created the skies without any pillars that you see, and He placed firm mountains in the earth so that it does not shake you (as violently), and He scattered all kinds of creatures in it. And We sent down rain from the sky, then We grew all types of splendid plants in it.

11.Bakhtiari Nejad: This is God’s creation, so show me what those besides Him have created. No, but the wrongdoers are in obvious error.

12.Bakhtiari Nejad: And We certainly gave Luqman wisdom (telling him:) “Be grateful to God. And whoever is grateful, then he is only grateful for himself, and whoever is ungrateful then indeed God is rich (without need) and praiseworthy.”

13.Bakhtiari Nejad: And (remember) when Luqman said to his son while advising him: “My son, do not associate (any partner) with God, for associating (partners with God) is certainly a great wrongdoing.”

14.Bakhtiari Nejad: And We have instructed human being about (being good to) his parents, his mother carried him (getting) weaker and weaker, and his weaning (off breastfeeding) is in two years. You should be thankful to Me and your parents. The final return is to Me.

15.Bakhtiari Nejad: And if they try to make you associate (partners) with Me, something that you have no knowledge of, then do not obey them, but continue to be nice to them in this world, and follow the way of those who have returned to Me (in repentance). Your return is to Me, and I inform you of what you were doing.

16.Bakhtiari Nejad: (Luqman also said:) “My son, indeed if it (your action) is the weight of a mustard seed and it is in a rock or in the skies or on the earth, God brings it (into account). Indeed, God is nice and well-informed.

17.Bakhtiari Nejad: My son, perform mandatory prayer and instruct to the acceptable (and right) and prohibit from the unacceptable (and wrong) and be patient about what happens to you, indeed that is of the matters (requiring) determination.

18.Bakhtiari Nejad: And do not turn your cheek away from people, and do not walk on the earth arrogantly, for God does not like every selfish show-off.

19.Bakhtiari Nejad: And be modest in your walking (do not walk arrogantly) and lower your voice, for the most awful voice is certainly voice of the donkey.”

20.Bakhtiari Nejad: Have you not considered that God has brought everything in the skies and everything on the earth under your control (and in your service), and He has given you of His favors abundantly, apparent and hidden? And some people argue about God without any knowledge and without any guidance and without an enlightening book.

21.Bakhtiari Nejad: And when they are told: “Follow what God has sent down” they say: “No, but we follow what we found our fathers upon it” even if Satan was inviting them to the punishment of the burning fire.

22.Bakhtiari Nejad: And anyone who submits himself to God and he is a good doer then he has indeed grabbed on to the firm handle, and the end of all affairs are with God.

23.Bakhtiari Nejad: And anyone who disbelieves, then do not let his disbelief make you sad. Their return is to Us, and We inform them of what they did. Indeed, God knows well what is inside the chests/minds.

24.Bakhtiari Nejad: We let them enjoy for a little, then We force them into a severe punishment.

25.Bakhtiari Nejad: And if you ask them who created the skies and the earth? They shall say: “God.” Say: “All praise belongs to God.” But most of them do not know.

26.Bakhtiari Nejad: Whatever is in the skies and the earth belongs to God. Indeed, God is the rich (without need) and the praiseworthy.

27.Bakhtiari Nejad: If every tree on the earth was (made into) pens, and the sea (was ink) and afterward seven more seas replenish it, God’s words would not finish. Indeed, God is powerful and knowledgeable.

28.Bakhtiari Nejad: Your creation and your resurrection is only like (creation of) a single person. Indeed, God hears all and sees all.

29.Bakhtiari Nejad: Do you not see that God makes the night pass through the day and makes the day pass through the night, and He controls the sun and the moon, each running (its course) in a finite time, and God is well informed of what you do?

30.Bakhtiari Nejad: That is because God is the truth, and whatever they call on other than Him is falsehood, and God is the superior, the great.

31.Bakhtiari Nejad: Or do you not see that the ship sails in the sea by God’s favor, so that He shows you some of His signs? Indeed, there are signs in that for every persevering (and patient) and thankful (person).

32.Bakhtiari Nejad: And when a wave covers them like the shades, they call on God being sincere to Him in the religion, then when He saves them to the land, some of them keep to the middle course, and no one rejects Our signs except every ungrateful traitor.

33.Bakhtiari Nejad: People, be cautious of your Lord and fear a day when no father pays for his child and no child is the payer of anything for his father. Indeed, God’s promise is true, so do not be deceived by this world’s life, and do not be deceived by the deceiver (Satan) about God.

34.Bakhtiari Nejad: Indeed, knowledge of the Hour is with God, and He sends down the rain and knows what is in the wombs, and no one knows what he/she will do tomorrow and no one knows in which land he/she will die. Indeed, God is knowledgeable and well-informed.

32.SurahEnglishNames: The Prostration, Worship, Adoration, The Adoration

1.Bakhtiari Nejad: A.L.M. (Alif. Lam. Mim.)

2.Bakhtiari Nejad: Without a doubt, revelation of the book is from the Lord of humankind.

3.Bakhtiari Nejad: Or do they say he made it up? No, but it is the truth from your Lord in order for you to warn people whom a warner has not come to them before you, so that they may be guided.

4.Bakhtiari Nejad: God is the One Who created the skies and the earth and whatever between them in six stages then He reigned over the dominion. There is no protector and no mediator for you other than Him. Do you not take notice?

5.Bakhtiari Nejad: He directs every affair from the sky to the earth, then it goes up to Him in a day that its duration is one thousand years of what you count.

6.Bakhtiari Nejad: This is the knower of the unseen and the visible, the powerful, the merciful.

7.Bakhtiari Nejad: The One Who created everything well, and He began the creation of the human being from clay,

8.Bakhtiari Nejad: then He made his descendants from an extract of a despicable (and slimy) liquid,

9.Bakhtiari Nejad: then He shaped him and blew from His breath of life (or spirit) into him, while He made hearing, sight, and hearts for you. You give little thanks.

10.Bakhtiari Nejad: And they say: “When we are lost in the earth (after death), will we indeed be in a new creation?” No, but they are disbelievers in meeting of their Lord.

11.Bakhtiari Nejad: Say: “The angel of death, the one who is put in charge of you, makes you die, then you are returned to your Lord.”

12.Bakhtiari Nejad: And if you see when the guilty ones hang their heads down before their Lord (saying:) “Our Lord, we saw and we heard, so send us back and we will do good, we are certain.”

13.Bakhtiari Nejad: And if We had wanted, We would have given everyone its guidance, but the word from Me will be proved, that I shall fill hell with the Jinn and the people altogether.

14.Bakhtiari Nejad: So, taste (the punishment) because you forgot the meeting of this day of yours, (therefore) We forgot you, and taste the eternal punishment for what you were doing.

15.Bakhtiari Nejad: Only (people who) believe in Our signs are those who when they are reminded of them, fall down prostrating (showing humbleness), and with praise of their Lord they glorify Him, and they are not arrogant.

16.Bakhtiari Nejad: Their sides separate from the beds (as they get up) to call on their Lord afraid and hopeful, and they spend (in God's way) from what We have provided for them.

17.Bakhtiari Nejad: And no one knows what delight of the eyes (and joys) is hidden for them as a reward for what they were doing.

18.Bakhtiari Nejad: Is someone who is a believer the same as someone who is disobedient? They are not equal.

19.Bakhtiari Nejad: As for those who believe and do good, they will have gardens of (eternal) housing, a reception for what they were doing.
