20.Bakhtiari Nejad: And as for those who were disobedient, their housing will be the fire. Whenever they want to get out of it, they are sent back in it, and they are told: “Taste the punishment of fire which you used to deny.”

21.Bakhtiari Nejad: And We shall make them taste from the lesser punishment (of this world) besides the greater punishment (of the Hereafter), so that they may return.

22.Bakhtiari Nejad: And who is more wrong than someone who is reminded of His Lord's signs, then he stays away from them? Indeed, We take revenge from the guilty ones.

23.Bakhtiari Nejad: And We certainly gave Moses the book, so do not be in doubt about his encounter (to receive the Torah), and We made it a guide for the children of Israel.

24.Bakhtiari Nejad: And We appointed leaders among them to guide by Our command because they persevered and were certain of Our signs.

25.Bakhtiari Nejad: Indeed, on the Resurrection Day your Lord judges between them about what they were disagreeing about.

26.Bakhtiari Nejad: Or does it not guide them (the fact) that how many generations before them We destroyed, which (now) they walk in their houses? There are certainly signs in that, do they not listen?

27.Bakhtiari Nejad: Or do they not see that We drive the rain to the barren land, then We bring out crops with it, that their livestock and themselves eat from it? Do they not see?

28.Bakhtiari Nejad: And they say: “When is the judgment/victory, if you are truthful?”

29.Bakhtiari Nejad: Say: “On the judgment/victory day, believing of those who disbelieved does not benefit them, and they are not given any delays.”

30.Bakhtiari Nejad: So, stay away from them and wait, for they are also waiting.

33.SurahEnglishNames: The Clans, The Coalition, The Combined Forces, The Allies

1.Bakhtiari Nejad: Prophet, be cautious of God and do not obey the disbelievers and the hypocrites. Indeed, God is knowledgeable and wise.

2.Bakhtiari Nejad: And follow what is revealed to you from your Lord. Indeed, God is well informed of what you do.

3.Bakhtiari Nejad: And put your trust in God, and God is enough as an advocate.

4.Bakhtiari Nejad: God did not give any man two hearts inside of him, and He did not make your wives, those you divorce by declaring them as your mother’s back, your mothers. And He did not make your adopted sons, your sons. That is only your saying by your mouths, but God speaks the truth and He guides to the (right) way.

5.Bakhtiari Nejad: Call them by their fathers’ (names), it is more just before God. And if you do not know their fathers, then they are your brothers in the religion and your friends. And there is no blame on you about what you made a mistake in it (unintentionally or being unaware) but (you are responsible) for what your hearts intended (and you did intentionally). God is forgiving and kind.

6.Bakhtiari Nejad: The prophet is more entitled to the believers than themselves, and his wives are (like) their mothers. And in God’s book, blood relatives (and close relatives) are more entitled to (inherit from) each other than the believers and the migrants unless you (want to) do some good to your friends. This is written in the book.

7.Bakhtiari Nejad: And (remember) when We took from the prophets their commitment, and from you and from Noah and Abraham and Moses and Jesus, son of Mary, and We took a firm commitment from them.

8.Bakhtiari Nejad: So that He questions the truthful ones about their truthfulness, and He has prepared a painful punishment for the disbelievers.

9.Bakhtiari Nejad: You who believe, remember God’s favor upon you when troops came to you (and attacked you), so We sent (strong) wind and troops against them that you did not see them. And God sees what you do.

10.Bakhtiari Nejad: When they came to you (and attacked) from above you and from below you, and when the eyes turned aside (in fear), and the hearts reached up to the throats and you thought of God doubtfully.

11.Bakhtiari Nejad: It was then that the believers were tested, and they were shaken, a strong shake.

12.Bakhtiari Nejad: And (remember) when hypocrites and those who had a disease in their hearts said: “God and His messenger did not promise us except delusion.”

13.Bakhtiari Nejad: And (remember) when a group of them said: “People of Yathreb (Medina), there is no place for you, so return.” And a part of them asked permission from the prophet, saying: “Our homes are unprotected (and defenseless)” while they were not unprotected, they only wanted to run away.

14.Bakhtiari Nejad: And if they (the enemy) had entered upon them from its boroughs and they were asked for disloyalty, they would have certainly done it, and they would have only hesitated a little.

15.Bakhtiari Nejad: And they had certainly promised God in the past that they would not turn their backs (and run away). And promise to God is questioned (and is a responsibility).

16.Bakhtiari Nejad: Say: “Escape will never benefit you if you escape from death or killing (being killed), and even then you only enjoy for a little while.”

17.Bakhtiari Nejad: Say: “Who is the one who will defend you against God if He wants harm for you or if He wants mercy for you?” And they will not find any protector and no helper for them besides God.

18.Bakhtiari Nejad: Indeed, God knows those holding the others back among you, and those saying to their brothers: “Come to us” while only a few of them come to the battle.

19.Bakhtiari Nejad: Covetous (and stingy) toward you, and when fear comes, you see them looking at you rolling their eyes like someone who faints because of death, and when the fear goes away, they are going to slash you with the sharp tongues being covetous of the good (that comes to you). They do not believe, therefore God makes their works useless, and that is easy for God.

20.Bakhtiari Nejad: They think that the (warring) parties did not go away, and if the (warring) parties come they wish they were nomads among the desert Arabs asking about your news, and if they were among you, they would have fought a little.

21.Bakhtiari Nejad: There has certainly been a good example in God's messenger for you and for anyone who hopes for God and the Last Day and remembers God often.

22.Bakhtiari Nejad: And when the believers saw the (warring) parties they said: “This is what God and His messenger promised us, and God and His messenger told the truth.” And it only increased their belief and their submission.

23.Bakhtiari Nejad: There are men among the believers who were true to what they promised to God, and some of them fulfilled their vows (and died) and some of them are waiting, and they did not change (their promise) by any changes.

24.Bakhtiari Nejad: So that God rewards the truthful for their truth, and punishes the hypocrites if He wants, or turns to them (in mercy). Indeed, God is forgiving and merciful.

25.Bakhtiari Nejad: And God turned back those who disbelieved in their rage, and they did not gain any good. And God spared the believers from the fight. God is strong and powerful.

26.Bakhtiari Nejad: And God brought down those among the people of the book who supported them (the warring parties) from their fortresses, and He threw horror in their hearts, (so that) you kill part of them and you capture part of them.

27.Bakhtiari Nejad: And He made you inherit their land and their houses and their possessions and a land that you have not yet set foot on it. And God is capable of everything.

28.Bakhtiari Nejad: Prophet, tell your wives: “If you want this world’s life and its decoration (and luxuries), then come, I compensate you and I let you go free (so you may divorce), a nice leaving,

29.Bakhtiari Nejad: and if you want God and His messenger and the home of the Hereafter, then indeed God has prepared a great reward for the good doers among you.”

30.Bakhtiari Nejad: Wives of the prophet, anyone among you who commits an obvious indecency, the punishment is multiplied for her twofold. And that is easy for God.

31.Bakhtiari Nejad: And anyone among you who is obedient to God and His messenger and does good, We give her twice her reward, and We have prepared a noble provision for her.

32.Bakhtiari Nejad: Wives of the prophet, you are not like any of the women. If you are cautious (of God), then do not be soft in speech so the one who has disease in his heart does not desire (you), and speak in proper word (and manner).

33.Bakhtiari Nejad: And stay in your houses and do not display your beauties like displaying in the old days of ignorance, and perform mandatory prayer and give to mandatory charity and obey God and His messenger. God only wants to remove the filth from you, the people of household (of the prophet), and to cleanse you, a total cleansing.

34.Bakhtiari Nejad: And remember what is read to you in your houses from God’s signs/verses and wisdom. Indeed, God is nice and well-informed.

35.Bakhtiari Nejad: Indeed the submitted men and the submitted women, and the believing men and the believing women, and the obedient men and the obedient women, and the truthful men and the truthful women, and the persevering men and the persevering women, and the humble men and the humble women, and the charitable men and the charitable women, and the fasting men and the fasting women, and the men guarding their private parts and the women guarding (theirs), and the men remembering God often and the women remembering (Him often), God has prepared forgiveness and a great reward for them.

36.Bakhtiari Nejad: It is not for a believing man or a believing woman, that when God and His messenger decided on a matter, to have a choice in their matter. And whoever disobeys God and His messenger has certainly erred, an obvious error.

37.Bakhtiari Nejad: And (remember) when you said to the one whom God favored upon him and you favored upon him: “Keep your wife for yourself, and be cautious of God.” And you hid in yourself what God was to disclose it. And you feared people, while God is more deserving that you fear Him. So, when Zaid finished with her (and divorced her), We married her to you so that there would be no difficulty for the believers about (marrying) wives of their adopted sons when they are finished with them (and have divorced them). And God’s command is to be done.

38.Bakhtiari Nejad: There is no difficulty on the prophet about (doing) what God has mandated to him. This is God’s way about those who passed away in the past. And God’s command is a mandated destiny.

39.Bakhtiari Nejad: Those who deliver God’s message and fear Him and do not fear anyone except God, (they know that) God is enough for reckoning.

40.Bakhtiari Nejad: Muhammad is not father of any of your men, but (he is) God’s messenger and the seal (and the last) of the prophets. And God knows everything.

41.Bakhtiari Nejad: You who believe, remember God, remembering often,

42.Bakhtiari Nejad: and glorify Him morning and afternoon.

43.Bakhtiari Nejad: He is the One Who sends blessings to you and (so do) His angels to bring you out of the darkness to the light. And He is merciful to the believers.

44.Bakhtiari Nejad: Their greeting on the day they meet Him is: “Peace (and well-being).” And He has prepared a noble (and generous) reward for them.

45.Bakhtiari Nejad: Prophet, We have sent you as a witness and a giver of good news and a warner,

46.Bakhtiari Nejad: and a caller toward God by His permission, and as a shining lamp.

47.Bakhtiari Nejad: And give good news to the believers that they will have a great bounty from God.

48.Bakhtiari Nejad: And do not obey the disbelievers and the hypocrites and disregard their harassment and put your trust in God. God is enough as an advocate.

49.Bakhtiari Nejad: You who believe, when you marry the believing women and then divorce them before you touch them, then they are not responsible for any waiting period for you that you count it, so compensate them and let them go free, a nice leaving.

50.Bakhtiari Nejad: Prophet, We made lawful for you, your wives whom you gave them their compensations (marriage portions), and those whom your right hand owns (slaves) from what God has given you (as spoil), and daughters of your paternal uncles (your father’s brothers), and daughters of your paternal aunts (your father’s sisters), and daughters of your maternal uncles (your mother’s brothers), and daughters of your maternal aunts (your mother’s sisters) who migrated with you, and any believing woman who gives herself to the prophet (without asking for marriage portion) if the prophet wants to marry her, this (last group) is only for you and not the other believers. We also know what We mandated to them (the believers) regarding their wives and those whom their right hands own, so that there would be no difficulty (or blame) on you. And God is forgiving and merciful.

51.Bakhtiari Nejad: You may put off any one of them (your wives) you want and take to yourself anyone you want. And there is no blame on you to desire any one of those whom you set aside. That is more likely to delight their eyes and that they do not be sad and be pleased with what you give all of them. And God knows what is in your hearts. And God is knowledgeable and patient.

52.Bakhtiari Nejad: Women are not lawful for you from now on, and neither is exchanging them for other wives, even though their beauty impresses you, except those your right hand owns. God is watchful over everything.

53.Bakhtiari Nejad: You who believe, do not enter the prophet’s houses unless permission is given to you for a meal, without waiting for its preparation. But when you are invited then enter, and when you have eaten then disperse and do not look for staying for a conversation. Indeed, that is annoying the prophet, but he is shy about (asking) you (to leave), but God is not shy about the truth. And when you ask them (prophet’s wives) for anything, ask them from behind a curtain (or a partition). That is purer for your hearts and their hearts. And it is not for you to annoy God’s messenger, and do not ever marry his wives after him, indeed that is awful in God's sight.

54.Bakhtiari Nejad: If you disclose anything or hide it, indeed God is knowledgeable about everything.

55.Bakhtiari Nejad: There is no blame on them about (not covering themselves in the presence of) their fathers or their sons or their brothers or their brothers’ sons or their sisters’ sons or their women, or those whom their right hands own. And (you, wives of the prophet) be cautious of God, for God is witness over everything.

56.Bakhtiari Nejad: God and His angels send blessings to the prophet. You who believe, send blessings to him and greet him, a (respectful) greeting (or sincerely pray for him).

57.Bakhtiari Nejad: Indeed, those who annoy God and His messenger, God curses them in this world and the Hereafter and He has prepared a humiliating punishment for them.

58.Bakhtiari Nejad: And those who harass the believing men and the believing women for other than what they did, then they have carried (the guilt of) a false accusation and an obvious sin.

59.Bakhtiari Nejad: Prophet, tell your wives and your daughters and women of the believers to draw their outer garment over themselves. That is more likely that they are recognized and are not harassed. And God is forgiving and merciful.

60.Bakhtiari Nejad: If the hypocrites and those who have a disease in their hearts and those who spread false rumors in the city do not stop, We shall provoke you against them, then they will only be your neighbors in there for a short while.

61.Bakhtiari Nejad: They are cursed, and wherever they are found they are taken and they are killed,

62.Bakhtiari Nejad: God’s way about those who passed away in the past. And you never find any change in God’s way.

63.Bakhtiari Nejad: People ask you about the Hour, say: “Its knowledge is only with God.” And what do you know, the Hour may be near!

64.Bakhtiari Nejad: Indeed, God has cursed the disbelievers and has prepared a burning fire for them,

65.Bakhtiari Nejad: remaining in there forever and ever, and they do not find any protector or any helper.

66.Bakhtiari Nejad: On the day when their faces are turned over in the fire, they say: “We wish we had obeyed God and obeyed the messenger.”

67.Bakhtiari Nejad: And they say: “Our Lord, we obeyed our leaders and our elders (and great ones), and they misled us from the (right) way.

68.Bakhtiari Nejad: Our Lord, give them double the punishment and curse them, a great curse.”

69.Bakhtiari Nejad: You who believe, do not be like those who harassed Moses, then God cleared him of what they said, and he is respected before God.

70.Bakhtiari Nejad: You who believe, be cautious of God and say the right (and just) word,

71.Bakhtiari Nejad: so that He corrects (and improves) your works for you, and to forgive your sins for you. And whoever obeys God and His messenger then he has achieved a great victory.

72.Bakhtiari Nejad: Indeed, We offered the trust to the skies and the earth and the mountains, but they refused to undertake it and they were afraid of it, but the human being undertook it. Indeed, he is wrongdoer and ignorant.

73.Bakhtiari Nejad: So that God will punish the hypocrite men and the hypocrite women, and the idolater men and the idolater women, and He will turn (in mercy) to the believing men and the believing women. And God is forgiving and merciful.

1.Bakhtiari Nejad: All praise belongs to God, the One that everything in the skies and everything on the earth belongs to Him, and all praise in the Hereafter belongs to Him, and He is the wise and the well-informed.

2.Bakhtiari Nejad: He knows what goes into the earth and what comes out of it, and what comes down from the sky and what goes up to it, and He is the merciful, the forgiving.

3.Bakhtiari Nejad: And those who disbelieve say: “The Hour would not come to us.” Say: “Yes, by my Lord, knower of the unseen, it shall come to you.” (Even) a tiny particle on the earth and in the skies does not escape from Him, and neither anything smaller than that or larger, unless it is (written) in a clear book.

4.Bakhtiari Nejad: So that He rewards those who believe and do good. They have forgiveness and a noble provision.

5.Bakhtiari Nejad: And those who tried to disable (and invalidate) Our signs, they have punishment of a painful filth.

6.Bakhtiari Nejad: And those who were given knowledge see that what is revealed to you from your Lord is the truth and it guides to the path of the powerful, the praiseworthy.

7.Bakhtiari Nejad: And those who disbelieve say: “Should we point you out to a man who tells you that you will certainly be (raised) in a new creation when you are torn into pieces, completely torn apart?”

8.Bakhtiari Nejad: Has he fabricated a lie (and attributed it) to God or is he mad? No, but those who do not believe in the Hereafter are in the punishment and in major error.

9.Bakhtiari Nejad: Have they not looked at what is in front of them and what is behind them from the sky and the earth? If We want, We will sink them down into the earth or We make a piece of the sky fall on them. Indeed, there is a sign in that for every repenting servant.

10.Bakhtiari Nejad: And We have certainly given David advantage from Us, (and We said:) “Mountains and birds, repeat (and echo) with him (glorifying Me).” And We made the iron soft for him,

11.Bakhtiari Nejad: (Telling him:) “Make loose and long coats of armor, and measure the links accurately, and do good. Indeed, I see whatever you do.”

12.Bakhtiari Nejad: And (We made) the wind (compliant) to Solomon, its morning journey a month and its evening journey a month. And We made a spring of melted copper flow for him, and some Jinn worked in front of him by his Lord’s permission, and any one of them who deviated from Our command, We made him taste punishment of the burning fire.

13.Bakhtiari Nejad: They worked for him (to make) whatever he wanted, from temples and statues and large bowls like reservoirs and fixed cooking pots. (We said to) David’s family: “Do (good deeds) to be thankful, and a few of My servants are thankful.”

14.Bakhtiari Nejad: So, when We ordered death for him, nothing pointed out his death to them except a creature of the earth (a termite) eating his staff. But when he fell down, it became clear to the Jinn that if they had known the unseen, they would not have remained in the humiliating punishment.

15.Bakhtiari Nejad: There has certainly been a sign for (the people of) Sheba in their residence, two gardens, (one) on the right and (one) the left. (We told them:) “Eat from the provision of your Lord and be thankful to Him. A good land and a forgiving Lord.”

16.Bakhtiari Nejad: Then they turned away, so We sent the devastating flood on them, and We changed their two gardens into two gardens having bitter fruits and tamarisk, and a little bit of a Lote (Sidra) tree.

17.Bakhtiari Nejad: That is how We punished them because they disbelieved, and do We punish (anyone) except the ungrateful?

18.Bakhtiari Nejad: And We placed visible (and accessible) towns between them and the towns that We had blessed them, and We mandated travel in them (and said:) “Travel safely between them at nights and days.”

19.Bakhtiari Nejad: Then they said: “Our Lord, prolong between our journeys.” And they did wrong to themselves, so We made them stories (for people to talk about) and We broke them up into pieces, a total break up. Indeed, there are signs in that for every persevering (and patient) and thankful (person).

20.Bakhtiari Nejad: And certainly Iblis (Satan) was true about them in his assumption, and they followed him except a group of believers.

21.Bakhtiari Nejad: And there was no authority (and power) for him over them, except that We know anyone who believes in the Hereafter from anyone who is in doubt about it. And your Lord is guardian of everything.

22.Bakhtiari Nejad: Say: “Call on those whom you claim (as god) besides God, they do not own a tiny particle in the skies or on the earth, and they have no partnership in (either of) them, and He has no helper among them.”

23.Bakhtiari Nejad: And mediation before Him does not benefit, except for someone whom He has permitted him. When horror is removed from their hearts, they say: “What did your Lord say?” They would say: “The truth, and He is the superior, the great.”

24.Bakhtiari Nejad: Say: “Who provides for you from the skies and the earth?” Say: “God, and indeed (either) we or you are on guidance or in obvious error.”

25.Bakhtiari Nejad: Say: “You will not be questioned about what we have done wrong, and we will not be questioned about what you do.”

26.Bakhtiari Nejad: Say: “Our Lord brings us together, then He judges between us in truth, and He is the knowledgeable judge.”

27.Bakhtiari Nejad: Say: “Show me those you joined with Him as associates. No way, but He is God, the powerful and the wise.”

28.Bakhtiari Nejad: And We did not send you except as a giver of good news and a warner for all people, but most people do not know.

29.Bakhtiari Nejad: And they say: “When is this promise if you are truthful?”

30.Bakhtiari Nejad: Say: “You have an appointment of a day which you cannot put it back for an hour or put it forward.”

31.Bakhtiari Nejad: And those who disbelieve say: “We will never believe in this Quran, or in what (came) before it.” And if you (could) see when the wrongdoers are standing before their Lord, returning the word to each other (and arguing), those who were weak will say to those who were arrogant: “If it was not for you, we would have certainly been believers.”

32.Bakhtiari Nejad: Those who were arrogant will say to those who were weak: “Did we block you from the guidance after it came to you? No, but you were guilty.”

33.Bakhtiari Nejad: And those who were weak will say to those who were arrogant: “No, but (it was your) plot by night and day, when you ordered us to disbelieve in God and to set up equals for Him.” And they will hide the regret when they see the punishment, and We put the shackles around the necks of those who disbelieved. Are they punished except for what they were doing?

34.Bakhtiari Nejad: And We did not send any warner in any town, unless its rich (and wealthy) said: “Indeed we disbelieve in what you are sent with it.”

35.Bakhtiari Nejad: And they said: “We have more wealth and children, and we will not be punished.”

36.Bakhtiari Nejad: Say: “Indeed my Lord increases and decreases the provision for anyone He wants, but most people do not know.”

37.Bakhtiari Nejad: And it is not your wealth and not your children that bring you closer to Us in position, but anyone who believes and does good, then they will have double/multiple reward for what they did, and they will be safe (and secure) in the chambers (of paradise).

38.Bakhtiari Nejad: And those who try to disable (and invalidate) Our signs, they are brought into the punishment.

39.Bakhtiari Nejad: Say: “Indeed my Lord increases and decreases the provision for anyone He wants among His servants, and anything you spend (in God's way), He replaces it, and He is the best of providers.”

40.Bakhtiari Nejad: And on the day when He gathers them altogether, He says to the angels: “Did these used to serve you?”

41.Bakhtiari Nejad: They say: “You are flawless (glory to You), You are our protector, not them. No, but they used to serve the Jinn, and most of them were believers in them.”

42.Bakhtiari Nejad: So, today you do not have any benefit or harm for one another, and We say to those who did wrong: “Taste the punishment of fire that you used to deny.”

43.Bakhtiari Nejad: And when Our clear signs are read to them, they say: “This is only a man who wants to prevent you from what your fathers used to serve.” And they say: “This is only a fabricated lie.” And those who disbelieve say about the truth when it comes to them: “This is only an obvious magic.”

44.Bakhtiari Nejad: And We did not give them any books to study, and We did not send any warner to them before you.

45.Bakhtiari Nejad: And those before them also denied, and they have not reached one tenth of what We had given them (their predecessors), yet they denied My messengers, so how was My rejection (and their punishment)?

46.Bakhtiari Nejad: Say: “I only advise you of one thing, that you rise up for God in twos or (as) individuals, then think that your friend is not mad, he is only a warner for you about a severe punishment that is at hand (and is coming).”

47.Bakhtiari Nejad: Say: “Whatever wage I asked you, it is yours, my wage is only God's responsibility, and He is witness over everything.”

48.Bakhtiari Nejad: Say: “Indeed, my Lord shows the truth, He knows the unseen.”

49.Bakhtiari Nejad: Say: “The truth has come and the falsehood does not begin (any creation) and it does not return (anything).”

50.Bakhtiari Nejad: Say: “If I go wrong, then I go wrong only against myself, and if I am guided then it is because of what my Lord reveals to me. Indeed, He hears all and is near.”

51.Bakhtiari Nejad: And if you could see when they are scared but there is no escape and they are taken from a nearby place,

52.Bakhtiari Nejad: and they say: “We believe in it.” But how can they attain it from a faraway place?

53.Bakhtiari Nejad: And indeed, they disbelieved in it in the past, and accused (and cast doubt about) the unseen from a faraway place.

54.Bakhtiari Nejad: And a barrier will be put between them and what they desire (to make their desire impossible), as was done with their kind in the past. Indeed, they were in a disturbing doubt.

1.Bakhtiari Nejad: All praise belongs to God, creator of the skies and the earth, Who appointed the angels as messengers, having two, three, and four wings. He adds to creation whatever He wants. Indeed, God is capable of everything.

2.Bakhtiari Nejad: Whatever God opens to the people from mercy, there is no withholder for it, and whatever He withholds, there is no sender for it after Him. And He is the powerful and the wise.

3.Bakhtiari Nejad: People, remember God’s favor upon you. Is there any creator other than God who provides for you from the sky and the earth? There is no god except Him, so how do you deviate (from the truth)?

4.Bakhtiari Nejad: And if they deny you, (know that) messengers before you were also denied. And all affairs are returned to God.

5.Bakhtiari Nejad: People, indeed God’s promise is true, so do not let this world’s life deceive you, and do not let the deceiver (Satan) deceive you about God.

6.Bakhtiari Nejad: Indeed, Satan is your enemy, so take him as an enemy. He only invites his party so that they become among inhabitants of the burning fire.

7.Bakhtiari Nejad: Those who disbelieve have a severe punishment, and those who believe and do good have forgiveness and a great reward.

8.Bakhtiari Nejad: Is someone whose bad work is beautified for him to see it good (like someone who is not)? Indeed, God misguides anyone He wants and guides anyone He wants, so do not kill yourself regretting for them. Indeed, God knows what they do.

9.Bakhtiari Nejad: God is the One Who sends the winds, then they put the clouds in motion, then We drive them to a dead land and with it We bring the earth back to life after its death. The Resurrection is like that.

10.Bakhtiari Nejad: Anyone who wants honor/power, (should know that) all honor/power belongs to God, the good talk goes up to Him, and the good deed raises it up. And those who plot the bad (things) have a severe punishment, and their plot leads to nothing.

11.Bakhtiari Nejad: And God created you from dust, then from fertilized egg (zygote), then He made you couples. And no female carries (and gets pregnant) and does not give birth without His knowledge. And anyone who is given life is not given a long life or his life is not shortened unless it is (recorded) in a book. Indeed, that is easy for God.

12.Bakhtiari Nejad: And the two seas are not the same. Drink of this one is fresh, sweet and pleasant, and that one salty and bitter. And you eat fresh meat (fish) from both, and you bring out jewelry that you wear, and you see ships slicing (and sailing) through them so that you look for His bounty, and so that you may be thankful.

13.Bakhtiari Nejad: He makes the night pass through the day and makes the day pass through the night, and He regulates the sun and the moon, each running (its course) in a finite time. This is God, your Lord, the rule belongs to Him. And those whom you call on besides Him do not own the skin of a date pit.

14.Bakhtiari Nejad: If you call on them, they do not hear your call, and even if they hear, they will not answer you, and on the Resurrection Day they deny your associating (them as God's partners). And no one tells you like the well-informed (God).

15.Bakhtiari Nejad: People, you are in need of God, and God is the rich (without need) and the praiseworthy.

16.Bakhtiari Nejad: If He wants, He does away with you and brings a new creation.

17.Bakhtiari Nejad: And that is not difficult for God.

18.Bakhtiari Nejad: And no bearer bears burden of another. And if one with heavy load (of burdens) calls on (others) to carry it, nothing of it is carried even if they are relatives. You can only warn those who secretly fear their Lord and perform mandatory prayer. And anyone who purifies (and absolves) then he only purifies for himself. And the final return is to God.

19.Bakhtiari Nejad: And the blind and the seeing are not equal,

20.Bakhtiari Nejad: neither are the darkness and the light,

21.Bakhtiari Nejad: nor are the shade and the (sun’s) heat.

22.Bakhtiari Nejad: And the living and the dead are not equal. Indeed, God makes anyone He wants listen. And you cannot make those who are in the graves listen.

23.Bakhtiari Nejad: You are only a warner.

24.Bakhtiari Nejad: Indeed, We have sent you with the truth as a giver of good news and as a warner. And there is not any community unless a warner has passed through it.

25.Bakhtiari Nejad: And if they deny you, (know that) those before them also denied (their messengers even though) their messengers brought them clear evidences and the scriptures and the enlightening book.

26.Bakhtiari Nejad: Then I took those who disbelieved, so how was My rejection (and their punishment)?

27.Bakhtiari Nejad: Do you not see that God sends down the rain from the sky, then We bring out produce of various colors with it, and some of the mountains have streaks of white and red, various colors and dark black.

28.Bakhtiari Nejad: And likewise, people and creatures and livestock are different colors. Only the knowledgeable among His servants fear (the punishment of) God. God is powerful and forgiving.

29.Bakhtiari Nejad: Indeed, those who read God’s book, and perform mandatory prayer and spend (in God's way) secretly and openly from what We have provided for them, hope for a trade that would never fail,

30.Bakhtiari Nejad: that He pays them back their rewards in full and increases them (their reward) from His grace. He is forgiving and appreciative.

31.Bakhtiari Nejad: And what We revealed to you from the book is the truth, confirming what is before it. God is certainly well-informed and watchful of His servants.

32.Bakhtiari Nejad: Then We gave the book as inheritance to those whom We chose among Our servants, and some of them were wrongdoer to themselves, and some of them were moderate, and some of them exceeded in good deeds by God’s permission. That is the great grace.

33.Bakhtiari Nejad: (Their reward is) eternal gardens which they will enter them, and they will be decorated with bracelets of gold and pearl in them, and their clothes will be silk in them.

34.Bakhtiari Nejad: And they say: “All praise belongs to God, the One Who removed the sadness from us, our Lord is certainly forgiving and appreciative,

35.Bakhtiari Nejad: the One Who settled us in the everlasting house out of His grace, suffering would not touch us in it and fatigue would not touch us in it.”

36.Bakhtiari Nejad: And those who disbelieve, they will have fire of hell. It will not be decided for them that they die (to stop the punishment), and its punishment will not be reduced for them. That is how We punish every ungrateful one.

37.Bakhtiari Nejad: And they cry out in it: “Our Lord, bring us out, we will do good, unlike what we used to do.” (They will be told:) “Didn't We make your life long enough so that anyone who takes notice would take notice in it, and the warner came to you? So, taste (the punishment), for there is no helper for the wrongdoers.”

38.Bakhtiari Nejad: Indeed, God is knower of the unseen (secrets) of the skies and the earth. He knows what is inside the chests/minds.

39.Bakhtiari Nejad: He is the One Who made you successors on the earth. So, anyone who disbelieves, then his disbelief is against him. And disbelief of the disbelievers only increases disgust in their Lord’s view, and disbelief of the disbelievers only increases (their) loss.

40.Bakhtiari Nejad: Say: “What do you think of your partners (of God), those you called on besides God? Show me what they created on the earth, or do they have any share (in the creation) of the skies, or have We given them a book so they are upon a clear evidence from that?” No, but the wrongdoers only promise each other a delusion.

41.Bakhtiari Nejad: Indeed, God keeps the skies and the earth so that they do not stop (functioning), and if they stop, no one can keep them (functioning) after Him. He is patient and forgiving.

42.Bakhtiari Nejad: And they solemnly swore by God that if a warner comes to them, they shall become better guided than any of the communities. But when a warner came to them, it only increased their disgust,

43.Bakhtiari Nejad: being arrogant on the earth and plotting bad (things). But the bad plot only falls on its people (who plotted it). So, are they looking for (anything) other than the way of (dealing with) the earlier ones? And you will never find any change in God’s way, and you will never find any revision in God’s way.

44.Bakhtiari Nejad: Or have they not traveled throughout the earth to see what the end of those before them was, and they were more powerful than them? And God is not made powerless by anything in the skies or on the earth. Indeed, He is knowledgeable and capable.

45.Bakhtiari Nejad: And if God takes (punishes) people for what they have done, He will not leave a living creature on its back, but He postpones them (their punishment) for a limited period. And when their appointed time comes, then indeed God is observant of His servants.

1.Bakhtiari Nejad: Y. S. (Ya. Sin.)

2.Bakhtiari Nejad: By the wise Quran,

3.Bakhtiari Nejad: indeed you are one of the messengers,

4.Bakhtiari Nejad: on a straight path.

5.Bakhtiari Nejad: (Quran is) a sent down by the powerful and the merciful,

6.Bakhtiari Nejad: so that you warn a people whose fathers were not warned, therefore they are negligent.

7.Bakhtiari Nejad: Certainly, the word is justified against most of them, for they would not believe.

8.Bakhtiari Nejad: Indeed, We put shackles around their necks, and it is up to the chins, so their heads are raised (and they cannot see ahead of them).

9.Bakhtiari Nejad: And We have put an obstacle in front of them and an obstacle behind them and We have covered them (their eyes), so they do not see.

10.Bakhtiari Nejad: And it is the same to them whether you warn them or do not warn them, they will not believe.

11.Bakhtiari Nejad: You (can) only warn someone who follows the reminder (Quran) and secretly fears the beneficent, so give him good news of forgiveness and a noble reward.

12.Bakhtiari Nejad: Indeed, We give life to the dead and We write what they send ahead and they leave behind, and We keep track of everything in a clear logbook.

13.Bakhtiari Nejad: And give them an example of inhabitants of the town when the messengers came to it.

14.Bakhtiari Nejad: When We sent them two, they denied them both, so We empowered them with a third, and they said: “Indeed, we are sent to you.”

15.Bakhtiari Nejad: They said: “You are only a human being like us, and the beneficent has not sent down anything, you are only lying.”

16.Bakhtiari Nejad: And they said: “Our Lord knows that indeed we are sent to you,

17.Bakhtiari Nejad: and our responsibility is only delivering (the message) clearly.”

18.Bakhtiari Nejad: They said: “We consider you as bad omen, if you do not stop, we shall stone you and a painful punishment by us shall touch you.”

19.Bakhtiari Nejad: They said: “Your bad omen is with yourselves. Is it because you are reminded (that you say this)? No, but you are excessive people.”

20.Bakhtiari Nejad: And a man came running from farthest part of the city. He said: “My people, follow the messengers.

21.Bakhtiari Nejad: Follow those who do not ask you for any wage, and they are guided.

22.Bakhtiari Nejad: And why should I not serve the One Who created me, and you are returned to Him?

23.Bakhtiari Nejad: Should I take gods other than Him? If the beneficent wants any harm for me, their mediation would not be of any use to me at all and they would not save me.

24.Bakhtiari Nejad: Then, I am certainly in obvious error.

25.Bakhtiari Nejad: Indeed, I have believed in your Lord, so listen to me.”

26.Bakhtiari Nejad: (After his death) he was told: “Enter the garden.” He said: “I wish my people knew

27.Bakhtiari Nejad: how my Lord forgave me and made me of the honored ones.”

28.Bakhtiari Nejad: And We did not send down any troops from the sky against his people after him, and We were not to send down (the troops against his people).

29.Bakhtiari Nejad: It was only a single awful blast, then they were immediately silenced.

30.Bakhtiari Nejad: Unfortunate for the servants (of Me), no messenger came to them unless they used to ridicule him.

31.Bakhtiari Nejad: Did they not see how many generations We destroyed before them, that they will not return to them?

32.Bakhtiari Nejad: And they are all brought before Us, every one of them.

33.Bakhtiari Nejad: And the dead earth is a sign for them, We bring it back to life and We bring grain out of it and they eat from it.

34.Bakhtiari Nejad: And We have made gardens of date palms and grapes in it, and We have made the springs flow out of it.

35.Bakhtiari Nejad: So that they eat from its produce and what their hands made it. So, will they not be thankful?

36.Bakhtiari Nejad: Glory to the One Who created all the pairs/varieties (of things), such as what the earth grows and themselves, and what they do not know.

37.Bakhtiari Nejad: And the night is a sign for them, We strip off the daylight from it, and then they are in darkness.

38.Bakhtiari Nejad: And the sun circulates in its place of stay (in its orbit). That is the ordinance of the powerful and the knowledgeable.

39.Bakhtiari Nejad: And the moon, We determined phases for it until it returns like the old (dried out) date branch.

40.Bakhtiari Nejad: It is not appropriate (or required) of the sun to catch up with the moon, and not the night to get ahead of the day, and each flow in an orbit.

41.Bakhtiari Nejad: And a sign for them is that We carried their descendants in the loaded ship,

42.Bakhtiari Nejad: and We created the like of it for them that they ride.

43.Bakhtiari Nejad: And if We want, We drown them, then they have no one to cry out to, and they will not be saved,

44.Bakhtiari Nejad: except by a mercy from Us, and as an enjoyment for a while.

45.Bakhtiari Nejad: And when it is said to them: “Be cautious of what is in front of you and what is behind you so that you may receive mercy (they do not pay attention).”

46.Bakhtiari Nejad: And no sign of their Lord's sign came to them, unless they were turning away from it.

47.Bakhtiari Nejad: And when it is said to them: “Spend (in God's way) from what God provided for you” those who disbelieve say to those who believe: “Shall we feed someone that if God wanted He would have fed him? You are only in an obvious error.”

48.Bakhtiari Nejad: And they say: “When is this promise, if you are truthful?”

49.Bakhtiari Nejad: They only await a single awful blast which takes them while they dispute,

50.Bakhtiari Nejad: then they will not be able to make any instruction (as their will) and they will not return to their families.

51.Bakhtiari Nejad: And the horn is blown, then immediately they rush to their Lord from the graves.

52.Bakhtiari Nejad: They say: “Woe to us, who raised us from our resting place (graves)? This is what the beneficent promised, and the messengers told the truth.”

53.Bakhtiari Nejad: It is only a single awful blast, then immediately all of them are brought before Us.

54.Bakhtiari Nejad: And on this day, no one will be wronged at all, and you will be rewarded only for what you used to do.

55.Bakhtiari Nejad: Indeed, inhabitants of the garden will be happily busy on this day,

56.Bakhtiari Nejad: they and their spouses will be leaning on sofas in the shade.

57.Bakhtiari Nejad: They will have fruits in there and whatever they call for.

58.Bakhtiari Nejad: Peace (and well-being) is the word of merciful Lord (to them).

59.Bakhtiari Nejad: And you the guilty ones, will split up on this day.

60.Bakhtiari Nejad: Children of Adam, did I not charge you that you should not serve Satan? Indeed, he is your obvious enemy.

61.Bakhtiari Nejad: And that you should (only) serve Me. This is a straight path.

62.Bakhtiari Nejad: And he certainly misguided a great number of you. Did you not use to understand?

63.Bakhtiari Nejad: This is hell that you were promised.

64.Bakhtiari Nejad: Enter (and burn in) it today, because of what you used to disbelieve.

65.Bakhtiari Nejad: We set a seal on (and shut) their mouth today, and their hands speak to Us and their feet testify to what they were doing.

66.Bakhtiari Nejad: And if We wanted, We would have wiped out their eyes, then they would have competed toward the path, but how would they see (the right path)?

67.Bakhtiari Nejad: And if We wanted, We would have immobilized them in their places, and they would not be able to proceed or return.

68.Bakhtiari Nejad: And anyone We give him a long life, We reverse him in the creation (and make him weak), so do they not understand?

69.Bakhtiari Nejad: And We did not teach him the poetry, and it is not appropriate for him. This is only a reminder and a clear (and clarifying) Quran,

70.Bakhtiari Nejad: to warn anyone who is alive and to prove the word (of God) against the disbelievers.

71.Bakhtiari Nejad: Or did they not see that We created livestock for them, by what Our hands (power) did, and they are their owners?

72.Bakhtiari Nejad: And We tamed them for them, and some of them are their rides and they eat some of them.

73.Bakhtiari Nejad: And there are (other) benefits and beverages for them in them, so would they not thank?

74.Bakhtiari Nejad: And they took gods besides God so that they may be helped,

75.Bakhtiari Nejad: they (those gods) cannot help them, while they are present for them (their gods) as (ready and loyal) troops.

76.Bakhtiari Nejad: So, do not be sad by their saying. Indeed, We know what they hide and what they disclose.

77.Bakhtiari Nejad: Or does the human being not consider that We created him from a fertilized egg (zygote), and now he is an obvious adversary?

78.Bakhtiari Nejad: And he gives Us an example, and forgets his creation, he says: “Who gives life to the bones when they are decomposed?”

79.Bakhtiari Nejad: Say: “The One Who gave them life creating them the first time, and He knows every (kind of) creation,

80.Bakhtiari Nejad: the One Who made fire for you from the green tree, and then you light (fire) from it.”

81.Bakhtiari Nejad: Or is the One Who created the skies and the earth not able to create similar to them? Yes, and He is the knowledgeable creator.

82.Bakhtiari Nejad: When He wants anything, His order for it is only to say: “Be” and it will be.

83.Bakhtiari Nejad: So, glory to the One that kingdom of everything is in His hand, and you are returned to Him.

37.SurahEnglishNames: Those Who Set The Ranks, Drawn up in Ranks, The Rangers

1.Bakhtiari Nejad: By those who lined up in rows,

2.Bakhtiari Nejad: and those who drive away (evil or clouds) strongly,

3.Bakhtiari Nejad: and those reading a reminder,

4.Bakhtiari Nejad: that your god is certainly One,

5.Bakhtiari Nejad: the Lord of the skies and the earth and whatever between them, and the Lord of the easts.

6.Bakhtiari Nejad: Indeed, We beautified the sky of the world with beauty of the stars

7.Bakhtiari Nejad: and as a guard against every defiant devil.

8.Bakhtiari Nejad: They cannot listen to the high assembly, for they are pelted from every side,

9.Bakhtiari Nejad: chased away, and they will have an everlasting punishment,

10.Bakhtiari Nejad: except someone who snatches (and overhears) the snatch (the word), then a piercing shooting flame follows him.

11.Bakhtiari Nejad: So, ask their opinion: “Are they a harder creation or those whom We created (such as angels and the universe)?” Indeed, We created them from sticky clay.

12.Bakhtiari Nejad: Rather, you are surprised while they ridicule.

13.Bakhtiari Nejad: And when they are reminded, they do not take notice.

14.Bakhtiari Nejad: And when they see a sign they ridicule,

15.Bakhtiari Nejad: and they say: “This is only an obvious magic,

16.Bakhtiari Nejad: will we be raised after we are dead and turned into dust and bones,

17.Bakhtiari Nejad: or our forefathers?”

18.Bakhtiari Nejad: Say: “Yes, and you will be humiliated.”

19.Bakhtiari Nejad: It is only a single shout, and then they see,

20.Bakhtiari Nejad: and they say: “Woe to us, this is the Judgment Day.”

21.Bakhtiari Nejad: This is the day of separation/decision, the one that you used to deny.

22.Bakhtiari Nejad: Gather those who did wrong and their kinds and what they used to serve

23.Bakhtiari Nejad: besides God, and lead them to the path of hellfire.

24.Bakhtiari Nejad: And stop them (on the way), indeed they are questioned (and are responsible).

25.Bakhtiari Nejad: What is with you that you do not help each other?

26.Bakhtiari Nejad: No, but today they are surrendered.

27.Bakhtiari Nejad: And they turn to each other asking one another,

28.Bakhtiari Nejad: they say: “Indeed, you were coming to us from the right (to seduce us).”

29.Bakhtiari Nejad: They (the others) say: “No, but you were not believers,

30.Bakhtiari Nejad: and there was no authority for us over you, but you were rebellious people,

31.Bakhtiari Nejad: so, the word of our Lord is justified against us, indeed we will taste (the punishment).

32.Bakhtiari Nejad: So, we misled you, as we were indeed misled.”

33.Bakhtiari Nejad: And indeed, on that day they are partners in the punishment.

34.Bakhtiari Nejad: Indeed, that is what We do to the guilty ones.

35.Bakhtiari Nejad: Indeed, when it was said to them there is no god except God, they were arrogant (and did not accept).

36.Bakhtiari Nejad: And they would say: “Should we give up our gods for a mad poet?”

37.Bakhtiari Nejad: No, but he brought the truth and confirmed the messengers (before him).

38.Bakhtiari Nejad: Indeed, you will taste the painful punishment.

39.Bakhtiari Nejad: And you are only punished for what you used to do.

40.Bakhtiari Nejad: Except for God's devoted servants.

41.Bakhtiari Nejad: They have a known provision,

42.Bakhtiari Nejad: (all kinds of) fruits, and they are honored

43.Bakhtiari Nejad: in the gardens of delight,

44.Bakhtiari Nejad: on sofas facing each other.

45.Bakhtiari Nejad: A cup of spring water is circulated among them,

46.Bakhtiari Nejad: white and delicious for the drinkers,

47.Bakhtiari Nejad: no sickness in it, and they do not get exhausted (and drunk) from it.

48.Bakhtiari Nejad: And with them will be girls with restrained glances and beautiful eyes,

49.Bakhtiari Nejad: as if they were protected eggs (or pearls).

50.Bakhtiari Nejad: And they turn to each other asking one another.

51.Bakhtiari Nejad: A talker among them says: “Indeed, I had a close friend”

52.Bakhtiari Nejad: saying: “Are you among those confirming (the Resurrection and the Judgment)?

53.Bakhtiari Nejad: Would we indeed be judged when we die and become dust and bones?”

54.Bakhtiari Nejad: He says: “Do you know (where he is)?”

55.Bakhtiari Nejad: Then he looks and sees him in the middle of hellfire.

56.Bakhtiari Nejad: He says: “By God, you almost ruined me,

57.Bakhtiari Nejad: and if it was not for my Lord’s favor, I would have certainly been of those who are brought (to hell).

58.Bakhtiari Nejad: Are we not to die (again)

59.Bakhtiari Nejad: except our first death, and we are not punished?

60.Bakhtiari Nejad: Indeed, this is the great victory.”

61.Bakhtiari Nejad: For (something) like this, the doers should do (good deeds).

62.Bakhtiari Nejad: Is this a better reception or the Zaqqum tree?

63.Bakhtiari Nejad: Indeed, We made it a suffering for the wrongdoers.

64.Bakhtiari Nejad: It is a tree that comes out from the bottom of hellfire,

65.Bakhtiari Nejad: its bud is like devils’ heads.

66.Bakhtiari Nejad: And they certainly eat from it and fill their stomachs from it.

67.Bakhtiari Nejad: Then indeed they will have a mixture of boiling water (to drink) over it.

68.Bakhtiari Nejad: Then their return will be to the hellfire.

69.Bakhtiari Nejad: Indeed, they found their fathers misguided,

70.Bakhtiari Nejad: and yet they rushed (to follow) in their footsteps.

71.Bakhtiari Nejad: And most of the earlier ones have certainly lost (the right path) before them.

72.Bakhtiari Nejad: And We have certainly sent warners among them.

73.Bakhtiari Nejad: So, see what the end of those who were warned was,

74.Bakhtiari Nejad: except God's devoted servants.

75.Bakhtiari Nejad: And Noah had certainly called Us, and We are certainly the best of responders.

76.Bakhtiari Nejad: And We saved him and his family from the great distress.

77.Bakhtiari Nejad: And We made his descendants the survivors.

78.Bakhtiari Nejad: And We left for him (a good name) among the later ones.

79.Bakhtiari Nejad: Peace (and well-being) upon Noah among humankind.

80.Bakhtiari Nejad: That is how We reward the good doers.

81.Bakhtiari Nejad: Indeed, he was among Our believing servants.

82.Bakhtiari Nejad: So, We drowned the others.

83.Bakhtiari Nejad: And indeed among his followers was Abraham.

84.Bakhtiari Nejad: When he came to his Lord with a sound heart.

85.Bakhtiari Nejad: When he said to his father and his people: “What do you serve?

86.Bakhtiari Nejad: Do you want false gods besides God?

87.Bakhtiari Nejad: So, what do you think about the Lord of humankind?”

88.Bakhtiari Nejad: Then he looked a glance at the stars.

89.Bakhtiari Nejad: Then he said: “Indeed I am sick (of your practices).”

90.Bakhtiari Nejad: So, they turned back from him going away.

91.Bakhtiari Nejad: Then he turned to their gods and said: “Will you not eat?

92.Bakhtiari Nejad: What is with you, why do you not speak?”

93.Bakhtiari Nejad: Then he turned on them, striking (them) with the right hand.

94.Bakhtiari Nejad: So, they (his people) came to him in a hurry.

95.Bakhtiari Nejad: He said: “Do you serve what you carve,

96.Bakhtiari Nejad: while God created you and what you do (and make)?”

97.Bakhtiari Nejad: They said: “Build a structure (a furnace) for him and throw him into the great fire.”

98.Bakhtiari Nejad: They wanted to plot against him, but We made them the lower ones (failing in their plot).

99.Bakhtiari Nejad: And he said: “Indeed I will go to my Lord, He is going to guide me,

100.Bakhtiari Nejad: my Lord, give me (a son) from the righteous.”

101.Bakhtiari Nejad: So, We gave him the good news of a patient boy.

102.Bakhtiari Nejad: So, when he reached the (age of) working with him, he said: “My son, indeed I saw in the dream that I sacrifice you, so see what you think?” He said: “My father, do what you are ordered, God willing you are going to find me of the patient ones.”

103.Bakhtiari Nejad: So, when they both submitted and he (Abraham) put him down on the forehead,

105.Bakhtiari Nejad: you have fulfilled the vision.” Indeed, that is how We reward the good doers.

106.Bakhtiari Nejad: Indeed, this was the obvious test,

107.Bakhtiari Nejad: and We ransomed him with a great sacrifice.

108.Bakhtiari Nejad: And We left for him (a good name) among the later ones.

110.Bakhtiari Nejad: That is how We reward the good doers.

111.Bakhtiari Nejad: Indeed, he was among Our believing servants.

112.Bakhtiari Nejad: And We gave him good news of Isaac, a prophet from the righteous.

113.Bakhtiari Nejad: And We blessed him and Isaac, and from their descendants, (some) are good doers and (some) are obviously wrongdoers to themselves.

114.Bakhtiari Nejad: And We have certainly favored upon Moses and Aaron.

115.Bakhtiari Nejad: And We saved them both and their people from the great distress.

116.Bakhtiari Nejad: And We helped them, so they became the winners.

117.Bakhtiari Nejad: And We gave them the clear (and clarifying) book,

118.Bakhtiari Nejad: and We guided them to the straight path.

119.Bakhtiari Nejad: And We left both of them (a good name) among the later ones.

120.Bakhtiari Nejad: Peace (and well-being) on Moses and Aaron.

121.Bakhtiari Nejad: Indeed, that is how We reward the good doers.

122.Bakhtiari Nejad: Indeed, they were both among Our believing servants.

123.Bakhtiari Nejad: And indeed Elias (Elijah) was one of the messengers.

124.Bakhtiari Nejad: When he said to his people: “Will you not be cautious (of God)?

125.Bakhtiari Nejad: Do you call on Baal and you abandon the best of creators?

126.Bakhtiari Nejad: God is your Lord and the Lord of your forefathers.”

127.Bakhtiari Nejad: So, they denied him, therefore they will be brought (to the punishment),

129.Bakhtiari Nejad: And We left for him (a good name) among the later ones.

131.Bakhtiari Nejad: Indeed, that is how We reward the good doers.

132.Bakhtiari Nejad: Indeed, he was among Our believing servants.

133.Bakhtiari Nejad: And indeed, Lot was one of the messengers.

134.Bakhtiari Nejad: When We saved him and his family altogether.

135.Bakhtiari Nejad: Except an old woman (his wife who was) among those staying behind.

137.Bakhtiari Nejad: And indeed, you pass by them in the morning

138.Bakhtiari Nejad: and by the night. Do you not understand?

139.Bakhtiari Nejad: And indeed, Jonah was one of the messengers.

140.Bakhtiari Nejad: When he ran away to the loaded ship.

141.Bakhtiari Nejad: Then he drew lots and he was of those thrown off (the ship).

142.Bakhtiari Nejad: So, the whale swallowed him, and he was to blame.

143.Bakhtiari Nejad: And if he was not among those who glorify (God),

144.Bakhtiari Nejad: he would have remained in its belly until the day of rising.

145.Bakhtiari Nejad: So, We threw him on the bare shore while he was sick.

146.Bakhtiari Nejad: And We made a plant of squash grow over him.

147.Bakhtiari Nejad: And We sent him to a hundred thousand or more (people).

148.Bakhtiari Nejad: And they believed, so We let them enjoy for a while.

149.Bakhtiari Nejad: So, ask their opinion: “Are daughters for your Lord, and sons for them?

150.Bakhtiari Nejad: Or did We create the angels as females, and they were witnesses?”

151.Bakhtiari Nejad: No doubt, indeed, as part of their lies they will say:

152.Bakhtiari Nejad: “God has fathered (children).” And they are certainly liars.

153.Bakhtiari Nejad: Did He choose daughters over sons?

154.Bakhtiari Nejad: What is with you? How do you judge?

156.Bakhtiari Nejad: Or do you have a clear reason?

157.Bakhtiari Nejad: Then bring your book (document), if you are truthful.

158.Bakhtiari Nejad: And they have made a relationship between Him and the Jinn, while the Jinn certainly knew that they shall be brought (to judgment),

159.Bakhtiari Nejad: God is flawless about what they describe,

160.Bakhtiari Nejad: except God's devoted servants (who are saved from the punishment).

161.Bakhtiari Nejad: So indeed, you and what you serve,

162.Bakhtiari Nejad: you will not be able to mislead (any of God's devoted servants) against Him,

163.Bakhtiari Nejad: except someone who enters (and burns in) the hellfire.

164.Bakhtiari Nejad: And (the angels say:) “No one is from us unless he has a known position,

165.Bakhtiari Nejad: and we are certainly those lined up in rows,

166.Bakhtiari Nejad: and we are certainly those who glorify (God).”

167.Bakhtiari Nejad: And they (the disbelievers) certainly used to say:

168.Bakhtiari Nejad: “Indeed, if we had a reminder (or a scripture) from the earlier ones with us,

169.Bakhtiari Nejad: we would have certainly been of God's devoted servants.”

170.Bakhtiari Nejad: And they disbelieved in it (Quran), so they will know.

171.Bakhtiari Nejad: And Our word has already gone out to Our servants, the messengers,

173.Bakhtiari Nejad: and indeed, Our troops are the winners.

174.Bakhtiari Nejad: So, turn away from them for a while,

175.Bakhtiari Nejad: and look at them, for they will see.

176.Bakhtiari Nejad: Do they want Our punishment in a hurry?

177.Bakhtiari Nejad: When it comes down to their courtyard, it is a bad morning for those who were warned.

178.Bakhtiari Nejad: And turn away from them for a while,

179.Bakhtiari Nejad: and look, for they will see.

180.Bakhtiari Nejad: Your Lord, the Lord of power (and honor), is flawless about what they describe.

181.Bakhtiari Nejad: And peace (and well-being) upon the messengers.

182.Bakhtiari Nejad: And all praise belongs to God, the Lord of humankind.

1.Bakhtiari Nejad: S. (Saad.) By the Quran, having reminders.

2.Bakhtiari Nejad: Yet those who disbelieve are in self-admiration and opposition.

3.Bakhtiari Nejad: How many generations did We destroy before them, and they called out (for help) and it was too late to escape?

4.Bakhtiari Nejad: And they are surprised that a warner has come to them from them, and the disbelievers say: “This is a lying magician.

5.Bakhtiari Nejad: Has he made the gods into one god? This is certainly a strange thing.”

6.Bakhtiari Nejad: And the leaders of them went off (saying:) “Go on and persevere about your gods, indeed this is certainly something wanted (and expected from you).

7.Bakhtiari Nejad: We did not hear this in the previous faith, this is only an invention.

8.Bakhtiari Nejad: Was the reminder (only) sent down to him among us?” No, they are in doubt about My reminder, rather they have not tasted My punishment.

9.Bakhtiari Nejad: Or the treasures of mercy of your Lord, the powerful and the giver, are with them?

10.Bakhtiari Nejad: Or do they have the rule of the skies and the earth and whatever between them? (If they do), then they should go up by the means (that they have).

11.Bakhtiari Nejad: They are an army of the parties defeated in there.

12.Bakhtiari Nejad: People of Noah and Aad and Pharaoh, the owners of the stakes (pyramids), denied before them.

13.Bakhtiari Nejad: And Thamud and people of Lot and the inhabitants of the woods (people of Shu'aib/Jethro), they were the parties (that denied the messengers).

14.Bakhtiari Nejad: They all denied the messengers, so they deserved My punishment.

15.Bakhtiari Nejad: And these are only awaiting a single awful blast, which there would not be any delay for it (or any comeback).

16.Bakhtiari Nejad: And they say: “Our Lord, rush us our share (of punishment) before the day of reckoning.”

17.Bakhtiari Nejad: Be patient about what they say, and remember Our servant David having the power, indeed he was repentant.

18.Bakhtiari Nejad: Indeed, We controlled the mountains to glorify (Us) with him in the evening and the sunrise.

19.Bakhtiari Nejad: And the birds gathering, all returning to him (to glorify God).

20.Bakhtiari Nejad: And We strengthened his kingdom, and We gave him wisdom and the decisive (and expressive) speech.

21.Bakhtiari Nejad: And did the news of the (two) adversaries come to you when they climbed the chamber?

22.Bakhtiari Nejad: When they entered upon David and he was afraid of them, they said: “Do not fear, we are two adversaries, one of us has wronged the other, so judge between us with the truth and do not be unfair, and guide us to the even (and right) path.

23.Bakhtiari Nejad: Indeed this is my brother, and he has ninety nine female sheep and I have a single female sheep and he says put her in my care, and he overpowers me in the speech.”

24.Bakhtiari Nejad: He (David) said: “He has certainly wronged you by asking (to add) your female sheep to his female sheep, and indeed most partners do wrong to one another, except those who believe and do good, and they are few.” And David assumed that We have tested him, so he asked forgiveness of his Lord, and fell down humbly and repented.

25.Bakhtiari Nejad: So, We forgave him that, and indeed he has closeness with Us and a good place of return.

26.Bakhtiari Nejad: David, indeed We made you a successor on the earth, so judge between people with truth and do not follow the desire, for it misguides you from God's way. Indeed, those who lose God's way have a severe punishment because they forgot the day of reckoning.

27.Bakhtiari Nejad: And We did not create the sky and the earth and whatever is between them without purpose. That is the thinking of those who disbelieve. So, woe to those who disbelieve, from the fire.

28.Bakhtiari Nejad: Or should We place those who believe and do good the same as the corruptors on the earth, or should We place those who are cautious (of God) the same as the immoral ones!?

29.Bakhtiari Nejad: (This is) a blessed book that We have sent it down to you, so that they think about its verses, and so that people of understanding take notice.

30.Bakhtiari Nejad: And We gave David, Solomon, an excellent servant, indeed he was repentant.

31.Bakhtiari Nejad: When he was presented with the stallions of excellent breed in the evening,

32.Bakhtiari Nejad: he said: “Indeed I liked the love of good (things) over remembrance of my Lord” until they disappeared behind the partition.

33.Bakhtiari Nejad: (He said:) “Bring them back to me.” Then he rubbed the legs and the necks (of the horses).

34.Bakhtiari Nejad: And We certainly tested Solomon by throwing a (dead) body on his chair, then he repented.

35.Bakhtiari Nejad: He said: “My Lord, forgive me, and give me a kingdom that is not likely for anyone after me, indeed you are the giver.”

36.Bakhtiari Nejad: Then We brought the wind under his control to blow gently by his command wherever he wanted,

37.Bakhtiari Nejad: and (also under his control) the devils, every builder and diver

38.Bakhtiari Nejad: and others, tied together in chains.

39.Bakhtiari Nejad: (We told him:) “This is Our gift, so give or keep without any limit.”

40.Bakhtiari Nejad: And indeed, he had closeness with Us and a good place of return.

41.Bakhtiari Nejad: And remember Our servant Job, when he called his Lord: “Indeed Satan has touched me with pain and suffering.”

42.Bakhtiari Nejad: (We told him:) “Stomp with your foot, this is cool water to wash and to drink.”

43.Bakhtiari Nejad: And We gave him his family and the like of them with them (doubled his family) as a mercy from Us and as a reminder for people of understanding.

44.Bakhtiari Nejad: (We told him:) “Take a bunch (of hay) in your hand and strike with it and do not break your oath.” Indeed, We found him patient, an excellent servant, indeed he was repentant.

45.Bakhtiari Nejad: And remember Our servants Abraham, Isaac and Jacob, men of power and insight.

46.Bakhtiari Nejad: And We made them devoted (to Us) through a pure (trait of) remembering the home (of the Hereafter).

47.Bakhtiari Nejad: And indeed, they are among the chosen and the good ones in Our view.

48.Bakhtiari Nejad: And remember Ishmael and Al-Yasa'a (Elisha) and Zul-kifl (man of the responsibility), all among the good ones.

49.Bakhtiari Nejad: This (Quran) is a reminder, and indeed those who are cautious (of God) have a good place of return.

50.Bakhtiari Nejad: Eternal gardens, with the doors open for them,

51.Bakhtiari Nejad: reclining (and relaxing) in there, they call for many fruits and drinks in there,

52.Bakhtiari Nejad: and there are girls of equal age and restrained glances with them.

53.Bakhtiari Nejad: This is what you are promised for the day of reckoning.

54.Bakhtiari Nejad: Indeed, this is Our provision, which there is no end to it.

55.Bakhtiari Nejad: This (is for the believers), but for the rebellious, there is a bad place of return.

56.Bakhtiari Nejad: Hell, a miserable resting place, they will enter (and burn in) there.

57.Bakhtiari Nejad: This is what they should taste it, boiling water and pus,

58.Bakhtiari Nejad: and other kinds of that type.

59.Bakhtiari Nejad: This is a group rushing (and pushing) with you (rebellious ones), there is no welcome for them, indeed they enter (and burn in) the fire.

60.Bakhtiari Nejad: They will say: “No, there is no welcome for you (either), you brought it upon us, and it is the miserable place to stay.”

61.Bakhtiari Nejad: They (will continue to) say: “Our Lord, whoever brought this upon us, then double/multiply his punishment in the fire.”

62.Bakhtiari Nejad: And they (the rebellious ones) will say: “What is with us, we do not see men whom we used to count among the bad ones?

63.Bakhtiari Nejad: Did we make fun of them (by mistake), or did the eyes overlook them?”

64.Bakhtiari Nejad: Indeed, this dispute of the people of fire is true.

65.Bakhtiari Nejad: Say: “I am only a warner, and there is no god except God, the One, the supreme (and dominant),

66.Bakhtiari Nejad: the Lord of the skies and the earth and whatever is between them, the powerful, the forgiver.”

67.Bakhtiari Nejad: Say: “It is a great news,

68.Bakhtiari Nejad: that you turn away from it,

69.Bakhtiari Nejad: I have no knowledge of the high assembly (angels) when they disputed,

70.Bakhtiari Nejad: it is only revealed to me that I am a clear warner.”

71.Bakhtiari Nejad: When your Lord said to the angels: “I am creator of a human being from clay,

72.Bakhtiari Nejad: so, when I shape him and blow My breath of life (or spirit) into him, then fall down prostrating (and humbly) before him.”

73.Bakhtiari Nejad: So the angels, all of them together, prostrated (and showed humbleness),

74.Bakhtiari Nejad: except Iblis (Satan) who was arrogant and became one of the disbelievers.

75.Bakhtiari Nejad: He (God) said: “Iblis, what prevented you from prostrating (and being humble) before what I created with My hands (and My power), are you arrogant or are you among the supreme ones?”

76.Bakhtiari Nejad: He said: “I am better than him, You created me from fire and You created him from clay.”

77.Bakhtiari Nejad: He (God) said: “Then, get out of here, indeed you are expelled,

78.Bakhtiari Nejad: and indeed, My curse is upon you until the Judgment Day.”

79.Bakhtiari Nejad: He said: “Give me time until the day they are raised.”

80.Bakhtiari Nejad: He (God) said: “Indeed you are of those given a delay,

81.Bakhtiari Nejad: until the known time.”

82.Bakhtiari Nejad: He said: “By Your honor (and power) I shall mislead them all,

83.Bakhtiari Nejad: except your devoted servants among them.”

84.Bakhtiari Nejad: He (God) said: “This is the truth and I say the truth,

85.Bakhtiari Nejad: I shall fill hell from you and from those of them who follow you, altogether.”

86.Bakhtiari Nejad: Say: “I do not ask you for any wage for it (delivering the message) and I am not of the pretenders (and the fake ones).

87.Bakhtiari Nejad: This (Quran) is only a reminder for humankind.

88.Bakhtiari Nejad: And you shall know its news after a while.”

1.Bakhtiari Nejad: Revelation of the book (Quran) is from God, the powerful, the wise.

2.Bakhtiari Nejad: Indeed, We sent down the book to you with the truth, so serve God, being sincere (and devoted) to Him in the way of life (religion).

3.Bakhtiari Nejad: Be aware that the devoted way of life (religion) is for God. And those who take protectors/masters other than Him (say:) “We only serve them so that they bring us closer to God.” Indeed, God judges between them in what they disagree about. Indeed, God does not guide anyone who is a disbelieving liar.

4.Bakhtiari Nejad: If God wanted to take a child (son), He would have chosen what He wants from what He creates. He is flawless, He is God, the One, the supreme (and dominant).

5.Bakhtiari Nejad: He created the skies and the earth with truth. He wraps the night over the day and wraps the day over the night and He controls the sun and the moon, each running (its course) for a finite time. Surely, He is the powerful, the forgiver.

6.Bakhtiari Nejad: He created you from a single being, then He made its spouse from it, and He sent down eight in pairs (four pairs) of livestock for you. He creates you in your mothers' wombs, creation after creation, in three (layers of) darkness. That is God, your Lord, the rule belongs to Him, there is no God except Him. So, how are you turned away?

7.Bakhtiari Nejad: If you disbelieve, (know that) indeed God does not need you (or your belief), and He is not pleased for the ungratefulness of His servants, and if you are thankful, He is pleased with you. No bearer bears the burden of another. Your return is to your Lord, and He informs you of what you were doing. Indeed, He knows what is inside the chests/minds.

8.Bakhtiari Nejad: And when a hardship touches human being, he calls on his Lord, turning to Him. Then when He gives him a favor from Himself, he forgets what he previously called Him for, and sets up equals for God to misguide (people) from His way. Say: “Enjoy a little with your disbelief, indeed you are among inhabitants of the fire.”

9.Bakhtiari Nejad: Is someone who is obedient, prostrating (and showing humbleness), standing (in prayer) during nighttime, fearing the Hereafter and hoping for his Lord’s mercy (better off or a disbeliever)? Say: “Are those who know and those who do not know equal?” Only people of understanding take notice.

10.Bakhtiari Nejad: Say: “My servants who believe, be cautious of your Lord. For those who do good in this world is a good (reward in this world or in the Hereafter), and God's earth is vast. Indeed, those who persevere are paid back their reward in full without any limit.”

11.Bakhtiari Nejad: Say: “Indeed I am ordered to serve God, being sincere (and devoted) to Him in the way of life (religion),

12.Bakhtiari Nejad: and I am ordered to be the first (and the best) of the submitted ones.”

13.Bakhtiari Nejad: Say: “Indeed I am afraid of the punishment of a great day if I disobey my Lord.”

14.Bakhtiari Nejad: Say: “Indeed I serve God, being sincere (and devoted) to Him in my way of life (religion),

15.Bakhtiari Nejad: so, (you idolaters) serve whatever you want besides Him.” Say: “Indeed the losers are those who lose themselves and their families on the Resurrection Day. No doubt, this is the obvious loss.”

16.Bakhtiari Nejad: They will have canopies of fire from above them and canopies (of fire) from beneath them. That is what God scares His servants with it. So My servants, be cautious of Me.

17.Bakhtiari Nejad: And those who avoid serving the rebellious ones and turn to God, they have the good news. Give the good news to My servants,

18.Bakhtiari Nejad: those who listen to the word and follow the best of it. They are those whom God has guided them, and they are people of understanding.

19.Bakhtiari Nejad: Can you save someone, whom the word of punishment is justified against him, from the fire?

20.Bakhtiari Nejad: But those who are cautious of their Lord will have chambers built over chambers, rivers flowing beneath them. (That is) God’s promise and God does not break His promise.

21.Bakhtiari Nejad: Do you not see that God sends down the rain from the sky and makes it flow as springs in the earth, then He produces crops of different colors with it, then they dry up and you see them turn yellow, then He makes them into debris? There is certainly a reminder in that for people of understanding.

22.Bakhtiari Nejad: Is someone whom God has opened his chest/minds for submission (Islam), and he is upon a light from his Lord (like someone who is not)? So, woe to those whose hearts are hardened against remembering God. They are in obvious error.

23.Bakhtiari Nejad: God sent down the best saying as a book, (with its verses) similar and often repeated, the skins of those who fear (disobeying) their Lord shiver from it, then their skins and their hearts relax by God's remembrance. That (Quran) is God’s guidance, He guides anyone He wants with it (according to His laws), and there is no guide for whomever God misguides.

24.Bakhtiari Nejad: Is someone who protects (himself) with his face against the terrible punishment of the Resurrection Day (same as one who has no punishment)? And it will be said to the wrongdoers: “Taste what you were earning.”

25.Bakhtiari Nejad: Those before them (also) denied, so the punishment came upon them from where they did not realize.

26.Bakhtiari Nejad: So, God made them taste the humiliation in this world’s life, and certainly the punishment of the Hereafter is greater, if they knew.

27.Bakhtiari Nejad: And We have certainly given every kind of example for the people in this Quran so that they may take notice.

28.Bakhtiari Nejad: An Arabic Quran without having any crookedness (or anomaly) so that they may be cautious (of God).

29.Bakhtiari Nejad: God gave an example of a man belonging to quarreling partners and a man fully belonging to one man. Are the two examples equal? All praise belongs to God. No, but most of them do not know.

30.Bakhtiari Nejad: Indeed, you die and indeed they die,

31.Bakhtiari Nejad: then you dispute before your Lord on the Resurrection Day.

32.Bakhtiari Nejad: Who is more wrong than someone who lies against God and denies the truth when it comes to him? Is there not a place for the disbelievers in hell?

33.Bakhtiari Nejad: And the one who brings the truth and those who confirm it, they are those who are cautious (of God).

34.Bakhtiari Nejad: They will have whatever they want with their Lord. That is reward of the good doers.

35.Bakhtiari Nejad: God will remove the worst of what they did from them, and He rewards them their wage with the best of what they were doing.

36.Bakhtiari Nejad: Is God not enough for His servant? And yet they scare you from those other than Him! And there is no guide for whomever God misguides.

37.Bakhtiari Nejad: And whomever God guides, then no one misguides him. Is not God powerful and revengeful?

38.Bakhtiari Nejad: And if you ask them who created the skies and the earth, they shall say: “God.” Say: “So, did you think that whatever you call on besides God are remover of His harm if God wants a harm for me, or are they withholder of His mercy if He wants a mercy for me?” Say: “God is enough for me, those who trust put their trust in Him.”

39.Bakhtiari Nejad: Say: “My people, do what you are capable of, indeed I am a doer (of what I should), you will know

40.Bakhtiari Nejad: to whom a punishment comes humiliating him, and on whom the lasting punishment befalls.”

41.Bakhtiari Nejad: Indeed, We sent down the book to you with the truth (as a guide) for people. So, whoever is guided, it is for himself (for his own benefit) and whoever loses (the right path) then he has only made an error against himself, and you are not their advocate.

42.Bakhtiari Nejad: God takes back the consciousness/souls at the time of their death, and the one who has not died, (He will take their consciousness/soul) in their sleep. He keeps the one whom He has decided death for them and sends the others back for a limited period. Indeed, there are signs in that for people who think.

43.Bakhtiari Nejad: Or did they take mediators besides God? Say: “Even though they do not own anything, and they do not understand?”

44.Bakhtiari Nejad: Say: “Mediation entirely belongs to God, the rule of the skies and the earth belongs to Him, then you are returned to Him (after death).”

45.Bakhtiari Nejad: And when God alone is mentioned, the hearts of those who do not believe in the Hereafter is disgusted, and when those other than Him are mentioned then they are glad.

46.Bakhtiari Nejad: Say: “God, creator of the skies and the earth, knower of the unseen (secrets) and the visible, You judge between Your servants about what they used to disagree about.”

47.Bakhtiari Nejad: And if those who did wrong had all that is on the earth and the like of it with it (twice as much), they would offer it as ransom for the bad punishment of the Resurrection Day. And what they were not counting on, will appear to them from God.

48.Bakhtiari Nejad: Badness of what they did appears to them, and what they used to ridicule surrounds them.

49.Bakhtiari Nejad: When harm touches human being, he calls on Us, then when We give him a favor from Us, he says: “I was only given it because of (my) knowledge. “No, rather it is a test and most of them do not know.

50.Bakhtiari Nejad: Those before them also said it, and what they were doing (their deeds) was of no use to them.

51.Bakhtiari Nejad: So, badness (and consequence) of what they did, struck them. And those who did wrong among these are (also) going to be struck by badness of what they did, and they cannot disable/escape it.

52.Bakhtiari Nejad: Or did they not know that God increases or decreases the provision for anyone He wants. Indeed, there are signs in that for people who believe.

53.Bakhtiari Nejad: Say: “My servants, those who have been excessive against themselves, do not lose hope of God’s mercy, indeed God forgives all sins, indeed He is the forgiving, the merciful.
