25.Bakhtiari Nejad: They are those who disbelieved, and obstructed you from the Sacred Mosque, and the offering was prevented to reach its place (of sacrifice). And (you would have attacked Mecca) if it was not for the believing men and believing women whom you did not know that you would have unknowingly trampled them and then you would have been afflicted by disgrace from them. For God admits anyone He wants into His mercy. If they (believers and disbelievers) were apart, We would have certainly punished those among them who disbelieved with a painful punishment.

26.Bakhtiari Nejad: When those who disbelieved put prejudice, the prejudice of the (days of) ignorance, in their hearts, then God sent down His calmness to His messenger and to the believers and made them keep the word of self control, and they were more deserving of it and suited for it. And God knows everything.

27.Bakhtiari Nejad: God has certainly proved the vision of His messenger with truth, that if God wants, you shall enter the Sacred Mosque having your heads shaved or (your hairs) shortened, safely and without being afraid. And He knew what you did not know, so He put a forthcoming victory besides that.

28.Bakhtiari Nejad: He is the One Who sent His messenger with the guidance and the right way of life (religion) in order to inform him about all of the religion (God's recommended way of life). And God is enough as a witness.

29.Bakhtiari Nejad: Muhammad is God's messenger, and those with him are firm against the disbelievers and kind among themselves. You see them bowing down, showing humbleness, looking for God’s grace and pleasure. Their mark (appearance) is in their faces from effect of the humbleness. That is their example in the Torah, and their example in the Gospel is like a seed that brings out its shoots then strengthens it then becomes thick then it stands on its stem impressing the farmers, therefore He angers the disbelievers with them. God has promised forgiveness and a great reward to those among them who believe and do good.

49.SurahEnglishNames: The Private Apartments, The Inner Apartments, The Chambers

1.Bakhtiari Nejad: You who believe, do not put (your opinion) ahead of God and His messenger and be cautious of God. Indeed, God hears all, knows all.

2.Bakhtiari Nejad: You who believe, do not raise you voices above the prophet's voice and do not talk to him loudly as you talk loudly to each other, that your works become useless while you do not realize.

3.Bakhtiari Nejad: Indeed, those who lower their voices before God’s messenger, they are those whom God tested their hearts for being cautious (of Him), they will have forgiveness and a great reward.

4.Bakhtiari Nejad: Indeed, those who call you from behind the chambers, most of them do not understand.

5.Bakhtiari Nejad: And if they wait until you come out to them, that is better for them. God is forgiving and merciful.

6.Bakhtiari Nejad: You who believe, if a disobedient one comes to you with any news, then clarify it so that you do not harm some people ignorantly, and you become sorry about what you did.

7.Bakhtiari Nejad: And know that God’s messenger is among you. If he obeys you in most of the matters, you would certainly be in trouble, but God made the belief pleasant to you and He beautified it in your hearts, and He made disbelief and disobedience and rebellion hateful to you. They are the rightly guided ones.

8.Bakhtiari Nejad: A grace and a favor from God, and God is knowledgeable and wise.

9.Bakhtiari Nejad: If two groups of the believers fight, then make peace between them, and if one of them treated the other unjustly then fight the one who did injustice until it returns to God’s command, and if it returned then make peace between them fairly and be just. Indeed, God likes the just people.

10.Bakhtiari Nejad: Indeed, the believers are brothers/fellows, so make peace between your brothers/fellows, and be cautious of God, that you may receive mercy.

11.Bakhtiari Nejad: You who believe, people should not ridicule other people, as perhaps they may be better than them, and women should not (ridicule) other women, as perhaps they may be better than them, and do not criticize (and insult) each other, and do not call each other by (offensive) nicknames, it is bad (to call people by) disgraceful names after believing, and whoever does not repent then they are the wrongdoers.

12.Bakhtiari Nejad: You who believe, avoid most suspicions, as indeed some suspicions are sins, and do not snoop, and do not defame/backbite each other (or gossip), for would any one of you like to eat his dead brother’s flesh? You would hate it. And be cautious of God. Indeed, God is acceptor of repentance and merciful.

13.Bakhtiari Nejad: People, indeed We created you from a male and a female, and We made you into races (and nations) and tribes so that you know each other. Indeed, the more honorable of you before God are those of you who are more cautious (of God). Indeed, God is knowledgeable and well-informed.

14.Bakhtiari Nejad: The desert Arabs say: “We believe.” Say: “You have not believed” but say: “We surrendered (to you, and not yet to God), and belief has not yet entered your hearts. And if you obey God and His messenger, He will not reduce anything from your works. God is forgiving and merciful.”

15.Bakhtiari Nejad: Indeed, the believers are those who believe in God and His messenger, then they do not doubt and they try hard with their possessions and their lives in God’s way. They are the truthful ones.

16.Bakhtiari Nejad: Say: “Do you inform God about your religion (way of life) while God knows everything in the skies and everything on the earth? And God knows everything.”

17.Bakhtiari Nejad: They consider it a favor to you that they submitted, say: “Do not consider your submission as a favor to me, but God favored you to guide you to belief, if you are truthful.”

18.Bakhtiari Nejad: Indeed, God knows the unseen (and secrets) of the skies and the earth. And God sees whatever you do.

1.Bakhtiari Nejad: Q. (Qaf.) By the glorious Quran.

2.Bakhtiari Nejad: They are surprised that a warner has come to them from themselves, so the disbelievers say: “This is a strange thing!

3.Bakhtiari Nejad: When we die and become dust (will we be raised)? This is an unlikely return.”

4.Bakhtiari Nejad: We definitely know what the earth reduces from them, and a book that keeps (track of everything) is with Us.

5.Bakhtiari Nejad: No, but they denied the truth when it came to them, and they are in a state of confusion.

6.Bakhtiari Nejad: Do they not look at the sky above them, that how We built it and beautified it, and it has no cracks?

7.Bakhtiari Nejad: And We spread out the earth, and We placed firm mountains in it, and We grew all kinds of beautiful (plants) in it.

8.Bakhtiari Nejad: An observation and a reminder for every repenting servant.

9.Bakhtiari Nejad: And We sent down blessed rain from the sky, and with it We grew gardens and seed of the harvest,

10.Bakhtiari Nejad: and tall date palms having layered cluster (of dates),

11.Bakhtiari Nejad: as a provision for Our servants, and We gave life to a dead land with it. The coming out (of graves) is like that.

12.Bakhtiari Nejad: People of Noah and inhabitants of Raas (the well) and Thamud denied before them

13.Bakhtiari Nejad: and Aad and Pharaoh and brothers of Lot

14.Bakhtiari Nejad: and inhabitants of the wood and people of Tubba (a Yemenite dynasty), all of them denied the messengers, so My threat (of punishment) came true.

15.Bakhtiari Nejad: Were We tired by the first creation? No, but they are in doubt about the new creation.

16.Bakhtiari Nejad: And We have certainly created human being and We know what his soul seduces him to, and We are closer to him than the jugular vein,

17.Bakhtiari Nejad: when the two receivers (or recorders) sitting on the right and on the left receive (and record his works),

18.Bakhtiari Nejad: he does not speak a word unless there is a watcher with him ready (to record).

19.Bakhtiari Nejad: And the agony of death comes in truth, which is what you were keeping away from it.

20.Bakhtiari Nejad: And the horn is blown. That is the day of the threat.

21.Bakhtiari Nejad: And everyone comes with a driver (who steers him) and a witness.

22.Bakhtiari Nejad: You were negligent of this (day), so We remove your cover from you, and today your eyesight is sharp.

23.Bakhtiari Nejad: And his companion (angel) says: “This is (his record) that is ready with me.”

24.Bakhtiari Nejad: (And it will be said:) “Throw into hell every stubborn disbeliever,

25.Bakhtiari Nejad: who prevented from the good, exceeded the limits, and was a doubter,

26.Bakhtiari Nejad: the one who set up another god with God, so throw him into the severe punishment.”

27.Bakhtiari Nejad: His companion (devil) will say: “Our Lord, I did not make him rebel, but he was lost far (from the right path).”

28.Bakhtiari Nejad: He (God) says: “Do not dispute before Me while I have sent the threat to you in advance.

29.Bakhtiari Nejad: The word (of punishment) from Me will not be changed, and I am not a wrongdoer to My servants.”

30.Bakhtiari Nejad: On the day when We say to hell: “Are you filled?” and it says: “Are there some more?”

31.Bakhtiari Nejad: And the garden is brought near for those who are cautious (of God), and it is not far.

32.Bakhtiari Nejad: This is what was promised to all who turn (to God) keeping (His commands),

33.Bakhtiari Nejad: anyone who fears the beneficent in the secret and comes with a repenting heart,

34.Bakhtiari Nejad: (We tell him) enter it with peace (and well-being), this is the eternal day.

35.Bakhtiari Nejad: They have whatever they want in it, and there is more with Us.

36.Bakhtiari Nejad: And how many generations did We destroy before them who were more courageous (and powerful) than them, and they explored throughout the land? Is there any way (or place) of escape?

37.Bakhtiari Nejad: There is certainly a reminder in that for anyone who has a heart or listens while he is attentive.

38.Bakhtiari Nejad: And We have certainly created the skies and the earth and whatever is between them in six stages and no fatigue touched us.

39.Bakhtiari Nejad: So, persevere (and be patient) about what they say and glorify your Lord with praise before the sunrise and before the sunset.

40.Bakhtiari Nejad: And glorify Him part of the night and after the prostration (showing humbleness at the end of prayers).

41.Bakhtiari Nejad: And listen, the day when the caller calls out from a nearby place,

42.Bakhtiari Nejad: a day when they hear the awful blast in truth, that is the day of coming out (of graves).

43.Bakhtiari Nejad: Indeed, We give life and We cause death, and the final return is to Us.

44.Bakhtiari Nejad: The day when the earth breaks open for them (and they come out of it) quickly. This is a gathering that is easy for Us.

45.Bakhtiari Nejad: We know better about what they say. You are not to force them. So, remind with the Quran anyone who fears My threat.

1.Bakhtiari Nejad: By the scattering (winds) that scatter,

2.Bakhtiari Nejad: and by the carriers of a heavy load (of rain),

3.Bakhtiari Nejad: and by the (ships) sailing with ease,

4.Bakhtiari Nejad: and by the distributors of affairs/commands (the angels),

5.Bakhtiari Nejad: what you are promised is certainly true,

6.Bakhtiari Nejad: and the judgment is certainly a reality.

7.Bakhtiari Nejad: And by the sky having pathways (and orbits),

8.Bakhtiari Nejad: indeed you (people) are of different opinion (regarding the truth),

9.Bakhtiari Nejad: anyone who is deceived, he is turned away from it (Quran and the truth).

10.Bakhtiari Nejad: Death to the liars (and conjecturers),

11.Bakhtiari Nejad: those who are neglectful in a flood (of ignorance).

12.Bakhtiari Nejad: They ask: “When is the Judgment Day?”

13.Bakhtiari Nejad: The day when they are burned over the fire.

14.Bakhtiari Nejad: Taste (the result of) your trial, this is what you used to want it in a hurry.

15.Bakhtiari Nejad: Indeed, those who are cautious (of God) are in gardens and springs.

16.Bakhtiari Nejad: Taking what their Lord has given them. Indeed, they were good doers before this.

17.Bakhtiari Nejad: They used to sleep a little of the night,

18.Bakhtiari Nejad: and they ask forgiveness by the dawns,

19.Bakhtiari Nejad: and there was a (portion) in their wealth due for the beggars and the disadvantaged.

20.Bakhtiari Nejad: And on earth there are signs for those who are certain,

21.Bakhtiari Nejad: and (there are signs) in yourselves (too), do you not see?

22.Bakhtiari Nejad: And your provision (produced by rain) and what you are promised are in the sky.

23.Bakhtiari Nejad: By the Lord of the skies and the earth, it is certainly true, same as (it is true that) you speak.

24.Bakhtiari Nejad: Did the story of the noble guests of Abraham reach you?

25.Bakhtiari Nejad: When they entered upon him, and they said: “Peace (and well-being).” He said: “Peace (and well-being) strangers.”

26.Bakhtiari Nejad: Then he went to his family and brought a fat (roasted) calf.

27.Bakhtiari Nejad: Then he placed it close to them saying: “Won’t you eat?”

28.Bakhtiari Nejad: Then he felt afraid of them, they said: “Do not be afraid.” And they gave him the good news of a knowledgeable son.

29.Bakhtiari Nejad: Then his wife came forward screaming, striking her face, and she said: “I am an infertile old woman.”

30.Bakhtiari Nejad: They said: “That is what your Lord has said, indeed He is the wise, the knowledgeable.”

31.Bakhtiari Nejad: He said: “You messengers, what is your business?”

32.Bakhtiari Nejad: They said: “We are sent to a guilty people,

33.Bakhtiari Nejad: so that we send upon them stones of clay,

34.Bakhtiari Nejad: marked by your Lord for the excessive ones.”

35.Bakhtiari Nejad: So, We brought out anyone who was among the believers in there.

36.Bakhtiari Nejad: But We only found a house of the submitted ones in there.

37.Bakhtiari Nejad: And We left a sign in there for those who fear the painful punishment.

38.Bakhtiari Nejad: And in (the story of) Moses when We sent him to Pharaoh with clear power,

39.Bakhtiari Nejad: then he turned away with his base (of supporters) and said: “A magician or a madman!”

40.Bakhtiari Nejad: So, We took him and his troops, then We threw them in the sea, and he was to blame.

41.Bakhtiari Nejad: And in (the story of) Aad when We sent upon them the destructive wind.

42.Bakhtiari Nejad: It did not leave anything that it came upon it, except making it as decomposed things.

43.Bakhtiari Nejad: And in (the story of) Thamud when they were told: “Enjoy yourselves for a while.”

44.Bakhtiari Nejad: Then they disobeyed their Lord’s command, so the thunderbolt took them while they were looking.

45.Bakhtiari Nejad: Then they could not stand up and they could not defend (or take revenge).

46.Bakhtiari Nejad: And people of Noah in the past, indeed they were disobedient people.

47.Bakhtiari Nejad: We built the sky with Our power, and We are certainly expanding (it).

48.Bakhtiari Nejad: And We spread out the earth, and how good We spread out.

49.Bakhtiari Nejad: And We created pairs of everything, so you may take notice.

50.Bakhtiari Nejad: So, run off to God. Indeed, I am (sent) by Him as a clear warner for you.

51.Bakhtiari Nejad: And do not set up another god with God. Indeed, I am (sent) by Him as a clear warner for you.

52.Bakhtiari Nejad: Similarly, no messenger came to those before them unless they said: “A magician or a madman.”

53.Bakhtiari Nejad: Did they recommend (one another) to that? No, they are rebellious people.

54.Bakhtiari Nejad: So, turn away from them, you are not to blame.

55.Bakhtiari Nejad: And (continue to) remind, as indeed the reminder benefits the believers.

56.Bakhtiari Nejad: And I did not create Jinn and humans except to serve Me (and no one else).

57.Bakhtiari Nejad: I do not want any provision from them, and I do not want them to feed Me.

58.Bakhtiari Nejad: Indeed, God is the provider, having the power and the definitive strength.

59.Bakhtiari Nejad: So indeed, for those who do wrong there will be a share (of punishment), like the share of their companions (and those in the past), so they should not ask Me to rush.

60.Bakhtiari Nejad: So, woe to those who disbelieve from their day that they are promised.

1.Bakhtiari Nejad: By the mountain (Mount Sinai),

2.Bakhtiari Nejad: and by a book written

3.Bakhtiari Nejad: in spread out (or published) scroll,

4.Bakhtiari Nejad: and by the thriving (and frequented) house,

5.Bakhtiari Nejad: and by the raised roof,

6.Bakhtiari Nejad: and by the (filled and) blazing sea,

7.Bakhtiari Nejad: your Lord’s punishment is certainly a reality.

8.Bakhtiari Nejad: No one (and nothing) can repel it.

9.Bakhtiari Nejad: The day when the sky swings back and forth,

10.Bakhtiari Nejad: and the mountains move about, traveling,

11.Bakhtiari Nejad: woe to the deniers (of God and Resurrection Day) on that day,

12.Bakhtiari Nejad: those who play around, entering into (false and useless) conversation.

13.Bakhtiari Nejad: The day when they are forcefully pushed into the fire of hell.

14.Bakhtiari Nejad: This is the fire that you were denying it.

15.Bakhtiari Nejad: So, is this a magic, or you do not see?

16.Bakhtiari Nejad: Enter (and burn in) it, it is the same to you whether you are patient or you are not patient (about it), you are only penalized for what you used to do.

17.Bakhtiari Nejad: Indeed, those who are cautious (of God) are in gardens and in happiness,

18.Bakhtiari Nejad: enjoying because of what their Lord gave them and that their Lord protected them from punishment of the hellfire.

19.Bakhtiari Nejad: Eat and drink joyfully because of what you were doing.

20.Bakhtiari Nejad: Leaning on couches lined up in rows, and We marry them to beautiful (spouses) with gorgeous eyes.

21.Bakhtiari Nejad: And those who believed and their descendants who followed them in belief, We join their descendants with them and We do not reduce anything from their works. Every person is bound by what he did.

22.Bakhtiari Nejad: And We help them with whatever fruit and meat they desire.

23.Bakhtiari Nejad: They pass a cup to one another in there that there is nothing useless or sinful in it.

24.Bakhtiari Nejad: And servants who are like hidden pearls go around them (to serve).

25.Bakhtiari Nejad: And they turn to each other asking one another,

26.Bakhtiari Nejad: they say: “Indeed in the past we were afraid among our people,

27.Bakhtiari Nejad: but God favored upon us and protected us from the punishment of scorching wind.

28.Bakhtiari Nejad: Indeed, we used to call on Him in the past. Indeed, He is the good, the merciful.”

29.Bakhtiari Nejad: So, remind (them) that by your Lord’s favor you are not a fortune-teller or a madman.

30.Bakhtiari Nejad: Or do they say: “A poet, we wait for his time of misfortune (his death).”?

31.Bakhtiari Nejad: Say: “Wait and I will wait with you.”

32.Bakhtiari Nejad: Or do their imaginations (and dreams) order them to this, or are they disobedient people?

33.Bakhtiari Nejad: Or do they say: “He has made it up.”? No, but they do not believe.

34.Bakhtiari Nejad: So, let them bring a saying like it (Quran), if they are truthful.

35.Bakhtiari Nejad: Or were they created from nothing, or are they the creators?

36.Bakhtiari Nejad: Or did they create the skies and the earth? No, they are not sure.

37.Bakhtiari Nejad: Or are the treasures of their Lord with them, or are they in charge (of them)?

38.Bakhtiari Nejad: Or do they have a ladder that they listen by it? Then their listeners should bring a clear reason.

39.Bakhtiari Nejad: Or does He have daughters and you have sons?

40.Bakhtiari Nejad: Or do you ask them for a wage, and they are weighed down by the debt?

41.Bakhtiari Nejad: Or is the unseen with them, and they write it?

42.Bakhtiari Nejad: Or do they want to plot? But those who disbelieve are plotted against.

43.Bakhtiari Nejad: Or do they have a god other than God? God is flawless of what they associate (with Him).

44.Bakhtiari Nejad: And if they see a piece of the sky falling down, they say: “Piled up clouds.”

45.Bakhtiari Nejad: So, leave them until they meet their day, in which they are thunderstruck (and die).

46.Bakhtiari Nejad: The day when their plot is of no use to them at all, and they are not helped.

47.Bakhtiari Nejad: And indeed, for those who do wrong there is a punishment (in this world) other than that (of the Hereafter), but most of them do not know.

48.Bakhtiari Nejad: And (Muhammad,) be patient for your Lord’s command, as you are under Our eyes, and glorify your Lord with praise when you get up.

49.Bakhtiari Nejad: And glorify Him part of the night and when the stars disappear.

1.Bakhtiari Nejad: By the star when it falls down (or goes down),

2.Bakhtiari Nejad: your companion is not misguided, and he was not deceived.

3.Bakhtiari Nejad: And he does not speak from (his own) desire.

4.Bakhtiari Nejad: It (Quran) is only a revelation (from God) that is revealed (to him),

5.Bakhtiari Nejad: taught to him by the very powerful (Gabriel),

6.Bakhtiari Nejad: being strong (and competent), he stood straight,

7.Bakhtiari Nejad: while he was on the highest horizon,

8.Bakhtiari Nejad: then he came closer, and he came down

9.Bakhtiari Nejad: until he was at a distance of two bows or closer,

10.Bakhtiari Nejad: then he revealed to His servant what he revealed.

11.Bakhtiari Nejad: His (the prophet’s) heart/mind did not deny what he saw.

12.Bakhtiari Nejad: Do you argue with him about what he saw?

13.Bakhtiari Nejad: And he has certainly seen him in another descent,

14.Bakhtiari Nejad: by the Lote (Sidra) tree at the utmost boundary,

15.Bakhtiari Nejad: the garden of (eternal) housing is near it.

16.Bakhtiari Nejad: When the Lote (Sidra) tree was covered by what covers,

17.Bakhtiari Nejad: the eyes (of Muhammad) did not turn aside and did not outreach.

18.Bakhtiari Nejad: He has certainly seen some of the great signs of His Lord.

19.Bakhtiari Nejad: What do you think of the Lat, the Uzza

20.Bakhtiari Nejad: and Manat, the third, the other one (of them)?

21.Bakhtiari Nejad: Are the males for you and females for Him?

22.Bakhtiari Nejad: That is an unfair division.

23.Bakhtiari Nejad: They are only names which you and your fathers named them, whereas God did not send down any reason for that. They only follow guess (and speculation) and what the souls desire, while the guidance has certainly come to them from their Lord.

24.Bakhtiari Nejad: Or does human being have whatever he desires?

25.Bakhtiari Nejad: While the last (the Hereafter) and the first (this world) belongs to God.

26.Bakhtiari Nejad: And many angels are in the skies, that their mediation is of no benefit at all except after God gives permission for whom He wants and He approves.

27.Bakhtiari Nejad: Indeed, those who do not believe in the Hereafter shall name the angels the feminine names,

28.Bakhtiari Nejad: while they have no knowledge of that. They only follow guesswork, and guess is of no use against the truth at all.

29.Bakhtiari Nejad: So, stay away from anyone who turns away from Our reminder and only wants this world’s life.

30.Bakhtiari Nejad: That is the extent of their knowledge. Indeed, your Lord knows better anyone who lost His way and He knows better anyone who is guided.

31.Bakhtiari Nejad: And everything in the skies and everything on the earth belongs to God, so that He penalizes those who did bad according to what they did and to reward those who did good with the better (reward than what they did),

32.Bakhtiari Nejad: those who avoid the big sins and the indecencies except the small ones. Your Lord is vast in forgiveness. He knows best about you, when He produced you from the earth and when you were hidden (as embryos) in your mothers’ wombs. So, do not claim yourselves pure (and innocent), as He knows better who is cautious (of God).

33.Bakhtiari Nejad: Did you see the one who turned away

34.Bakhtiari Nejad: and gave a little and was stingy?

35.Bakhtiari Nejad: Does he have knowledge of the unseen, so he sees (what happens)?

36.Bakhtiari Nejad: Or was he not informed of what is in scriptures of Moses,

37.Bakhtiari Nejad: and Abraham, the one who fulfilled (his duties)?

38.Bakhtiari Nejad: That no bearer bears burden of another,

39.Bakhtiari Nejad: and that there is not (any reward) for human being except what he has worked for.

40.Bakhtiari Nejad: And that his efforts will be seen,

41.Bakhtiari Nejad: then he is rewarded with full reward.

42.Bakhtiari Nejad: And that the final ending is to your Lord.

43.Bakhtiari Nejad: And that He is he who makes (everyone) laugh and cry.

44.Bakhtiari Nejad: And that He is he who causes death and gives life.

45.Bakhtiari Nejad: And that He created the two types, the male and the female,

46.Bakhtiari Nejad: from sperm when it is ejected.

47.Bakhtiari Nejad: And that the other creation (resurrection) is His responsibility.

48.Bakhtiari Nejad: And that He is he who makes rich and makes poor (or gives property).

49.Bakhtiari Nejad: And that He is the Lord of Sirius (the brightest star at night).

50.Bakhtiari Nejad: And that He has destroyed the earlier Aad

51.Bakhtiari Nejad: and Thamud, and He did not leave (anyone alive).

52.Bakhtiari Nejad: And (He destroyed) people of Noah before (them), indeed they were more wrongdoer and more rebellious.

53.Bakhtiari Nejad: And He overthrew the overturned cities,

54.Bakhtiari Nejad: and it was covered by what covers.

55.Bakhtiari Nejad: So, which of your Lord's favors do you doubt?

56.Bakhtiari Nejad: This is a warner like the previous warners.

57.Bakhtiari Nejad: The upcoming (Judgment Day) is coming up.

58.Bakhtiari Nejad: No one other than God can expose it.

59.Bakhtiari Nejad: Are you surprised by this saying,

60.Bakhtiari Nejad: and you laugh (at it), and you do not cry

61.Bakhtiari Nejad: while you are negligent?

62.Bakhtiari Nejad: So, show humbleness to God and serve Him.

1.Bakhtiari Nejad: The Hour is getting close and the moon splits.

2.Bakhtiari Nejad: And if they see a miracle they turn away and say: “A continuous magic.”

3.Bakhtiari Nejad: And they denied and followed their desires. And all matters have a settlement.

4.Bakhtiari Nejad: And the news (of the earlier ones) has certainly come to them, in which there is a deterrence,

5.Bakhtiari Nejad: a perfect wisdom, but warnings are of no use.

6.Bakhtiari Nejad: So, stay away from them, a day (comes when) the caller calls them to a nasty thing.

7.Bakhtiari Nejad: With their eyes looking down (in humiliation), they come out of their graves as if they were spreading locusts.

8.Bakhtiari Nejad: Rushing toward the caller, the disbelievers say: “This is a difficult day.”

9.Bakhtiari Nejad: People of Noah denied before them, and they denied Our servant (Noah) and they said: “A madman” and he was cast out.

10.Bakhtiari Nejad: So, he called on his Lord: “I am defeated, so help.”

11.Bakhtiari Nejad: So, We opened the gates of the sky with downpour of water.

12.Bakhtiari Nejad: And We gushed out springs from the earth. The waters joined for a matter that was destined (the flood).

13.Bakhtiari Nejad: And We carried him on (the Ark) having timbers and nails.

14.Bakhtiari Nejad: It sailed under Our eyes, a reward for him who was rejected (Noah).

15.Bakhtiari Nejad: And We have certainly left it as a sign, so does anyone take notice?

16.Bakhtiari Nejad: So, how were My punishment and My warnings?

17.Bakhtiari Nejad: And We have certainly made the Quran easy to understand, so does anyone take notice?

18.Bakhtiari Nejad: Aad (also) denied, so how were My punishment and My warnings?

19.Bakhtiari Nejad: Indeed, We sent severe cold wind upon them on a day of continuous misery,

20.Bakhtiari Nejad: knocking the people over as if they were uprooted trunks of date palms.

21.Bakhtiari Nejad: So, how were My punishment and My warnings?

22.Bakhtiari Nejad: And We have certainly made the Quran easy to understand, so does anyone take notice?

23.Bakhtiari Nejad: Thamud (also) denied the warnings.

24.Bakhtiari Nejad: And they said: “Should we follow him, a single human being among us? Then indeed we are in error and madness.

25.Bakhtiari Nejad: Has the reminder only been given to him among us? No, he is a rude liar.”

26.Bakhtiari Nejad: (It was said:) “Tomorrow they are going to know who the rude liar is,

27.Bakhtiari Nejad: We are sending the female camel as a test for them, so watch them and be patient

28.Bakhtiari Nejad: and inform them that the water is shared between them, and each drinking will be attended (by everyone).”

29.Bakhtiari Nejad: But they called their companion, and he took (a knife) and killed (her).

30.Bakhtiari Nejad: So, how were My punishment and My warnings?

31.Bakhtiari Nejad: Indeed, We sent a single awful blast upon them and they became like dry fragments of plants of a barn builder.

32.Bakhtiari Nejad: And We have certainly made the Quran easy to understand, so does anyone take notice?

33.Bakhtiari Nejad: People of Lot (also) denied the warnings.

34.Bakhtiari Nejad: Indeed, We sent a sandstorm upon them, except Lot’s family whom We saved them by dawn,

35.Bakhtiari Nejad: a favor from Us. That is how We reward anyone who thanks.

36.Bakhtiari Nejad: And he has certainly warned them of Our assault, but they doubted the warnings.

37.Bakhtiari Nejad: And they have certainly demanded his guests from him, so We blinded their eyes, so taste My punishment and My warnings.

38.Bakhtiari Nejad: And certainly, a lasting punishment took them by early morning.

39.Bakhtiari Nejad: So, taste My punishment and My warnings.

40.Bakhtiari Nejad: And We have certainly made the Quran easy to understand, so does anyone take notice?

41.Bakhtiari Nejad: And the warners had certainly come to Pharaoh’s people.

42.Bakhtiari Nejad: They denied all Our signs, so We punished them, a powerful and awesome punishment.

43.Bakhtiari Nejad: Are your disbelievers better than them, or is there immunity for you in the scriptures?

44.Bakhtiari Nejad: Or do they say: “We are united and victorious”?

45.Bakhtiari Nejad: They are all going to be defeated and turn their backs (running away).

46.Bakhtiari Nejad: No, the Hour is their appointment time, and the Hour is more awful and bitterer (than this world’s punishment).

47.Bakhtiari Nejad: Indeed, the guilty ones are in error and madness.

48.Bakhtiari Nejad: The day when they are dragged into the fire on their faces (they are told:) “Taste the touch of hell.”

49.Bakhtiari Nejad: Indeed, We created everything in correct proportion.

50.Bakhtiari Nejad: And Our command is only once, like a blink of an eye.

51.Bakhtiari Nejad: And We have certainly destroyed your kinds, so does anyone take notice?

52.Bakhtiari Nejad: And everything they did is in the books (of records),

53.Bakhtiari Nejad: and everything small or big is written.

54.Bakhtiari Nejad: And indeed, those who are cautious (of God) will be in gardens and rivers,

55.Bakhtiari Nejad: in a seat of truth, with a mighty ruler.

55.SurahEnglishNames: The Beneficent, The Mercy Giving, The Merciful

1.Bakhtiari Nejad: The beneficent

2.Bakhtiari Nejad: taught the Quran,

3.Bakhtiari Nejad: created human being,

4.Bakhtiari Nejad: taught him the speech.

5.Bakhtiari Nejad: The sun and the moon with precisely calculated (courses).

6.Bakhtiari Nejad: Herbs (or stars) and trees humble themselves (before God).

7.Bakhtiari Nejad: And He raised the sky and set up the balance (of right and wrong),

8.Bakhtiari Nejad: so that you do not outdo the balance.

9.Bakhtiari Nejad: And perform the weighing with justice and do not make the scale light.

10.Bakhtiari Nejad: And He set up the earth for the human race,

11.Bakhtiari Nejad: in it there are fruits and date palms having coverings,

12.Bakhtiari Nejad: and the seed having outer shell, and the fragrant herbs.

13.Bakhtiari Nejad: Then which of your Lord’s favors do you deny?

14.Bakhtiari Nejad: He created human being from dried clay like pottery clay.

15.Bakhtiari Nejad: And He created Jinn from flame of a fire.

16.Bakhtiari Nejad: Then which of your Lord’s favors do you deny?

17.Bakhtiari Nejad: The Lord of the two easts and the Lord of the two wests.

18.Bakhtiari Nejad: Then which of your Lord’s favors do you deny?

19.Bakhtiari Nejad: He made the two seas flow freely to meet,

20.Bakhtiari Nejad: there is a boundary between them that they do not go beyond.

21.Bakhtiari Nejad: Then which of your Lord’s favors do you deny?

22.Bakhtiari Nejad: Pearl and coral come out of both of them.

23.Bakhtiari Nejad: Then which of your Lord’s favors do you deny?

24.Bakhtiari Nejad: And the sailing ships raised in the sea like the mountains/landmarks belong to Him.

25.Bakhtiari Nejad: Then which of your Lord’s favors do you deny?

26.Bakhtiari Nejad: Everyone on it (the earth) is mortal,

27.Bakhtiari Nejad: while your Lord's essence, having majesty and nobility remains (forever).

28.Bakhtiari Nejad: Then which of your Lord’s favors do you deny?

29.Bakhtiari Nejad: Everyone in the skies and on the earth asks Him (for their needs). Every day He is in some affair.

30.Bakhtiari Nejad: Then which of your Lord’s favors do you deny?

31.Bakhtiari Nejad: We are going to attend to you, the two important beings (humans and Jinn).

32.Bakhtiari Nejad: Then which of your Lord’s favors do you deny?

33.Bakhtiari Nejad: You, group of Jinn and humans, if you can cross the boundaries of the skies and the earth then cross (them). You cannot cross except with an authorization.

34.Bakhtiari Nejad: Then which of your Lord’s favors do you deny?

35.Bakhtiari Nejad: A flame of fire and melted copper will be sent upon both of you, and you cannot help/defend yourselves.

36.Bakhtiari Nejad: Then which of your Lord’s favors do you deny?

37.Bakhtiari Nejad: When the sky splits and it becomes red like the red rawhide (or red-hot oil).

38.Bakhtiari Nejad: Then which of your Lord’s favors do you deny?

39.Bakhtiari Nejad: On that day no human being or Jinn is asked about his sins.

40.Bakhtiari Nejad: Then which of your Lord’s favors do you deny?

41.Bakhtiari Nejad: The guilty ones are recognized by their appearance, then they are taken by (the hair lock of) the forehead and the feet.

42.Bakhtiari Nejad: Then which of your Lord’s favors do you deny?

43.Bakhtiari Nejad: This is hell that the guilty ones (used to) deny it.

44.Bakhtiari Nejad: They go around between it (its flames) and between hot boiling water.

45.Bakhtiari Nejad: Then which of your Lord’s favors do you deny?

46.Bakhtiari Nejad: And there are two gardens for anyone who fears his Lord’s position.

47.Bakhtiari Nejad: Then which of your Lord’s favors do you deny?

48.Bakhtiari Nejad: Two (gardens) having a variety (of trees).

49.Bakhtiari Nejad: Then which of your Lord’s favors do you deny?

50.Bakhtiari Nejad: There are two springs flowing in both of them.

51.Bakhtiari Nejad: Then which of your Lord’s favors do you deny?

52.Bakhtiari Nejad: There are pairs of every fruit in both of them.

53.Bakhtiari Nejad: Then which of your Lord’s favors do you deny?

54.Bakhtiari Nejad: Leaning on cushions/couches inside of which is from heavy silk, and fruits of the two gardens are within (their) reach.

55.Bakhtiari Nejad: Then which of your Lord’s favors do you deny?

56.Bakhtiari Nejad: And there are girls with restrained glances in them whom no human being or Jinn has touched (had sex with) them before.

57.Bakhtiari Nejad: Then which of your Lord’s favors do you deny?

58.Bakhtiari Nejad: They are like the ruby and the coral.

59.Bakhtiari Nejad: Then which of your Lord’s favors do you deny?

60.Bakhtiari Nejad: Is reward of goodness anything except goodness?

61.Bakhtiari Nejad: Then which of your Lord’s favors do you deny?

62.Bakhtiari Nejad: And besides those two are two (other) gardens.

63.Bakhtiari Nejad: Then which of your Lord’s favors do you deny?

64.Bakhtiari Nejad: Both dark green (because of lush vegetation).

65.Bakhtiari Nejad: Then which of your Lord’s favors do you deny?

66.Bakhtiari Nejad: There are two springs gushing out in both of them.

67.Bakhtiari Nejad: Then which of your Lord’s favors do you deny?

68.Bakhtiari Nejad: There are fruits and date palm and pomegranate in both of them.

69.Bakhtiari Nejad: Then which of your Lord’s favors do you deny?

70.Bakhtiari Nejad: There are good and beautiful females in both of them.

71.Bakhtiari Nejad: Then which of your Lord’s favors do you deny?

72.Bakhtiari Nejad: Beautiful girls limited to the tents/pavilions.

73.Bakhtiari Nejad: Then which of your Lord’s favors do you deny?

74.Bakhtiari Nejad: No human being or Jinn has touched (had sex with) them before.

75.Bakhtiari Nejad: Then which of your Lord’s favors do you deny?

76.Bakhtiari Nejad: Leaning on green pillows and fine colorful carpets.

77.Bakhtiari Nejad: Then which of your Lord’s favors do you deny?

78.Bakhtiari Nejad: Blessed is the name of your Lord, having majesty and nobility.

56.SurahEnglishNames: The Event, The Inevitable, That Which is Coming

1.Bakhtiari Nejad: When the event happens,

2.Bakhtiari Nejad: and its happening is not false,

3.Bakhtiari Nejad: it is lowering and elevating (humiliating and honoring).

4.Bakhtiari Nejad: When the earth is violently shaken,

5.Bakhtiari Nejad: and the mountains are totally disintegrated

6.Bakhtiari Nejad: and become scattered dust.

7.Bakhtiari Nejad: You will be three types.

8.Bakhtiari Nejad: The associates of happiness (the fortunate people). Who are the fortunate people?

9.Bakhtiari Nejad: The associates of misery (the unfortunate people). Who are the unfortunate people?

10.Bakhtiari Nejad: And the pioneers (in devotion) are the pioneers (in the Hereafter),

11.Bakhtiari Nejad: they are the close ones (to God),

12.Bakhtiari Nejad: in gardens of delight,

13.Bakhtiari Nejad: a large number of the earlier ones

14.Bakhtiari Nejad: and a few from the later ones.

15.Bakhtiari Nejad: On sofas lavishly inlaid (with jewels and gold),

16.Bakhtiari Nejad: reclining on them, facing each other.

17.Bakhtiari Nejad: Immortal youths circulate among them,

18.Bakhtiari Nejad: with drinking glasses and jugs and cups of spring water.

19.Bakhtiari Nejad: They do not get headache and do not get exhausted (or intoxicated) from it.

20.Bakhtiari Nejad: And (there will be) whatever fruits they choose,

21.Bakhtiari Nejad: and whatever meat of birds they desire,

22.Bakhtiari Nejad: and beautiful (spouses) with gorgeous eyes

23.Bakhtiari Nejad: like the hidden pearls (inside the shell),

24.Bakhtiari Nejad: as a reward for what they used to do.

25.Bakhtiari Nejad: They do not hear useless or sinful (talk) in there,

26.Bakhtiari Nejad: except saying of peace (and well-being), peace (and well-being).

27.Bakhtiari Nejad: And the associates of the right hand (the fortunate), who are the fortunate?

28.Bakhtiari Nejad: Among thorn free Lote (Sidra) tree,

29.Bakhtiari Nejad: and banana trees piled up (with fruits),

30.Bakhtiari Nejad: and extended shade,

31.Bakhtiari Nejad: and flowing water,

32.Bakhtiari Nejad: and plenty of fruits,

33.Bakhtiari Nejad: not ending and not forbidden.

34.Bakhtiari Nejad: And dignified spouses

35.Bakhtiari Nejad: whom We created them perfectly,

36.Bakhtiari Nejad: and We made them virgins,

37.Bakhtiari Nejad: devoted (and loving), of equal age

38.Bakhtiari Nejad: for associates of the right hand (the fortunate),

39.Bakhtiari Nejad: a large number of the earlier ones

40.Bakhtiari Nejad: and a large number of the later ones.

41.Bakhtiari Nejad: And associates of the left hand (the unfortunate), who are the unfortunate?

42.Bakhtiari Nejad: In scorching wind and boiling water,

43.Bakhtiari Nejad: and shade of thick (black) smoke,

44.Bakhtiari Nejad: not cool and not nice.

45.Bakhtiari Nejad: Indeed, they were rich (and wealthy) before this,

46.Bakhtiari Nejad: and they insisted on the great sin,

47.Bakhtiari Nejad: and they used to say: “Will we be raised when we die and become dust and bones?

48.Bakhtiari Nejad: Or our forefathers?”

49.Bakhtiari Nejad: Say: “Indeed the earlier ones and the later ones

50.Bakhtiari Nejad: are certainly collected at an appointment of a known day.

51.Bakhtiari Nejad: Then indeed you, the misguided deniers,

52.Bakhtiari Nejad: are certainly eaters of the Zaqqum tree,

53.Bakhtiari Nejad: filling the stomachs from it,

54.Bakhtiari Nejad: then drinking boiling water over it,

55.Bakhtiari Nejad: and drinking as thirsty camels drink.”

56.Bakhtiari Nejad: This is their reception on the Judgment Day.

57.Bakhtiari Nejad: We created you, so why do you not acknowledge?

58.Bakhtiari Nejad: Have you considered what you ejaculate?

59.Bakhtiari Nejad: Do you create it or are We the creators?

60.Bakhtiari Nejad: We mandated death among you, and We will not be surpassed

61.Bakhtiari Nejad: in replacing (you with) the likes of you and producing you in (a form/condition) that you do not know.

62.Bakhtiari Nejad: You certainly know about the first creation, so why do you not take notice?

63.Bakhtiari Nejad: Have you considered what you plant?

64.Bakhtiari Nejad: Do you grow it, or are We the growers?

65.Bakhtiari Nejad: If We want, We will make it into broken pieces, and leave you wondering

66.Bakhtiari Nejad: (saying:) “We certainly suffered losses,

67.Bakhtiari Nejad: no, but we have been deprived.”

68.Bakhtiari Nejad: Have you considered the water that you drink?

69.Bakhtiari Nejad: Did you send it down from the cloud, or are We the senders?

70.Bakhtiari Nejad: If We want, We will make it bitter (and salty), so why are you not thankful?

71.Bakhtiari Nejad: Have you considered the fire that you light?

72.Bakhtiari Nejad: Did you make its tree, or are We the makers?

73.Bakhtiari Nejad: We made it a reminder and a provision for those living/traveling in the desert.

74.Bakhtiari Nejad: So, glorify the name of your great Lord.

75.Bakhtiari Nejad: So, I swear by positions of the stars,

76.Bakhtiari Nejad: and it is a great oath if you knew,

77.Bakhtiari Nejad: indeed, this is a noble Quran

78.Bakhtiari Nejad: in a concealed book,

79.Bakhtiari Nejad: none touches it except the purified ones (the angels),

80.Bakhtiari Nejad: a revelation from the Lord of humankind.

81.Bakhtiari Nejad: Do you take this saying lightly,

82.Bakhtiari Nejad: and you make it your livelihood to deny it?

83.Bakhtiari Nejad: So, why not when it (someone’s soul) reaches the throat

84.Bakhtiari Nejad: and you are watching at that moment,

85.Bakhtiari Nejad: while We are closer to him than you, but you do not see,

86.Bakhtiari Nejad: then why not, if you are not obligated (by your deeds),

87.Bakhtiari Nejad: you return it (the soul to the body), if you are truthful?

88.Bakhtiari Nejad: But if he is one of the close ones (to God),

89.Bakhtiari Nejad: then ease and comfort and gardens of delight (are for him).

90.Bakhtiari Nejad: And if he is among associates of the right hand (the fortunate),

91.Bakhtiari Nejad: then peace (and well-being) to you from associates of the right hand.

92.Bakhtiari Nejad: And if he is among the misguided deniers,

93.Bakhtiari Nejad: then a reception of boiling water,

94.Bakhtiari Nejad: and entering (and burning in) hellfire (is for him).

95.Bakhtiari Nejad: And this is indeed the sure truth.

96.Bakhtiari Nejad: So, glorify the name of your great Lord.

1.Bakhtiari Nejad: Everything in the skies and the earth glorifies God, and He is the powerful, the wise.

2.Bakhtiari Nejad: The rule of the skies and the earth belongs to Him, He gives life and causes death, and He is capable of everything.

3.Bakhtiari Nejad: He is the first and the last, and the obvious and the obscure, and He knows everything.

4.Bakhtiari Nejad: He is the One Who created the skies and the earth in six stages and then He reigned over the dominion. He knows whatever goes into the earth and whatever comes out of it, and whatever comes down from the sky and whatever goes up to it, and He is with you wherever you are, and God sees whatever you do.

5.Bakhtiari Nejad: The rule of the skies and the earth belongs to Him, and all affairs are returned to God.

6.Bakhtiari Nejad: He makes the night pass through the day and makes the day pass through the night. And He knows what is inside the chests/minds.

7.Bakhtiari Nejad: Believe in God and His messenger and spend (in God's way) from what He made you successors in it. There is a great reward for those of you who believe and spend (in God's way).

8.Bakhtiari Nejad: What is with you that you do not believe in God while the messenger calls you to believe in your Lord? And He has certainly taken your commitment if you are believers.

9.Bakhtiari Nejad: He is the One Who sends down clear signs to His servant in order to bring you out of the darkness into the light. God is indeed gentle and merciful to you.

10.Bakhtiari Nejad: And what is with you that you do not spend in God’s way, while the inheritance of the skies and the earth belongs to God? Those of you who spent and fought before the victory are not equal (to those who did that later). They have greater rank than those who spent and fought afterward, while God promised goodness to all (of them). And God is well informed of what you do.

11.Bakhtiari Nejad: And who is he that lends God a good loan (or offers God a good deed) so that He multiplies it for him, and there will be a noble (and generous) reward for him?

12.Bakhtiari Nejad: The day when you see the believing men and the believing women rushing with their lights ahead of them and to the right of them (they will be told:) “Today your good news is: gardens that rivers flow through them, remaining in there forever. That is the great victory.”

13.Bakhtiari Nejad: The day when the hypocrite men and the hypocrite women say to those who believed: “Look at us that we may get some of your light.” It is said: “Go back to your past and look for a light.” And a wall having a gate will be put up between them, its interior will have mercy in it while its exterior will have punishment facing it.

14.Bakhtiari Nejad: They (the disbelievers) call on them (the believers:) “Were we not with you?” They will say: “Yes, but you tempted yourselves and you waited and you doubted, and wishful thinking deceived you until God’s command came and the deceiver (Satan) deceived you about God.

15.Bakhtiari Nejad: So, today no ransom will be taken from you and from those who disbelieved, your housing will be the fire, it is your companion, and it is a miserable destination.”

16.Bakhtiari Nejad: Is it not about time for those who believe to humble their hearts for God’s remembrance and what has come down from the truth, and not to be like those who were given the book in the past? And then after some time had passed for them, their hearts hardened and many of them were disobedient.

17.Bakhtiari Nejad: Know that God brings the earth back to life after its death. We certainly made the signs clear for you, so that you may understand.

18.Bakhtiari Nejad: The charitable men and the charitable women and those who lend God a good loan (do good deeds), it (their reward) will be multiplied for them, and they will have a noble (and generous) reward.

19.Bakhtiari Nejad: And those who believe in God and His messenger, they are the truthful and witnesses before their Lord, they will have their reward and their light. And those who disbelieve and deny Our signs, they will be inhabitants of the hellfire.

20.Bakhtiari Nejad: Know that this world’s life is only play and amusement, and decoration and bragging among yourselves, and wanting more wealth and children. It is like the example of a rain impressing the farmers with its (growth of the) plants, then it (the plant) dries up and you see it turn yellow and then becomes broken pieces. And in the Hereafter, there is severe punishment (for the disbelievers) and forgiveness and pleasure of God (for the believers). And this world’s life is nothing but means of deception.

21.Bakhtiari Nejad: Race to forgiveness of your Lord, and a garden whose width is as wide as the sky and the earth, and is prepared for those who believe in God and His messengers. That is God’s grace that He gives it to anyone He wants. And God has enormous grace.

22.Bakhtiari Nejad: No tragedy happens on the earth or within yourselves unless it is (written) in a book before We create it (according to God's laws). This is easy for God.

23.Bakhtiari Nejad: So that you do not be sad over what slips away from you (or what you lose) and not to be overjoyed about what He gives you. And God does not like any selfish show-off,

24.Bakhtiari Nejad: those who are stingy and order people to stinginess. And anyone who turns back, God is indeed the rich (without need) and the praiseworthy.

25.Bakhtiari Nejad: We have certainly sent Our messengers with clear evidences, and sent down the book and the balance (of right and wrong) with them so that people carry out justice. And We sent down the iron in which there is great harm and (many) benefits for people, and for God to know anyone who secretly helps Him and His messengers. God is indeed strong and powerful.

26.Bakhtiari Nejad: And We have certainly sent Noah and Abraham and We put the prophethood and the book among their descendants, so some of them were guided, and most of them were disobedient.

27.Bakhtiari Nejad: Then We followed them up with Our messengers, and We sent Jesus, son of Mary, and We gave him the Gospel, and put gentleness and mercy in the hearts of those who followed him. But they made up being monks, We did not mandate it to them, but (We only mandated) looking for God's pleasure, but they did not observe it as it was supposed to be observed. Then we gave those of them who believed their reward, while most of them are disobedient.

28.Bakhtiari Nejad: You who believe, be cautious of God and believe in His messenger, (so that) He gives you a double portion of His mercy and makes a light for you to walk with it and forgives you. He is forgiving and merciful.

29.Bakhtiari Nejad: So that people of the book know that they do not have a bit of power over God’s grace, and that grace is in God’s hand, giving it to anyone He wants. God has enormous grace.

58.SurahEnglishNames: She That Disputeth, The Pleading Woman, She Who Pleaded

1.Bakhtiari Nejad: God heard the saying of the one woman arguing with you about her husband and complaining to God. God has heard your conversation; indeed God hears all and sees all.

2.Bakhtiari Nejad: Those of you who divorce their wives by declaring them as their mothers, they are not their mothers. No one is their mothers except those who gave them birth, and they certainly say a nasty word and a lie. And God certainly pardons and forgives.

3.Bakhtiari Nejad: And those who divorce their wives by declaring them as their mothers, then they go back on what they said, should free a slave before touching each other. This is what you are advised to it. And God is well informed of what you do.

4.Bakhtiari Nejad: And if someone does not find (a slave) then fasting for two consecutive months before touching each other. And anyone who cannot (fast), then feeding sixty needy (people). This is for you to believe in God and His messenger, and this is the limits set by God, and disbelievers will have a painful punishment.

5.Bakhtiari Nejad: Indeed, those who oppose God and His messenger are subdued as those before them were subdued. And We have sent down clear signs/verses, and disbelievers will have a humiliating punishment.

6.Bakhtiari Nejad: The day when God raises them all, then He informs them of what they did, as God counted it while they forgot it. And God is witnesses over everything.

7.Bakhtiari Nejad: Do you not see that God knows everything in the skies and everything on the earth? There is not any private conversation among three unless He is the fourth of them, and not any five unless He is the sixth of them, and not less and not more than that unless He is with them, wherever they are. Then on the Resurrection Day He informs them of what they did. Indeed, God knows everything.

8.Bakhtiari Nejad: Have you not seen those who were prohibited from private talk, then they returned to what they were prohibited from, privately talking about sin and enmity and disobedience of the messenger? And when they come to you, they greet you in such a way that God has not greeted you with it, and they say among themselves: “Why does God not punish us for what we say?” Hell is enough for them, they enter (and burn in) there, and it is the bad destination.

9.Bakhtiari Nejad: You who believe, when you talk privately, do not privately talk about sin and enmity and disobedience of the messenger, but talk privately (only) about goodness and self control, and be cautious of God, the One you will be gathered to Him.

10.Bakhtiari Nejad: Secret conversation is only from Satan to make those who believe sad, while it does not harm them a bit unless with God's permission. And the believers should put their trust in God.

11.Bakhtiari Nejad: You who believe, when you are told to make room in the assemblies, then make room so that God makes room for you, and when it is said to get up, then get up. God raises ranks of those of you who believe and those who have been given knowledge. And God is well informed of what you do.

12.Bakhtiari Nejad: You who believe, when you (want to) talk privately with the messenger, then give to charity before your private talk. This is better and purer for you. And if you do not find (it affordable), then indeed God is forgiving and merciful.

13.Bakhtiari Nejad: Are you afraid of giving to charity before your private talk? So, when you do not do it and God has turned to you (and forgiven you), then perform mandatory prayer and give to mandatory charity and obey God and His messenger. God is well informed of what you do.

14.Bakhtiari Nejad: Have you not seen those who turn (in friendship) to people whom God's anger is upon them? They are not from you and (you are) not from them, and they swear falsely while they know.

15.Bakhtiari Nejad: God has prepared a severe punishment for them, for what they were doing is indeed bad.

16.Bakhtiari Nejad: They took their oath as a shield to obstruct (people) from God's way, so they will have a humiliating punishment.

17.Bakhtiari Nejad: Their possessions and children are of no use against God at all. They are inhabitants of the fire, remaining in there forever.

18.Bakhtiari Nejad: On the day when God raises them all, then they swear for Him as they swear for you, and they think that they are onto something. Surely, they are liars.

19.Bakhtiari Nejad: Satan overcame them and made them forget God's remembrance, they are Satan's party. Surely, Satan's party, they are the losers.

20.Bakhtiari Nejad: Indeed, those who oppose God and His messenger, they are among the lowest ones.

21.Bakhtiari Nejad: God has prescribed: “I and My messengers shall be victorious.” God is indeed strong and powerful.

22.Bakhtiari Nejad: You will not find any people who believe in God and the Last Day loving those who oppose God and His messenger, even if they are their fathers or their sons or their brothers or their family (and tribe members). He has written the belief in their hearts, and He assisted them with a spirit from Him, and He will admit them to gardens which rivers flow through them, remaining in there forever. God is pleased with them, and they are pleased with Him, they are God's party. Be aware, indeed God's party, they are the successful ones.

1.Bakhtiari Nejad: Everything in the skies and everything on the earth glorifies God, and He is the powerful, the wise.

2.Bakhtiari Nejad: He is the One Who drove out those who disbelieved among people of the book from their homes for the first forced emigration. You did not think that they would leave, and they thought that their fortresses would protect them against God, but God came to them from where they did not expect, and He threw horror in their hearts. They destroyed their homes with their own hands and the believers' hands. So, learn a lesson, (those of) you who have insight.

3.Bakhtiari Nejad: And if God had not prescribed the evacuation for them, He would have certainly punished them in this world, and they will have punishment of fire in the Hereafter.

4.Bakhtiari Nejad: That is because they opposed God and His messenger, and whoever opposes God, then God is indeed severe in the punishment.

5.Bakhtiari Nejad: Any palm tree that you cut down or you left it standing on its roots, it is by God's permission so that He (may) humiliate the disobedient ones.

6.Bakhtiari Nejad: And whatever God gave to His messenger (as spoil) from them, you did not bother (riding) any horse or camel for it, but God makes His messengers dominate over whomever He wants. God is capable of everything.

7.Bakhtiari Nejad: And whatever God gave to His messenger (as spoil) from people of the towns is for God and for the messenger and for the relatives (and close ones) and the orphans and the needy and the traveler (in need) so that it does not circulate between the rich among you. And whatever the messenger gave you then take it, and whatever he held you back from it then stay away from it, and be cautious of God. God is indeed severe in the punishment.

8.Bakhtiari Nejad: And (part of it) is for the poor immigrants, those who were driven out of their homes and their possessions and they look for God’s bounty and His pleasure and they help God and His messenger, they are the truthful ones.

9.Bakhtiari Nejad: And (part of it is for) those who settled down in the houses (in Medina) and in the faith before them, and they like anyone who emigrated to them, and they do not find any need in their chests/minds for what they (the immigrants) were given, and they prefer them over themselves even though poverty is among them. And anyone who protects himself from stinginess (and greed), then they are the successful ones.

10.Bakhtiari Nejad: And those who came after them say: “Our Lord, forgive us and our brothers who came to faith before us, and do not put any resentment in our hearts toward those who believe; our Lord, you are gentle and merciful.”

11.Bakhtiari Nejad: Have you not seen those hypocrites who say to their brothers who disbelieve among people of the book: “If you are driven out, we shall leave with you, and we would never obey anyone against you, and we shall help you if you are fought.” God testifies that they are certainly liars.

12.Bakhtiari Nejad: If they are driven out, they (the hypocrites) would not leave with them, and if they are fought, they (the hypocrites) will not help them, and if they (want to) help them, they shall turn their backs (and run away), then they (the disbelievers) are not helped.

13.Bakhtiari Nejad: You are certainly more frightening than God in their chests/minds. That is because they are people who do not understand.

14.Bakhtiari Nejad: They do not fight all of you together unless in well-protected towns or from behind walls. Their hostility among themselves is severe. You think they are all together (and united) while their hearts are divided. That is because they are people who do not understand.

15.Bakhtiari Nejad: Same as those before them in the near past, they tasted the bad result of their affair, and they have a painful punishment.

16.Bakhtiari Nejad: Same as Satan when he says to the human being: “Disbelieve.” Then when he disbelieves, he (Satan) says: “I am free of you (and have nothing to do with you), I fear (the punishment of) God, the Lord of humankind.”

17.Bakhtiari Nejad: The end of both of them is in the fire, remaining in there forever, and that is the punishment of the wrongdoers.

18.Bakhtiari Nejad: You who believe, be cautious of God, everyone should watch what he sends ahead for tomorrow, and be cautious of God. God is well informed of what you do.

19.Bakhtiari Nejad: And do not be like those who forgot God, so He made them forget themselves (to send ahead some good for themselves). They are the disobedient ones.

20.Bakhtiari Nejad: Inhabitants of the fire and inhabitants of the garden are not equal. Inhabitants of the garden, they are the triumphant ones.

21.Bakhtiari Nejad: If We had sent down this Quran to a mountain, you would have certainly seen it humbly breaking up from fear of God. And that is among the examples that We give for people, so that they may think.

22.Bakhtiari Nejad: He is God, the One that there is no god except Him, knower of the unseen and the visible, He is the beneficent, the merciful.

23.Bakhtiari Nejad: He is God, the One that there is no god except Him, the ruler, the holy, the (source of) peace, the (source of) security, the guardian, the powerful, the enforcer (of His will), the supreme. God is flawless of what they associate (with Him).

24.Bakhtiari Nejad: He is God, the creator, the inventor, the designer. All the good attributes (and names) belong to Him. Everything in the skies and on the earth glorifies Him, and He is the powerful, the wise.

60.SurahEnglishNames: She That is to be Examined, Examining her, She Who is Tested

1.Bakhtiari Nejad: You who believe, do not take My enemy and your enemy as your friends, offering them friendship. They have disbelieved in what has come to you in truth, driving the messenger and yourselves out because you believe in God, your Lord. If you go out to try hard in My way and look for My pleasure, (do not) offer them friendship in secret, while I know what you hide and what you disclose. And whoever among you does that, he has lost the right way.

2.Bakhtiari Nejad: If they overcome you, they become your enemies and they extend their hands and their tongues towards you with bad (intentions), and they wish that you disbelieve.

3.Bakhtiari Nejad: Your blood relatives (and close relatives) and your children will never benefit you on the Resurrection Day as He separates you, and God sees whatever you do.

4.Bakhtiari Nejad: There has been a good example for you in Abraham and those with him when they said to their people: “We are free of (and have nothing to do with) you and whatever you serve besides God, we disbelieve in you, and an unending enmity and hatred has appeared between us and you until you believe in God alone.” Except Abraham's word to his father (when he said:) “I shall ask forgiveness for you, although I do not have power of anything for you from God.” Our Lord, we trust in You and we turn to You (in repentance) and the final return is to You.

5.Bakhtiari Nejad: Our Lord, do not make us a test for those who disbelieve. And our Lord, forgive us. Indeed You are the powerful, the wise.

6.Bakhtiari Nejad: Certainly, there has been a good example in them for you, for anyone who hopes for God and the Last Day. And anyone who turns away, then (know that) indeed God is the rich (without needs) and the praiseworthy.

7.Bakhtiari Nejad: Perhaps God will bring about friendship between you and those of them whom you consider as enemy, God is capable, and God is forgiving and merciful.

8.Bakhtiari Nejad: God does not prohibit you from being kind and fair toward those who did not fight you about the religion (way of life) and did not drive you out of your homes. Indeed, God likes the just people.

9.Bakhtiari Nejad: God only prohibits you from making friends with those who fought you about the religion (way of life) and drove you out of your homes and supported (others) in driving you out. And anyone who makes friend with them, then they are the wrongdoers.

10.Bakhtiari Nejad: You who believe, when the believing women come to you as emigrants, then examine them, even though God knows their belief better. So, if you find them as believing women, then do not return them to the disbelievers, they are not lawful for them (the disbelievers) and they (the disbelievers) are not lawful for them, and give them what they had spent (for these women). And there is no blame on you if you marry them when you give them their compensations (marriage portions). And do not hold on to the (marriage) ties of disbelieving women, but ask for what you have spent and they should ask for what they have spent. This is God's command; He judges between you. God is knowledgeable and wise.

11.Bakhtiari Nejad: And if any of your wives goes away to the disbelievers (and disbelievers didn't pay you for what you had spent), then when your turn comes, give those (believing men) whose wives have gone away equal to what they had spent. And be cautious of God, the One Whom you believe in Him.

12.Bakhtiari Nejad: Prophet, when the believing women come to you pledging to you that they will not associate anything with God, and they will not steal, and they will not commit adultery/fornication, and they will not kill their children, and they will not bring false accusation that they have made up between their hands and their feet (by falsely claiming that their husband or someone else is the father of a child that they have raised), and they will not disobey you in what is right, then accept their pledge and ask God for their forgiveness. God is indeed forgiving and merciful.

13.Bakhtiari Nejad: You who believe, do not make friends with people whom God’s anger is upon them, for they have lost hope of the Hereafter as the disbelievers have lost hope of the inhabitants of the graves (that their dead would not return to life).

1.Bakhtiari Nejad: Everything in the skies and everything on the earth glorifies God, and He is the powerful, the wise.

2.Bakhtiari Nejad: You who believe, why do you say what you do not do?

3.Bakhtiari Nejad: It is most hateful before God that you say what you do not do.

4.Bakhtiari Nejad: God likes those who fight in His way in rows as if they were a solid structure.

5.Bakhtiari Nejad: And when Moses said to his people: “My people, why do you harass me while you have known that I am God's messenger to you?” So, when they deviated, God made their hearts deviate. And God does not guide disobedient people.

6.Bakhtiari Nejad: And when Jesus, son of Mary, said: “Children of Israel, indeed I am God's messenger to you, confirming what is before me in the Torah, and giving good news of a messenger coming after me, whose name (or whose attribute) is Ahmad (or praised one).” Then when he brought them clear evidences, they said: “This is an obvious magic.”

7.Bakhtiari Nejad: Who is more wrong than someone who makes up a lie (and attributes it) to God while he is called to the submission (to God’s instructions)? God does not guide the wrongdoing people.

8.Bakhtiari Nejad: They want to put out God's light with (words of) their mouths, while God completes His light even though the disbelievers dislike it.

9.Bakhtiari Nejad: He is the One Who sent His messenger with the guidance and the right way of life (religion) in order to inform him about all of the religion (God's recommended way of life), even though the idolaters dislike it.

10.Bakhtiari Nejad: You who believe, should I advise you of a deal that saves you from a painful punishment?

11.Bakhtiari Nejad: Believe in God and His messenger, and try hard in God's way with your possessions and lives. That is better for you if you knew.

12.Bakhtiari Nejad: He will forgive your sins and will admit you into gardens which rivers flow through them and to good houses in eternal gardens. That is the great victory.

13.Bakhtiari Nejad: And other (things that) you love, help from God and a forthcoming victory. And give good news to the believers.

14.Bakhtiari Nejad: You who believe, be God's helpers, as Jesus, son of Mary, told his apostles: “Who are my helpers toward God?” The apostles said: “We are God's helpers.” So, a group of children of Israel believed and a group disbelieved. Then We helped those who believed against their enemies, and they became victorious.

62.SurahEnglishNames: The Congregation, Friday, The Day of Congregation

1.Bakhtiari Nejad: Everything in the skies and everything on the earth glorifies God, the ruler, the holy, the powerful, the wise.

2.Bakhtiari Nejad: He is the One Who raised among the illiterate a messenger from themselves to read to them His verses and to purify (and absolve) them and to teach them the book and wisdom while they were indeed in obvious error in the past.

3.Bakhtiari Nejad: And others among them who have not joined them yet. And He is the powerful, the wise.

4.Bakhtiari Nejad: That is God's grace, He gives it to anyone He wants, and God has enormous grace.

5.Bakhtiari Nejad: Example of those who were charged with (upholding) the Torah and they did not carry it out is like the example of the donkey carrying books. The example of the people who denied God's signs is miserable. And God does not guide wrongdoing people.

6.Bakhtiari Nejad: Say: “Jews, if you claim that you are God's friends (and His chosen ones) and no other people, then wish for death (to go to paradise sooner) if you are truthful.”

7.Bakhtiari Nejad: And they will never wish it because of what they have sent ahead, and God knows the wrongdoers well.

8.Bakhtiari Nejad: Say: “Indeed death, that you run away from it, catches up with you, then you are returned to knower of the unseen and the visible, then He informs you of what you were doing.”

9.Bakhtiari Nejad: You who believe, when the call is made for mandatory prayer on Friday (the day of gathering), then hurry up to God's remembrance and stop the trade. That is better for you if only you knew.

10.Bakhtiari Nejad: Then when mandatory prayer is finished, disperse in the land and look for God's bounty, and remember God often, so that you may be successful.

11.Bakhtiari Nejad: And when they see a business or an amusement, they go away to it and leave you standing. Say: “What is with God is better than amusement and business, and God is the best of providers.”

1.Bakhtiari Nejad: When the hypocrites come to you, they say: “We testify that indeed you are God's messenger” while God knows that you are His messenger, and God testifies that the hypocrites are certainly liars.

2.Bakhtiari Nejad: They took their oath as a shield, then obstructed (people) from God's way. Indeed, what they were doing is bad.

3.Bakhtiari Nejad: That is because they believed, then disbelieved, so their hearts were sealed, and they do not understand.

4.Bakhtiari Nejad: And when you see them, their bodies impress you and if they speak, you listen to their speech, (but they are shallow) as if they are lumbers leaned (against a wall and can’t stand on their own), they think that every shout is against them. They are the enemy, so beware of them. May God destroy them, how are they deviated (from the truth)?

5.Bakhtiari Nejad: And when they are told: “Come, God's messenger asks forgiveness for you” they turn their heads, and you see them turn away in arrogance.

6.Bakhtiari Nejad: It is the same for them whether you ask forgiveness for them or you do not ask forgiveness for them. God will never forgive them. Indeed, God does not guide the disobedient people.

7.Bakhtiari Nejad: They are those who say: “Do not spend on those who are with God's messenger until they break up.” The treasures of the skies and the earth belong to God, but the hypocrites do not understand.

8.Bakhtiari Nejad: They say: “If we return to Medina, the more powerful shall drive out the weaker from there.” The power (and honor) belongs to God and His messenger and the believers, but the hypocrites do not know.

9.Bakhtiari Nejad: You who believe, your possessions and your children should not distract you from God's remembrance. And anyone who does that, then they are the losers.

10.Bakhtiari Nejad: And spend (in God's way) from what We have provided for you before death comes to one of you and he says: “My Lord, why did You not postpone me (my death) for a short period, so that I give to charity and be of the righteous?”

11.Bakhtiari Nejad: And God will never postpone (death of) anyone when his time comes. God is well informed of what you do.

1.Bakhtiari Nejad: Everything in the skies and everything on the earth glorifies God. The rule belongs to Him, and all praise belongs to Him, and He is capable of everything.

2.Bakhtiari Nejad: He is the One Who created you, then some of you are disbelievers and some of you are believers. God sees whatever you do.

3.Bakhtiari Nejad: He created the skies and the earth with truth, and He shaped you, and shaped you well, and the final return is to Him.

4.Bakhtiari Nejad: He knows whatever is in the skies and on the earth, and He knows what you hide and what you disclose. God knows inside the chests/minds.

5.Bakhtiari Nejad: Has the news of those who disbelieved in the past not come to you? They tasted the bad result of their affair, and they will have a painful punishment.

6.Bakhtiari Nejad: That is because their messenger brought them clear evidences, then they said: “Does a human being guide us?” So, they disbelieved and turned away, while God does not need them, and God is rich (without needs) and praiseworthy.

7.Bakhtiari Nejad: Those who disbelieve claim that they will never be raised (in the Hereafter). Say: “Yes, by my Lord, you shall be raised, then you shall be informed of what you did, and that is easy for God.”

8.Bakhtiari Nejad: So, believe in God and His messenger and the light which We have sent down, and God is well informed of what you do.

9.Bakhtiari Nejad: The day when He gathers you for the day of gathering, that is the day of mutual loss and gain. And anyone who believes in God and does good, He will remove his sins from him and admits him to gardens which rivers flow through them, remaining in there forever and ever. That is the great victory.

10.Bakhtiari Nejad: And those who disbelieve and deny Our signs, they will be inhabitants of the fire, remaining in there forever, and it is the bad destination.

11.Bakhtiari Nejad: No tragedy happens except with God's permission (according to His laws). And anyone who believes in God, He guides his heart. And God knows everything.

12.Bakhtiari Nejad: And obey God and obey the messenger, and if you turn away, then Our messenger's responsibility is only delivering (the message) clearly.

13.Bakhtiari Nejad: God, there is no god except Him, so the believers should put their trust in God.

14.Bakhtiari Nejad: You who believe, indeed some of your wives and your children are your enemies, so beware of them. And if you excuse and overlook and forgive, then indeed God is forgiving and merciful.

15.Bakhtiari Nejad: Your possessions and your children are only a test, and the big reward is with God.

16.Bakhtiari Nejad: So, be cautious of God as much as you can and listen and obey and spend (in God's way), it is better for yourselves, and anyone who protects himself from stinginess (and greed), then they are the successful ones.

17.Bakhtiari Nejad: If you lend God a good loan (do a good deed), He multiplies it for you and forgives you. God is appreciative and patient.

18.Bakhtiari Nejad: (God is) knower of the unseen and the visible, the powerful, the wise.

1.Bakhtiari Nejad: Prophet, when you divorce women, then divorce them after their waiting period (three monthly periods) and keep count of the waiting period and be cautious of God, your Lord. (During that period) do not drive them out of their houses and they should not leave unless they commit an obvious indecency. These are limits set by God. And anyone who exceeds the limits set by God then he has wronged himself. You do not know, God may bring about an affair after that (to cause reconciliation).

2.Bakhtiari Nejad: And when they reach their appointed time, then keep them nicely or part with them nicely, and take witness two just persons from among yourselves, and perform the testimony for God. This is what anyone who believes in God and the Last Day is advised to it. And anyone who is cautious of God, He makes a way out for him.

3.Bakhtiari Nejad: And He provides him from where he would not think. And whoever puts his trust in God then He is enough for him. Indeed, God achieves His purpose. God has set a (proper) measure for everything.

4.Bakhtiari Nejad: And if you have doubt about those women of yours who are hopeless of menstruation then their waiting period is three months, as well as those who do not menstruate. And those who carry (are pregnant), their appointed time is until they deliver their load (and give birth). And anyone who is cautious of God, He makes his affair easy for him.

5.Bakhtiari Nejad: This is God's command which He has sent it down to you. And anyone who is cautious of God, He will remove his sins from him, and He makes his reward great.

6.Bakhtiari Nejad: Let them live where you live, according to your means, and do not harm them in order to pressure them (to leave). And if they are carrying, then spend on them until they deliver their load (and give birth). And if they nurse (your child) for you, then give them their wages and consult between yourselves nicely, and if you find it difficult then another (woman) may nurse (the child) for him.

7.Bakhtiari Nejad: A wealthy man should spend according to his wealth and anyone whose provision is restricted then he should spend according to what God has given him. God does not task anyone except according to what He has given it. God is going to bring about ease after difficulty.

8.Bakhtiari Nejad: And how many towns disobeyed its Lord's commandment and His messengers, then We called it into account, a severe reckoning, and We punished it, an awful punishment.

9.Bakhtiari Nejad: So, it tasted the bad result of its affair and the end of its affair was loss.

10.Bakhtiari Nejad: God has prepared a severe punishment for them. So, you people of understanding, who believe, be cautious of God. God has sent down a reminder to you.

11.Bakhtiari Nejad: A messenger who reads God's clear signs to you in order to bring out those who believe and do good from the darkness into the light. And anyone who believes and does good, He will admit him to gardens which rivers flow through them, remaining in there forever and ever. God has made good provision for him.

12.Bakhtiari Nejad: God is the One Who created seven skies, and like them of the earth, the command comes down between them so that you know that God is capable of everything and that God surrounds (has complete knowledge of) everything.

1.Bakhtiari Nejad: Prophet, why do you prohibit what God made lawful for you looking for your wives' pleasure? God is forgiving and merciful.

2.Bakhtiari Nejad: God has mandated for you breaking up of your oaths (when they are in conflict with God's commandments). God is your protector, and He is the knowledgeable, the wise.

3.Bakhtiari Nejad: And when the prophet confidentially told a saying to one of his wives, then when she told (the other) about it, God informed him of it, making known some of it and avoided some. So, when he told her about it, she said: “Who told you about this?” He said: “The knowledgeable, the well-informed told me.”

4.Bakhtiari Nejad: So, if you two repent to God, then your hearts have inclined (to God's command), and if you back each other up against him, then God is indeed his protector as well as Gabriel and the righteous believers, furthermore the angels are (also his) supporters.
