5.Bakhtiari Nejad: If he divorces you, perhaps his Lord gives him better wives than you in exchange, submitted, believer, obedient, repentant, devoted servant, fasting, previously married and virgin women.

6.Bakhtiari Nejad: You who believe, protect yourselves and your families from a fire that its fuel is people and rocks, over which are angels harsh and severe who do not disobey God in what He orders them, and they do what they are ordered.

7.Bakhtiari Nejad: You who disbelieved, do not apologize today, you are only penalized for what you used to do.

8.Bakhtiari Nejad: You who believe, repent to God a sincere repentance, perhaps your Lord removes your sins from you and admits you to gardens which rivers flow through them on the day when God does not humiliate the prophet and those who believe with him. Their light rushing ahead of them and to the right of them, and they say: “Our Lord, complete our light for us and forgive us, You are capable of everything.”

9.Bakhtiari Nejad: Prophet, try hard against the disbelievers and the hypocrites and be firm against them. Their housing will be hell, a miserable destination.

10.Bakhtiari Nejad: God gave an example of those who disbelieved, wife of Noah and wife of Lot, they were under (marriage to) two servants from Our righteous servants, then they both betrayed them, so they were of no use to them against God whatsoever, and were told: “Enter the fire with those who enter.”

11.Bakhtiari Nejad: And God gave an example of those who believed, wife of Pharaoh, when she said: “My Lord, build me a house with you in the garden and save me from Pharaoh and his work and save me from the wrongdoing people.”

12.Bakhtiari Nejad: And Mary, daughter of Imran, who guarded her private part, then We blew from Our breath of life (or spirit) into it and she confirmed her Lord's words and His books, and she was of the obedient ones.

1.Bakhtiari Nejad: Blessed is the One that the kingdom is in His hands, and He is capable of everything.

2.Bakhtiari Nejad: The One Who created death and life to test which one of you does better work. And He is the powerful, the forgiving.

3.Bakhtiari Nejad: The One Who created seven skies one above the other (in layers). You do not see any inconsistency in the creation of the beneficent. So, return the eye (to look again), do you see any cracks?

4.Bakhtiari Nejad: Then return the eye (to look) again and again, the eye returns to you confused and tired.

5.Bakhtiari Nejad: And We have certainly beautified the world's sky with lamps (stars), and We have made them meteorites for (throwing at) the devils, and We have prepared the punishment of burning fire for them.

6.Bakhtiari Nejad: And for those who disbelieve in their Lord is punishment of hell, and it is the bad destination.

7.Bakhtiari Nejad: When they are thrown in it, they hear howling from it while it boils.

8.Bakhtiari Nejad: It nearly blows up from the rage. Every time a group (of disbelievers) is thrown in it, its keepers ask them: “Did a warner not come to you?”

9.Bakhtiari Nejad: They say: “Yes, a warner did come to us, but we denied and we said: “God did not send down anything, you are only in a great error.””

10.Bakhtiari Nejad: And they (also) say: “If we had listened or had understood, we would not be among inhabitants of the burning fire.”

11.Bakhtiari Nejad: So, they confess to their sin, so down with the inhabitants of the burning fire.

12.Bakhtiari Nejad: Those who are afraid of (disobeying) their Lord in secret (without seeing Him), they will have forgiveness and a great reward.

13.Bakhtiari Nejad: Whether you hide your word or you disclose it, He knows what is inside the chests/minds.

14.Bakhtiari Nejad: Does He not know what He created? He is nice and well-informed.

15.Bakhtiari Nejad: He is the One Who made the earth tame for you, so walk in its tracts and eat of His provision. The resurrection (of everyone) is to Him.

16.Bakhtiari Nejad: Are you safe from the One in the sky that He would not make you sink in the earth when it suddenly shakes?

17.Bakhtiari Nejad: Or are you safe from the One in the sky that He would not send a sandstorm upon you? Then you are going to know how My warning is.

18.Bakhtiari Nejad: And those before them have certainly denied, so how was My rejection (and punishment)?

19.Bakhtiari Nejad: Or did they not look at the birds above them spreading (their) wings and folding them? What holds them except the beneficent? He sees everything.

20.Bakhtiari Nejad: Or who is the one who is an army for you and helps you, other than the beneficent? The disbelievers are only in deception.

21.Bakhtiari Nejad: Or who is the one who provides for you if He withholds His provision? No, but they insist on rebellion and unruliness.

22.Bakhtiari Nejad: Is someone who walks with his face downward (not seeing what is in front of him) better guided or someone who walks properly on a straight path?

23.Bakhtiari Nejad: Say: “He is the One Who created you and made hearing, sight, and hearts/intellect for you, but you thank a little.”

24.Bakhtiari Nejad: Say: “He is the One Who scattered you on the earth, and you will be gathered to Him.”

25.Bakhtiari Nejad: And they say: “When is this promise, if you are truthful?”

26.Bakhtiari Nejad: Say: “Knowledge of it (the Resurrection Day) is only with God, and I am only to warn clearly.”

27.Bakhtiari Nejad: Then when they see it near, faces of those who disbelieved turn gloomy, and it is said: “This is what you used to call for.”

28.Bakhtiari Nejad: Say: “What do you think, whether God destroys me and those with me or He has mercy on us, who protects the disbelievers from a painful punishment?”

29.Bakhtiari Nejad: Say: “He is the beneficent, we believed in Him and we trust in Him, and you are going to know who is in obvious error.”

30.Bakhtiari Nejad: Say: “What do you think, if your water (sinks deep and) becomes dried up then who brings you (fresh) running water?”

1.Bakhtiari Nejad: N. (Nun.) By the pen and what they write,

2.Bakhtiari Nejad: by your Lord's grace, you are not a madman.

3.Bakhtiari Nejad: And indeed, an unending reward is for you.

4.Bakhtiari Nejad: And you are indeed on a great manner/character (by means of Quran).

5.Bakhtiari Nejad: So, you are going to see and they will see,

6.Bakhtiari Nejad: which of you is the crazy one.

7.Bakhtiari Nejad: Indeed, your Lord knows best who is lost from His way, and He knows best who the guided ones are.

8.Bakhtiari Nejad: So, do not obey the deniers.

9.Bakhtiari Nejad: They wish that you would be flexible (to appease them), then they would be flexible.

10.Bakhtiari Nejad: So, do not obey any insignificant oath taker,

11.Bakhtiari Nejad: slandering, going around (spreading) malicious lies,

12.Bakhtiari Nejad: preventing the good, exceeding the limits, sinful,

13.Bakhtiari Nejad: ill-mannered (and despicable), and after all this mean (and notorious),

14.Bakhtiari Nejad: even if he is wealthy and has many children.

15.Bakhtiari Nejad: When Our verses are read to him, he says: “Stories of the earlier ones.”

16.Bakhtiari Nejad: We are going to brand him on the nose.

17.Bakhtiari Nejad: Indeed, We test them as We tested the owners of the garden when they swore they shall pick it in the morning,

18.Bakhtiari Nejad: with no exceptions.

19.Bakhtiari Nejad: Then a disaster from your Lord came to it while they were sleeping,

20.Bakhtiari Nejad: so it became like a totally picked field.

21.Bakhtiari Nejad: Then they called one another in the morning

22.Bakhtiari Nejad: (saying:) “Go to your crop early if you are pickers (of the fruits)”

23.Bakhtiari Nejad: so they went on, and they were talking softly (saying:)

24.Bakhtiari Nejad: “No poor shall enter it against you (your will) today.”

25.Bakhtiari Nejad: And they went out early determined and capable.

26.Bakhtiari Nejad: Then when they saw it, they said: “We are definitely lost,

27.Bakhtiari Nejad: no, but we are deprived.”

28.Bakhtiari Nejad: The fairest of them said: “Did I not tell you: “Why do you not glorify (God)?”?”

29.Bakhtiari Nejad: They said: “Our Lord is flawless; indeed we were wrongdoers.”

30.Bakhtiari Nejad: So, they turned on each other blaming one another.

31.Bakhtiari Nejad: They said: “Woe to us, indeed we were rebellious,

32.Bakhtiari Nejad: perhaps our Lord gives us better than that in exchange, indeed we are fond of our Lord.”

33.Bakhtiari Nejad: That is how the punishment is, and the punishment of the Hereafter is certainly greater, if they knew.

34.Bakhtiari Nejad: Indeed, there are gardens of delight with their Lord for those who are cautious (of God).

35.Bakhtiari Nejad: Shall We then place/treat the submitted ones the same as the guilty ones (in the Hereafter)?

36.Bakhtiari Nejad: What is with you, how do you judge (like this)?

37.Bakhtiari Nejad: Do you have a book that you study from,

38.Bakhtiari Nejad: and in it you have whatever you choose?

39.Bakhtiari Nejad: Or do you have any vows (binding) on Us, reaching to the Resurrection Day, that whatever you judge is yours?

40.Bakhtiari Nejad: Ask them which one of them guarantees this.

41.Bakhtiari Nejad: Or do they have associates? Then let them bring their associates if they are truthful.

42.Bakhtiari Nejad: On a day when the leg is bared (and the deeds are exposed) and they are called to prostration but they cannot,

43.Bakhtiari Nejad: lowering their eyes, humiliation overcomes them, and they had been called to show humbleness while they were sound and healthy.

44.Bakhtiari Nejad: So, leave Me (alone) with anyone who denies this saying (Quran), We are going to gradually lure them to destruction from where they do not know.

45.Bakhtiari Nejad: And I give them time, as My plan is solid.

46.Bakhtiari Nejad: Or do you ask them for a wage, and they are weighed down by the debt?

47.Bakhtiari Nejad: Or is the unseen with them, so they write it?

48.Bakhtiari Nejad: So, be patient for judgment of your Lord and do not be like companion of the fish (Jonah) when he called out while he was irritated.

49.Bakhtiari Nejad: If it was not for a favor from his Lord that had reached him, he would have been thrown to the desert shore while he was condemned.

50.Bakhtiari Nejad: But his Lord chose him and made him of the righteous.

51.Bakhtiari Nejad: And those who disbelieve almost make you slip with their eyes (looking hatefully and sarcastically) when they hear the reminder, and they say: “He is certainly mad.”

52.Bakhtiari Nejad: And it (Quran) is only a reminder for humankind.

1.Bakhtiari Nejad: The inevitable disaster.

2.Bakhtiari Nejad: What is the inevitable disaster?

3.Bakhtiari Nejad: How would you know what the inevitable disaster is?

4.Bakhtiari Nejad: Thamud and Aad denied the pounding catastrophe.

5.Bakhtiari Nejad: As for Thamud, they were destroyed by the wrongful conduct (or by the enormous blast).

6.Bakhtiari Nejad: And as for Aad, they were destroyed by violent severe cold wind

7.Bakhtiari Nejad: which He subjected them to seven nights and eight days of it consecutively, then you would have seen people fallen down in there as if they were trunks of hollow (and dried up) date palms.

8.Bakhtiari Nejad: So, do you see any of them left?

9.Bakhtiari Nejad: And Pharaoh and those before him and the turned over cities (Sodom and Gomorrah) came with sin.

10.Bakhtiari Nejad: Then they disobeyed their Lord's messenger, so He punished them, an increasing punishment.

11.Bakhtiari Nejad: Indeed, when the water rose up, We carried you on the sailing ship (the Ark).

12.Bakhtiari Nejad: So that We make it a reminder for you, and attentive ears keep it in mind.

13.Bakhtiari Nejad: So, when the horn is blown, a single blow,

14.Bakhtiari Nejad: and the earth and the mountains are lifted and crushed in a single blow,

15.Bakhtiari Nejad: then on that day the event happens,

16.Bakhtiari Nejad: and the sky splits, then on that day it (the sky) is weak,

17.Bakhtiari Nejad: and the angels are at its sides, and eight (angels) carry your Lord’s dominion above them.

18.Bakhtiari Nejad: On that day you are presented (before God) and none of your secrets remains hidden.

19.Bakhtiari Nejad: So, as for anyone who is given his book (of records) to his right hand, he says: “Here, read my book (of records),

20.Bakhtiari Nejad: indeed, I thought I come across my account.”

21.Bakhtiari Nejad: Then he will be in a pleasant life,

22.Bakhtiari Nejad: in an excellent garden,

23.Bakhtiari Nejad: its clusters of fruits are nearby (and within easy reach).

24.Bakhtiari Nejad: (They are told:) “Eat and drink joyfully for what you sent in advance in the days gone by.”

25.Bakhtiari Nejad: But anyone who is given his book to his left hand, he says: “I wish I was not given my book,

26.Bakhtiari Nejad: and I did not know what my account is,

27.Bakhtiari Nejad: I wish (my death) was the end,

28.Bakhtiari Nejad: my wealth was of no use to me,

29.Bakhtiari Nejad: my power departed from me.”

30.Bakhtiari Nejad: (It will be said:) “Take him and shackle him

31.Bakhtiari Nejad: then make him enter (and burn in) the hellfire

32.Bakhtiari Nejad: then put him in a chain that its length is seventy cubits,

33.Bakhtiari Nejad: for indeed he did not use to believe in the great God,

34.Bakhtiari Nejad: and he did not encourage feeding the poor.

35.Bakhtiari Nejad: So, there is no close friend for him here today,

36.Bakhtiari Nejad: and no food except pus,

37.Bakhtiari Nejad: that no one eats it except the sinners.”

38.Bakhtiari Nejad: So, I swear by what you see

39.Bakhtiari Nejad: and what you do not see

40.Bakhtiari Nejad: that it (Quran) is certainly a noble messenger’s word,

41.Bakhtiari Nejad: and it is not word of a poet. A few of you believe (or you believe a little).

42.Bakhtiari Nejad: And it is not the word of a fortune-teller (or a priest). You take a little notice.

43.Bakhtiari Nejad: A revelation from the Lord of humankind.

44.Bakhtiari Nejad: And if he had made up some sayings (and attributed them) to Us,

45.Bakhtiari Nejad: We would have certainly taken him by the right hand

46.Bakhtiari Nejad: then We would have cut off his main artery

47.Bakhtiari Nejad: and none of you could have kept it away from him.

48.Bakhtiari Nejad: And certainly it (Quran) is a reminder for those who are cautious (of God).

49.Bakhtiari Nejad: And We certainly know that some of you are deniers (of it),

50.Bakhtiari Nejad: and it will certainly be a (cause of) regret for the disbelievers.

51.Bakhtiari Nejad: And indeed, it is the sure truth.

52.Bakhtiari Nejad: So, glorify the name of your great Lord.

1.Bakhtiari Nejad: A questioner asked about a punishment bound to happen.

2.Bakhtiari Nejad: None can prevent it for the disbelievers.

3.Bakhtiari Nejad: (It is) from God, the owner of the places of ascent.

4.Bakhtiari Nejad: The angels and the spirit ascend to Him in a day that its measure is fifty thousand years.

5.Bakhtiari Nejad: So, be patient, a nice patience.

6.Bakhtiari Nejad: Indeed, they see it far

7.Bakhtiari Nejad: while We see it near.

8.Bakhtiari Nejad: The day when the sky is like the melted copper,

9.Bakhtiari Nejad: and the mountains are like the colored wool,

10.Bakhtiari Nejad: and a friend does not ask about a friend

11.Bakhtiari Nejad: (although) they are made to see them. The guilty wishes to redeem himself from the punishment of that day by (offering) his children

12.Bakhtiari Nejad: and his spouse and his brother

13.Bakhtiari Nejad: and his family who sheltered him

14.Bakhtiari Nejad: and everyone on the earth, so that it saves him.

15.Bakhtiari Nejad: No way, indeed it is flame (of hell)

16.Bakhtiari Nejad: stripping off the scalp (by burning it),

17.Bakhtiari Nejad: calling anyone who turned his back and turned away

18.Bakhtiari Nejad: and collected and withheld (his wealth).

19.Bakhtiari Nejad: Indeed, human being is created greedy (and anxious),

20.Bakhtiari Nejad: impatient (and worried) when badness touches him,

21.Bakhtiari Nejad: and miserly (and stingy) when goodness touches him,

22.Bakhtiari Nejad: except the performers of mandatory prayers,

23.Bakhtiari Nejad: those who perform their mandatory prayer all the time

24.Bakhtiari Nejad: and those in their wealth there is a known right

25.Bakhtiari Nejad: for the beggar and the disadvantaged,

26.Bakhtiari Nejad: and those who acknowledge the Judgment Day

27.Bakhtiari Nejad: and those who are afraid of their Lord's punishment,

28.Bakhtiari Nejad: as indeed no one is safe from their Lord's punishment,

29.Bakhtiari Nejad: and those who guard their private parts,

30.Bakhtiari Nejad: except from their spouses or what their right hands own as indeed they are blameless

31.Bakhtiari Nejad: and anyone who looks for (anything) beyond this then they are of those exceeding the limits,

32.Bakhtiari Nejad: and those who observe their trusts and their promise

33.Bakhtiari Nejad: and those who are upstanding in their testimony

34.Bakhtiari Nejad: and those who guard their mandatory prayer,

35.Bakhtiari Nejad: they are the honored ones in gardens.

36.Bakhtiari Nejad: So, what is with those who disbelieve, rushing (and staring) toward you

37.Bakhtiari Nejad: from the right and from the left, in groups?

38.Bakhtiari Nejad: Does every one of them expect to enter a garden of delight?

39.Bakhtiari Nejad: No way, indeed We created them from what they know.

40.Bakhtiari Nejad: So, I swear by the Lord of the easts and the wests that We are certainly able

41.Bakhtiari Nejad: to substitute (them with) better than them, and We are not incapable (and cannot be stopped from doing that).

42.Bakhtiari Nejad: So, leave them to engage in useless/false discussion and play until they meet their day which they are promised.

43.Bakhtiari Nejad: The day when they come out of the graves in a hurry as if they are rushing to an idol.

44.Bakhtiari Nejad: Lowering their eyes, humiliation overcomes them, that is the day that they were being promised.

1.Bakhtiari Nejad: Indeed, We sent Noah to his people (telling him:) “Warn your people before a painful punishment comes to them.”

2.Bakhtiari Nejad: He said: “My people, I am a clear warner for you,

3.Bakhtiari Nejad: (warning you) that you should serve God and be cautious of Him and obey me.

4.Bakhtiari Nejad: He forgives you of your sins and He postpones you for a limited period. Indeed, when God's appointed time comes, it is not postponed if you knew.”

5.Bakhtiari Nejad: He said: “My Lord, indeed I invited my people night and day,

6.Bakhtiari Nejad: but my invitation only increased (their) running away,

7.Bakhtiari Nejad: and indeed, every time I invited them so that You forgive them, they put their fingers in their ears and covered themselves with their clothes and insisted and were extremely arrogant.

8.Bakhtiari Nejad: So, I invited them openly,

9.Bakhtiari Nejad: then indeed I made it public for them, and confided in them secretly,

10.Bakhtiari Nejad: then I said: “Ask forgiveness from your Lord, indeed He is very forgiving,

11.Bakhtiari Nejad: He sends plenty of rain on you from the sky,

12.Bakhtiari Nejad: and He helps you with wealth and children, and He makes gardens for you, and He makes rivers for you.

13.Bakhtiari Nejad: What is with you that you are not apprehensive of (or you do not believe in) God’s magnificence (and you disobey Him)?

14.Bakhtiari Nejad: While He has created you in phases.

15.Bakhtiari Nejad: Do you not consider how God created seven skies one above the other?

16.Bakhtiari Nejad: And He made the moon in them as a light and made the sun as a lamp,

17.Bakhtiari Nejad: and He made you grow from the earth (like) a plant

18.Bakhtiari Nejad: then He returns you into it and brings you out (in another) bringing out,

19.Bakhtiari Nejad: and God made the earth a widespread mat for you,

20.Bakhtiari Nejad: so that you move around in it on wide roadways.””

21.Bakhtiari Nejad: Noah said: “My Lord, indeed they disobeyed me and followed someone whose wealth and children did not add anything to him except loss.”

22.Bakhtiari Nejad: And they plotted a great plot,

23.Bakhtiari Nejad: and they said: “Do not abandon your gods, and do not leave Wadd or Suwa or Yaghus and Ya'uq and Nasr.”

24.Bakhtiari Nejad: And (Noah said:) “They have misguided many (people), so (my Lord,) do not increase the wrongdoers except in error.”

25.Bakhtiari Nejad: They were drowned because of their sins, then they were made to enter the fire, and they did not find any helpers for themselves besides God.

26.Bakhtiari Nejad: And Noah said: "My Lord, do not leave any of the disbelievers living on the earth,

27.Bakhtiari Nejad: indeed, if You leave them, they misguide Your servants, and they would only give birth to an immoral, a disbeliever.

28.Bakhtiari Nejad: My Lord, forgive me and my parents, and anyone who enters my house (being a) believer, and the believing men and the believing women, and do not increase the wrongdoers except in destruction.”

1.Bakhtiari Nejad: Say: “It was revealed to me that a group of the Jinn listened, then they said: “Indeed we heard an amazing Quran,

2.Bakhtiari Nejad: it guides to the right way, so we believed in it, and we will never associate anyone with our Lord,

3.Bakhtiari Nejad: and that our Lord’s majesty is great, and He did not take a spouse or a child,

4.Bakhtiari Nejad: and that the fools among us used to say outrageous (lies) about God,

5.Bakhtiari Nejad: and we assumed that humans and Jinn never lie about God.

6.Bakhtiari Nejad: There were men among humans who were seeking protection from Jinn's men, so they increased them in foolishness (and injustice).

7.Bakhtiari Nejad: And they assumed as you assumed, that God never raises anyone.

8.Bakhtiari Nejad: And we touched the sky, then we found it filled with tough guards and shooting flames,

9.Bakhtiari Nejad: and we used to sit there in positions for listening, but anyone who listens now finds a shooting flame waiting for him.

10.Bakhtiari Nejad: And we do not know if badness is wanted for anyone on the earth or their Lord wants a right way for them.

11.Bakhtiari Nejad: And that some of us are the righteous and some of us are otherwise, we are (following) different ways.

12.Bakhtiari Nejad: And we know that we will never make God powerless on the earth, and we will never escape Him by running away.

13.Bakhtiari Nejad: And when we heard the guidance, we believed in it. Anyone who believes in his Lord, then he should not be afraid of a reduced (reward) or any injustice.

14.Bakhtiari Nejad: And some of us are the submitted ones, and some of us are unjust, so whoever submits (to God) then they have pursued the right way,

15.Bakhtiari Nejad: and as for the unjust, they are fuel for hell.””

16.Bakhtiari Nejad: And if they keep on the (right) way, then We give them plenty of water to drink (and plenty of wealth and provision),

17.Bakhtiari Nejad: so that We test them by it. And anyone who stays away from his Lord's remembrance, He puts him in a terrible punishment.

18.Bakhtiari Nejad: Places of worship belong to God, so do not call on anyone with God.

19.Bakhtiari Nejad: And when God's servant stood up calling on Him (alone), they almost became a mob against him.

20.Bakhtiari Nejad: Say: “I only call on my Lord and I do not associate anyone with Him.”

21.Bakhtiari Nejad: Say: “I do not have power of any harm or any benefit for you.”

22.Bakhtiari Nejad: Say: “Indeed no one will ever protect me from God, and I will never find any refuge besides Him.

23.Bakhtiari Nejad: (I have no responsibility) except delivering (the truth) from God and His message.” And anyone who disobeys God and His messenger, then indeed fire of hell is for him, remaining in there forever.

24.Bakhtiari Nejad: Until when they see what they are promised, then they are going to know who is weaker in helper and fewer in number.

25.Bakhtiari Nejad: Say: “I do not know whether what you are promised is near or if my Lord has set a far-out time for it.

26.Bakhtiari Nejad: (God is) knower of the unseen, and He does not inform anyone of His unseen

27.Bakhtiari Nejad: except any messenger whom He approves of, then He sends an observer (a guard) in front of him and behind him,

28.Bakhtiari Nejad: so that He knows that they have delivered their Lord’s message, and He surrounds (and has complete knowledge of) whatever is with them, and He keeps count of everything.”

73.SurahEnglishNames: The Enshrouded One, Bundled Up, The Mantled One

1.Bakhtiari Nejad: You who have wrapped yourself (with your clothes),

2.Bakhtiari Nejad: get up at night, except a little,

3.Bakhtiari Nejad: half of it or a little less of it

4.Bakhtiari Nejad: or add (a little) to it, and recite the Quran distinctly (slowly and thoughtfully).

5.Bakhtiari Nejad: Indeed, We are going to throw a heavy word on you.

6.Bakhtiari Nejad: Indeed, rising up at night is more effective and more appropriate for word (of prayer).

7.Bakhtiari Nejad: Indeed, you have lengthy occupations during the day.

8.Bakhtiari Nejad: And remember the name of your Lord and devote (your life) to Him devotedly.

9.Bakhtiari Nejad: The Lord of the east and the west, there is no god except Him, so take Him as an advocate.

10.Bakhtiari Nejad: And be patient about what they say and keep away from them nicely.

11.Bakhtiari Nejad: And leave Me and the deniers who have the good life, and give them a little time.

12.Bakhtiari Nejad: Indeed, there are shackles and hellfire with Us,

13.Bakhtiari Nejad: and food that chokes and a painful punishment (for them),

14.Bakhtiari Nejad: on the day the earth and the mountains shake, and the mountains become a pile of flowing sands.

15.Bakhtiari Nejad: Indeed, We sent a messenger to you as a witness over you as We sent a messenger to Pharaoh.

16.Bakhtiari Nejad: Then Pharaoh disobeyed the messenger, so We punished him, a disastrous punishment.

17.Bakhtiari Nejad: If you disbelieve, then how do you protect (yourselves) on the day that makes the children white-haired (grow old)?

18.Bakhtiari Nejad: (The day when) the sky is torn apart in it. God's promise shall be done.

19.Bakhtiari Nejad: Indeed this (Quran) is a reminder, so anyone who wants, takes a way to his Lord (with it).

20.Bakhtiari Nejad: Indeed, your Lord knows that you and a group of those with you get up nearly two thirds of the night or half of it or one third of it. God determines (length of) the night and the day, and He knows that you never calculate it, so He turned to you (in mercy), so read as much as you can from the Quran. He knows that some of you are going to get sick and others move around on the earth looking for His bounty and others fight in God's way, so read as much as you can from it, and perform mandatory prayer and give to mandatory charity and lend God a good loan (do a good deed). And anything good you send ahead for yourselves, you will find it as a better and greater reward with God. And ask forgiveness of God, as God is indeed forgiving and merciful.

74.SurahEnglishNames: The Cloaked One, The Man Wearing a Cloak, The Clothed One

1.Bakhtiari Nejad: You who have covered yourself,

2.Bakhtiari Nejad: get up and warn

3.Bakhtiari Nejad: and magnify your Lord

4.Bakhtiari Nejad: and cleanse your clothes

5.Bakhtiari Nejad: and keep away from filth

6.Bakhtiari Nejad: and do not do favor to ask for more

7.Bakhtiari Nejad: and be patient for (the sake of) your Lord.

8.Bakhtiari Nejad: So, when the horn is blown

9.Bakhtiari Nejad: then that day is a difficult day,

10.Bakhtiari Nejad: not easy upon the disbelievers.

11.Bakhtiari Nejad: Leave Me alone with whom I created

12.Bakhtiari Nejad: and I gave him plenty of wealth

13.Bakhtiari Nejad: and sons (who are) present

14.Bakhtiari Nejad: and made (everything) easy for him, so easy

15.Bakhtiari Nejad: yet he desires that I increase (it for him).

16.Bakhtiari Nejad: No way, indeed he is stubborn against Our signs.

17.Bakhtiari Nejad: I am going to make him suffer a terrible punishment.

18.Bakhtiari Nejad: Indeed, he thought and calculated.

19.Bakhtiari Nejad: So, death to him, how did he calculate?

20.Bakhtiari Nejad: Then (again), death to him, how did he calculate?

21.Bakhtiari Nejad: Then he looked

22.Bakhtiari Nejad: then he frowned and looked angry

23.Bakhtiari Nejad: then he turned back and showed arrogance.

24.Bakhtiari Nejad: Then he said: “This (Quran) is only a handed-down magic,

25.Bakhtiari Nejad: this is nothing but the word of a human being.”

26.Bakhtiari Nejad: I am going to enter (and burn) him in hell.

27.Bakhtiari Nejad: And how would you know what hell is?

28.Bakhtiari Nejad: It does not spare and it does not leave,

29.Bakhtiari Nejad: burning human being (skin and flesh).

30.Bakhtiari Nejad: (Guarding) over it are nineteen (angels)

31.Bakhtiari Nejad: and We made only the angels guardians of the fire and We made their numbers (nineteen) only as a test for those who disbelieve, so that those who were given the book would be certain and to increase the belief of those who believe, and those who were given the book and the believers would not doubt, and so that those who have a disease in their hearts and the disbelievers say: “What did God intend with this example?” That is how God misguides anyone He wants and guides anyone He wants. And none knows God's soldiers except Him. And this is only a reminder for the human being.

32.Bakhtiari Nejad: No way, by the moon,

33.Bakhtiari Nejad: and the night when it retreats,

34.Bakhtiari Nejad: and the morning when it lights up,

35.Bakhtiari Nejad: indeed it (hell) is one of the greatest (signs),

36.Bakhtiari Nejad: a warning for human being,

37.Bakhtiari Nejad: for any one of you who wants to be ahead (by believing) or to be behind (by disbelieving).

38.Bakhtiari Nejad: Every person is pawned by what he has done,

39.Bakhtiari Nejad: except associates of the right (the fortunate),

40.Bakhtiari Nejad: in gardens, asking

41.Bakhtiari Nejad: from the guilty ones:

42.Bakhtiari Nejad: “What made you enter into hell?”

43.Bakhtiari Nejad: They say: “We were not the performers of mandatory prayers

44.Bakhtiari Nejad: and we were not feeding the poor

45.Bakhtiari Nejad: and we used to enter into (false and useless) conversation with those conversing (falsely and uselessly)

46.Bakhtiari Nejad: and we used to deny the Judgment Day

47.Bakhtiari Nejad: until the certainty (of death) came to us.”

48.Bakhtiari Nejad: So, mediation of the mediators will not benefit them.

49.Bakhtiari Nejad: So, what is with them that they turn away from the reminder (Quran),

50.Bakhtiari Nejad: as if they are scared donkeys

51.Bakhtiari Nejad: running away from a lion!?

52.Bakhtiari Nejad: Yet, every one of them wants to be given open papers (from God),

53.Bakhtiari Nejad: certainly not (they will not believe). No, they are not afraid of the Hereafter.

54.Bakhtiari Nejad: On the contrary, indeed it (Quran) is a reminder,

55.Bakhtiari Nejad: so anyone who wants, will take notice (from) it.

56.Bakhtiari Nejad: And they will not take notice unless God wants. He is entitled to be cautioned of, and entitled to forgive.

75.SurahEnglishNames: The Rising of the Dead, Resurrection

1.Bakhtiari Nejad: I swear by the Resurrection Day,

2.Bakhtiari Nejad: and I swear by the blaming soul,

3.Bakhtiari Nejad: does the human being think that We will never put his bones together?

4.Bakhtiari Nejad: Yes, We are able to restore his fingertips (fingerprints).

5.Bakhtiari Nejad: But human being wants to sin in his future.

6.Bakhtiari Nejad: He asks: “When is the Resurrection Day?”

7.Bakhtiari Nejad: When the eye is baffled

8.Bakhtiari Nejad: and the moon is darkened

9.Bakhtiari Nejad: and the sun and the moon are joined together.

10.Bakhtiari Nejad: On that day the human being says: “Where is the escape?”

11.Bakhtiari Nejad: No way, there is no shelter.

12.Bakhtiari Nejad: On that day the place of stay is before your Lord.

13.Bakhtiari Nejad: On that day human being is informed of what he sent ahead and he put off.

14.Bakhtiari Nejad: Rather, human being has insight about himself,

15.Bakhtiari Nejad: even if he presents his excuses.

16.Bakhtiari Nejad: Do not move your tongue to rush for (remembering) it.

17.Bakhtiari Nejad: Indeed, its collection and its reading is Our responsibility.

18.Bakhtiari Nejad: So, when We read it, then follow its reading.

19.Bakhtiari Nejad: Then indeed its explanation is Our responsibility.

20.Bakhtiari Nejad: On the contrary, however you (people) like the transient (this world’s life),

21.Bakhtiari Nejad: and you leave (neglect) the Hereafter.

22.Bakhtiari Nejad: On that day some faces glow (from happiness),

23.Bakhtiari Nejad: looking at their Lord.

24.Bakhtiari Nejad: And on that day some faces are gloomy (from sadness),

25.Bakhtiari Nejad: thinking that a back breaking punishment will be done to them.

26.Bakhtiari Nejad: No way, when it (life) reaches to the collarbones (and the throat),

27.Bakhtiari Nejad: and it is said: “Who is a healer?”

28.Bakhtiari Nejad: And he thinks that it is the (time of) separation

29.Bakhtiari Nejad: and the leg is twisted around the leg,

30.Bakhtiari Nejad: on that day the driving will be toward your Lord.

31.Bakhtiari Nejad: He did not accept the truth and he did not pray,

32.Bakhtiari Nejad: but he denied and he turned away,

33.Bakhtiari Nejad: then he went to his family walking proudly.

34.Bakhtiari Nejad: Woe to you and woe,

35.Bakhtiari Nejad: then woe to you and woe.

36.Bakhtiari Nejad: Does the human being think that he is left aimlessly?

37.Bakhtiari Nejad: Was he not a fertilized egg (zygote) from ejaculated semen,

38.Bakhtiari Nejad: then it became a (dangling, clinging, and leach like) blood clot, then He created and shaped (it),

39.Bakhtiari Nejad: then He made two kinds from it, the male and the female?

40.Bakhtiari Nejad: Is not such (a creator) able to give life to the dead?

1.Bakhtiari Nejad: Did a period of time (not) come upon human being that he was nothing to be mentioned?

2.Bakhtiari Nejad: Indeed, We created human being from a mixture of fertilized egg (zygote) to test him, and We made hearing and sight for him.

3.Bakhtiari Nejad: Indeed, We guided him to the (right) way, whether he is grateful or ungrateful.

4.Bakhtiari Nejad: Indeed, We have prepared chains and shackles and burning fire for the disbelievers.

5.Bakhtiari Nejad: Indeed, the good ones drink from a cup that its mixture is camphor.

6.Bakhtiari Nejad: A spring that God's servants drink from it, they make it flow out abundantly (as they please).

7.Bakhtiari Nejad: They fulfill the pledges and they are afraid of a day that its badness is widespread,

8.Bakhtiari Nejad: and they feed the food to poor and orphans and captives for His love,

9.Bakhtiari Nejad: (saying:) “We feed you only for God's pleasure (and His attention), we do not want any reward or thanks from you,

10.Bakhtiari Nejad: we are afraid of our Lord in a harsh and distressful day.”

11.Bakhtiari Nejad: So, God protects them from badness of that day and gives them vitality and happiness.

12.Bakhtiari Nejad: And their reward for what they endured will be garden and silk.

13.Bakhtiari Nejad: Leaning on sofas in there, they do not see (burning) sun and bitter (freezing) cold in it.

14.Bakhtiari Nejad: And its shades are close over them and its fruits are lowered, hanging low.

15.Bakhtiari Nejad: And silver bowls and drinking glasses made of crystals are circulated among them,

16.Bakhtiari Nejad: crystals like silver, they determine their measure (and size).

17.Bakhtiari Nejad: And in there, they are given drink from a cup that its mixture is ginger,

18.Bakhtiari Nejad: from a spring in there called Salsabil.

19.Bakhtiari Nejad: And immortal youth circulate among them, so that when you see them you think they are scattered pearls.

20.Bakhtiari Nejad: And when you see it, there you will see delight and a great kingdom.

21.Bakhtiari Nejad: There are clothes of fine green silk and brocade on them, and they are decorated with silver bracelets, and their Lord gives them a pure drink to drink.

22.Bakhtiari Nejad: Indeed, this is a reward for you, and your effort is appreciated.

23.Bakhtiari Nejad: Indeed, We sent this Quran down to you gradually.

24.Bakhtiari Nejad: So, persevere (and be patient) for your Lord's command, and do not obey any sinful or ungrateful (disbeliever) among them.

25.Bakhtiari Nejad: And remember your Lord’s name morning and afternoon,

26.Bakhtiari Nejad: and during part of the night show your humbleness before Him and glorify Him long (part of) the night.

27.Bakhtiari Nejad: Indeed these (people) love the transient (this world’s life), and they leave (neglect) a cumbersome day behind.

28.Bakhtiari Nejad: We created them and We strengthened their form, and when We want We replace them with like them as a substitute.

29.Bakhtiari Nejad: Indeed this (Quran) is a reminder, so anyone who wants will take a way to his Lord (with following its instructions),

30.Bakhtiari Nejad: and you do not want except if God wants. Indeed, God is knowledgeable and wise.

31.Bakhtiari Nejad: He admits anyone He wants to His mercy, and He has prepared a painful punishment for the wrongdoers.

1.Bakhtiari Nejad: By those sent in succession

2.Bakhtiari Nejad: then by the storm, gusting

3.Bakhtiari Nejad: and by the spreaders, spreading

4.Bakhtiari Nejad: then by the separators, separating

5.Bakhtiari Nejad: then by those communicating a reminder

6.Bakhtiari Nejad: to excuse or to warn

7.Bakhtiari Nejad: that indeed what you are promised shall occur.

8.Bakhtiari Nejad: So, when the stars are wiped out

9.Bakhtiari Nejad: and when the sky is split open

10.Bakhtiari Nejad: and when the mountains are powdered

11.Bakhtiari Nejad: and when the messengers' time is set (for testifying or for gathering),

12.Bakhtiari Nejad: for what day (all these) are appointed?

13.Bakhtiari Nejad: For the day of separation/decision.

14.Bakhtiari Nejad: And how would you know what the day of separation/decision is?

15.Bakhtiari Nejad: Woe to the deniers on that day.

16.Bakhtiari Nejad: Did We not destroy the earlier ones?

17.Bakhtiari Nejad: Then We make the later ones follow them (in destruction).

18.Bakhtiari Nejad: That is how We deal with the guilty ones.

19.Bakhtiari Nejad: Woe to the deniers on that day.

20.Bakhtiari Nejad: Did We not create you from despicable liquid?

21.Bakhtiari Nejad: Then We placed it in a safe quarter (the womb)

22.Bakhtiari Nejad: for a known period.

23.Bakhtiari Nejad: So, We are able, and We are very capable.

24.Bakhtiari Nejad: Woe to the deniers on that day.

25.Bakhtiari Nejad: Did We not make the earth a holder

26.Bakhtiari Nejad: (for) living and dead?

27.Bakhtiari Nejad: And We placed towering mountains in it, and We gave you sweet fresh water to drink.

28.Bakhtiari Nejad: Woe to the deniers on that day.

29.Bakhtiari Nejad: (They will be told:) “Proceed to what you were denying,

30.Bakhtiari Nejad: proceed to shadow having three branches (of smoke)

31.Bakhtiari Nejad: that is not a shade and is of no use against the flame,

32.Bakhtiari Nejad: which indeed it shoots up sparks like towers

33.Bakhtiari Nejad: as if they were yellow camels.”

34.Bakhtiari Nejad: Woe to the deniers on that day.

35.Bakhtiari Nejad: This is a day when they will not speak

36.Bakhtiari Nejad: and it is not permitted for them to apologize.

37.Bakhtiari Nejad: Woe to the deniers on that day.

38.Bakhtiari Nejad: This is the day of separation/decision, We assemble you and the earlier ones.

39.Bakhtiari Nejad: So, if you have a plot (trick), then plot it.

40.Bakhtiari Nejad: Woe to the deniers on that day.

41.Bakhtiari Nejad: Indeed, those who are cautious (of God) are in shades and springs,

42.Bakhtiari Nejad: and whatever fruits they desire.

43.Bakhtiari Nejad: Eat and drink joyfully for what you used to do.

44.Bakhtiari Nejad: Indeed, that is how We reward the good doers.

45.Bakhtiari Nejad: Woe to the deniers on that day.

46.Bakhtiari Nejad: Eat and enjoy a little, you are indeed the guilty ones.

47.Bakhtiari Nejad: Woe to the deniers on that day.

48.Bakhtiari Nejad: And when they are told to bow down, they do not bow down.

49.Bakhtiari Nejad: Woe to the deniers on that day.

50.Bakhtiari Nejad: So, in what saying do they believe after it (Quran)?

1.Bakhtiari Nejad: What do they ask each other about?

2.Bakhtiari Nejad: About the great news.

3.Bakhtiari Nejad: The one that they disagree about.

4.Bakhtiari Nejad: No way, they are going to know.

5.Bakhtiari Nejad: Then, no way, they are going to know.

6.Bakhtiari Nejad: Did We not make the earth a resting place,

7.Bakhtiari Nejad: and the mountains as pins?

8.Bakhtiari Nejad: And We created you in pairs.

9.Bakhtiari Nejad: And We made your sleep as a rest.

10.Bakhtiari Nejad: And We made the night as a cover.

11.Bakhtiari Nejad: And We made the day as a livelihood (to earn a living).

12.Bakhtiari Nejad: And We built seven stable (skies) above you.

13.Bakhtiari Nejad: And We made (sun) a glowing lamp.

14.Bakhtiari Nejad: And We sent down plenty of rain from the dense clouds

15.Bakhtiari Nejad: that We bring out with it grain and plant

16.Bakhtiari Nejad: and dense (and lush) gardens.

17.Bakhtiari Nejad: Indeed, the day of separation/decision is an appointed time.

18.Bakhtiari Nejad: The day when the horn is blown and you come in groups (of large number).

19.Bakhtiari Nejad: And the sky is opened and becomes gates,

20.Bakhtiari Nejad: and the mountains are moved and become a mirage.

21.Bakhtiari Nejad: Indeed, hell is (waiting as) an ambush,

22.Bakhtiari Nejad: as a place of return for the rebellious ones,

23.Bakhtiari Nejad: staying in there for a long time.

24.Bakhtiari Nejad: They do not taste anything cool or any drink in there,

25.Bakhtiari Nejad: except boiling water and pus.

26.Bakhtiari Nejad: An appropriate punishment.

27.Bakhtiari Nejad: They were not expecting any reckoning,

28.Bakhtiari Nejad: and they strongly denied Our signs

29.Bakhtiari Nejad: while We keep track of everything in a book.

30.Bakhtiari Nejad: So, taste (the punishment), for We never add anything to you except punishment.

31.Bakhtiari Nejad: Indeed, victory is for those who are cautious (of God).

32.Bakhtiari Nejad: Fenced gardens and vineyards,

33.Bakhtiari Nejad: and fully developed maidens of the same age,

34.Bakhtiari Nejad: and overflowing cups.

35.Bakhtiari Nejad: They do not hear any useless talk or any lies in there.

36.Bakhtiari Nejad: A reward from your Lord, a calculated reward,

37.Bakhtiari Nejad: (a reward from) the Lord of the skies and the earth and whatever is between them, the beneficent. They do not have any authority from Him to talk,

38.Bakhtiari Nejad: a day when the spirit and the angels stand in a row, they do not speak except anyone whom the beneficent permits and he says what is right.

39.Bakhtiari Nejad: That is the day of the truth. So, anyone who wants, takes a way of returning to his Lord.

40.Bakhtiari Nejad: Indeed, We warned you of a forthcoming punishment, a day when a person looks at what his hands have sent ahead, and the disbeliever says: “I wish I was dust.”

79.SurahEnglishNames: Those Who Drag Forth, Soul-snatchers, Those Who Pulled Out

1.Bakhtiari Nejad: By those who pull out intensely

2.Bakhtiari Nejad: and by those who let out gently

3.Bakhtiari Nejad: and by those who swim/float smoothly

4.Bakhtiari Nejad: and by those who move ahead, outpacing

5.Bakhtiari Nejad: and by those who manage the affairs,

6.Bakhtiari Nejad: on the day when the earthquake shakes (the earth)

7.Bakhtiari Nejad: the subsequent one follows it,

8.Bakhtiari Nejad: on that day hearts tremble,

9.Bakhtiari Nejad: their eyes humbled (looking down),

10.Bakhtiari Nejad: they say: “Will we be restored to the original form,

11.Bakhtiari Nejad: even when we are decomposed bones?”

12.Bakhtiari Nejad: They say: “Then that would be a losing return.”

13.Bakhtiari Nejad: Then it is only a single scream

14.Bakhtiari Nejad: and they are immediately awake (on the surface).

15.Bakhtiari Nejad: Did the story of Moses come to you?

16.Bakhtiari Nejad: When his Lord called him in the holy valley of Tuwa (telling him):

17.Bakhtiari Nejad: “Go to Pharaoh for indeed he has rebelled.

18.Bakhtiari Nejad: Then say: “Do you like to purify (and absolve) yourself?

19.Bakhtiari Nejad: I will guide you to your Lord so you would fear (from His disobedience).””

20.Bakhtiari Nejad: Then he (Moses) showed him the great miracle,

21.Bakhtiari Nejad: but he denied and disobeyed,

22.Bakhtiari Nejad: then he turned his back trying (against God).

23.Bakhtiari Nejad: Then he gathered (his people) and called out

24.Bakhtiari Nejad: and said: “I am your lord, the highest.”

25.Bakhtiari Nejad: So, God punished him with an exemplary punishment in the Hereafter and this life.

26.Bakhtiari Nejad: Indeed, there is a lesson in that for anyone who fears (God).

27.Bakhtiari Nejad: Are you harder to create or the sky that He has built?

28.Bakhtiari Nejad: He raised its roof and arranged it.

29.Bakhtiari Nejad: And He darkened its night and brought out its daylight.

30.Bakhtiari Nejad: And after that He expanded/spread out the earth.

31.Bakhtiari Nejad: He brought out its water and its pasture from it,

32.Bakhtiari Nejad: and He set the mountains firm,

33.Bakhtiari Nejad: an enjoyment for you and your livestock.

34.Bakhtiari Nejad: So, when the great disaster comes,

35.Bakhtiari Nejad: a day when the human being remembers what he tried

36.Bakhtiari Nejad: and the hellfire is exposed for all who see.

37.Bakhtiari Nejad: So, anyone who rebelled

38.Bakhtiari Nejad: and preferred this world's life

39.Bakhtiari Nejad: then indeed the hellfire will be the housing (for him).

40.Bakhtiari Nejad: And as for anyone who is afraid of his Lord's position and prevents himself from the desires,

41.Bakhtiari Nejad: then indeed the garden will be the housing (for him).

42.Bakhtiari Nejad: They ask you about the Hour: “When is its anchoring (arrival)?”

43.Bakhtiari Nejad: In what (basis) would you remember it (when you have no knowledge of it)?

44.Bakhtiari Nejad: Its ending is up to your Lord.

45.Bakhtiari Nejad: You are only a warner for anyone who fears it.

46.Bakhtiari Nejad: The day when they see it, it is as if they stayed an evening or its morning.

1.Bakhtiari Nejad: He frowned and turned away

2.Bakhtiari Nejad: because the blind man came to him.

3.Bakhtiari Nejad: And how would you know? He may purify himself

4.Bakhtiari Nejad: or take notice, so the reminder would benefit him.

5.Bakhtiari Nejad: But whoever supposes he has no need,

6.Bakhtiari Nejad: then you pay attention to him

7.Bakhtiari Nejad: while it is not your responsibility if he did not purify.

8.Bakhtiari Nejad: But whoever comes to you rushing

9.Bakhtiari Nejad: and he fears (God)

10.Bakhtiari Nejad: then you pay no attention to him!

11.Bakhtiari Nejad: No way, it (Quran) is a reminder,

12.Bakhtiari Nejad: so, anyone who wants, will take notice (from) it.

13.Bakhtiari Nejad: (Written) in honored pages

14.Bakhtiari Nejad: elevated and purified,

15.Bakhtiari Nejad: by the hands of ambassadors/scribes,

16.Bakhtiari Nejad: noble and good.

17.Bakhtiari Nejad: Damn the (disbelieving) human being, how ungrateful he is!

18.Bakhtiari Nejad: What did He create him from?

19.Bakhtiari Nejad: He created him from a fertilized egg (zygote), then proportioned him.

20.Bakhtiari Nejad: Then He made the way easy for him.

21.Bakhtiari Nejad: Then He made him die and had him buried.

22.Bakhtiari Nejad: Then He will raise him when He wants.

23.Bakhtiari Nejad: No way, he did not fulfill what He ordered him.

24.Bakhtiari Nejad: So, the human being should look at his food.

25.Bakhtiari Nejad: Indeed, We poured down plenty of rain

26.Bakhtiari Nejad: then We split open the earth, cracking (for sprouts),

27.Bakhtiari Nejad: then We made grain grow in there,

28.Bakhtiari Nejad: and grapes and vegetables,

29.Bakhtiari Nejad: and olives and date palms,

30.Bakhtiari Nejad: and fenced gardens with lots of trees,

31.Bakhtiari Nejad: and fruits and grass,

32.Bakhtiari Nejad: an enjoyment for you and your livestock.

33.Bakhtiari Nejad: So, when the deafening blast comes,

34.Bakhtiari Nejad: a day when the man runs away from his brother

1.Bakhtiari Nejad: When the sun is rolled up

3.Bakhtiari Nejad: and when the mountains are moved

6.Bakhtiari Nejad: and when the seas are set on fire

17.Bakhtiari Nejad: and by the night when it turns dark

82.SurahEnglishNames: The Cleaving, The Cleaving Asunder, Bursting Apart

3.Bakhtiari Nejad: and when the seas are flooded (and overflowed)

83.SurahEnglishNames: Defrauding, The Defrauders, The Cheats, Cheating

5.Bakhtiari Nejad: for a great day?

10.Bakhtiari Nejad: Woe to the deniers on that day,

11.Bakhtiari Nejad: those who deny the Judgment Day.

12.Bakhtiari Nejad: And no one denies it except every sinner exceeding the limits.

13.Bakhtiari Nejad: When Our verses are read to him, he says: “Stories of the earlier ones.”

14.Bakhtiari Nejad: No way, but what they used to do has covered their hearts with rust.

15.Bakhtiari Nejad: No way, indeed on that day they are excluded from their Lord.

16.Bakhtiari Nejad: Then they shall enter (and burn in) the hellfire.

17.Bakhtiari Nejad: Then it is said: “This is what you used to deny.”

18.Bakhtiari Nejad: No way, indeed the record of the good ones shall be in Illiyin.

19.Bakhtiari Nejad: And how would you know what Illiyin is?

20.Bakhtiari Nejad: A written book,

21.Bakhtiari Nejad: the close ones (to God) testify to it.

22.Bakhtiari Nejad: Indeed, the good ones shall be in delight.

23.Bakhtiari Nejad: They will be on sofas looking.

25.Bakhtiari Nejad: They will be given sealed nectar to drink.

26.Bakhtiari Nejad: Its seal is musk. And the contenders should compete for that (delight).

27.Bakhtiari Nejad: And its mixture is from Tasneem,

28.Bakhtiari Nejad: a spring that the close ones (to God) drink from it.

30.Bakhtiari Nejad: and when they passed by them, they would wink at each other (ridiculing them)

32.Bakhtiari Nejad: and when they saw them, they would say: “These are certainly misguided.”

33.Bakhtiari Nejad: Although they were not sent as guardians over them.

34.Bakhtiari Nejad: So, today those who believed laugh at the disbelievers,

35.Bakhtiari Nejad: they are on sofas looking.

36.Bakhtiari Nejad: Were the disbelievers rewarded for (other than) what they used to do?

22.Bakhtiari Nejad: No, but those who disbelieve deny (Quran),

23.Bakhtiari Nejad: and God knows better what they hold (inside them).

24.Bakhtiari Nejad: So, give them the news of a painful punishment,

1.Bakhtiari Nejad: Did We not expand your chest/mind for you,

4.Bakhtiari Nejad: and We elevated your reputation for you?

3.Bakhtiari Nejad: with true (and lasting) writings in it.

4.Bakhtiari Nejad: And those who were given the book did not become divided until after the clear evidence had come to them.

5.Bakhtiari Nejad: And they were ordered to serve God alone, being sincere to Him in the way of life (religion) as a monotheist, and perform mandatory prayer and give to mandatory charity. And that is the lasting (and right) way of life (religion).

6.Bakhtiari Nejad: Indeed, those who disbelieve among people of the book and the idolaters will be in fire of hell, remaining in there forever. They are the worst of creatures.

7.Bakhtiari Nejad: Those who believe and do good, they are the best of creatures.

8.Bakhtiari Nejad: Their reward with their Lord is eternal gardens which rivers flow through them, remaining in there forever and ever. God is pleased with them, and they are pleased with Him. That is for anyone who fears his Lord.

1.Bakhtiari Nejad: When the earth is shaken by its earthquake,

2.Bakhtiari Nejad: and the earth unloads its heavy loads,

3.Bakhtiari Nejad: and the human being says: “What is the matter with it?”

4.Bakhtiari Nejad: On that day it speaks out its stories,

5.Bakhtiari Nejad: because your Lord revealed to it.

6.Bakhtiari Nejad: On that day people come out in separate groups to be shown their works.

7.Bakhtiari Nejad: And anyone who does a tiny bit of good sees it,

8.Bakhtiari Nejad: and anyone who does a tiny bit of bad sees it.

100.SurahEnglishNames: The Courser, The Chargers, The Assulters

1.Bakhtiari Nejad: By the horses making charge, snorting,

2.Bakhtiari Nejad: and the producers of sparks, striking (their horseshoes),

3.Bakhtiari Nejad: and the attackers in the morning

4.Bakhtiari Nejad: that raise cloud of dust with it,

5.Bakhtiari Nejad: and penetrate to the middle of it (the battle) together,

6.Bakhtiari Nejad: indeed, the human being is ungrateful to his Lord,

7.Bakhtiari Nejad: and he is certainly a witness to that,

8.Bakhtiari Nejad: and indeed, his love for the good things (and wealth) is extreme.

9.Bakhtiari Nejad: Does he not know that, when what is in the graves is turned upside down

10.Bakhtiari Nejad: and what is in the chests/minds is exposed,

11.Bakhtiari Nejad: indeed, their Lord is well aware of them on that day?

101.SurahEnglishNames: The Calamity, The Stunning Blow, The Disaster, The Terrible Calamity

1.Bakhtiari Nejad: The pounding disaster.

2.Bakhtiari Nejad: What is the pounding disaster?

3.Bakhtiari Nejad: And how would you know what the pounding disaster is?

4.Bakhtiari Nejad: The day when the people become like scattered butterflies

5.Bakhtiari Nejad: and the mountains become like fluffed up colored wool.

6.Bakhtiari Nejad: As for anyone whose balance (of good deeds) is heavy,

7.Bakhtiari Nejad: then he is in a pleasant life.

8.Bakhtiari Nejad: And as for anyone whose balance (of good deeds) is light,

9.Bakhtiari Nejad: then his residence is a bottomless pit.

10.Bakhtiari Nejad: And how would you know what it is?

11.Bakhtiari Nejad: (It is) a scorching fire.

102.SurahEnglishNames: Rivalry in World Increase, Competition, Worldly Gain

1.Bakhtiari Nejad: Greed (and rivalry) has distracted you,

2.Bakhtiari Nejad: to a point that you visited the graves.

3.Bakhtiari Nejad: No way, you will know.

4.Bakhtiari Nejad: And once more, no way, you will know.

5.Bakhtiari Nejad: No way, if you knew the sure knowledge (then greed/rivalry would not have preoccupied you).

6.Bakhtiari Nejad: You shall see the hellfire,

7.Bakhtiari Nejad: then you shall see it with the sure eye.

8.Bakhtiari Nejad: Then, on that day, you shall be questioned about the pleasures (in life).

103.SurahEnglishNames: The Declining Day, Eventide, The Epoch, Time

1.Bakhtiari Nejad: By the time (the ages),

2.Bakhtiari Nejad: indeed, the human being is in loss

3.Bakhtiari Nejad: except those who believe and do good and recommend one another to the truth and recommend one another to perseverance (and patience).

104.SurahEnglishNames: The Traducer, The Gossipmonger, The Slanderer

1.Bakhtiari Nejad: Woe to every slanderer and fault-finder.

2.Bakhtiari Nejad: The one who piles up wealth and keeps count of it,

3.Bakhtiari Nejad: thinking that his wealth (and possession) makes him immortal.

4.Bakhtiari Nejad: No way, he shall be thrown into the crushing fire.

5.Bakhtiari Nejad: And how would you know what the crushing fire is?

6.Bakhtiari Nejad: (It is the) blazing fire of God

7.Bakhtiari Nejad: which rises over (and overtakes) the hearts,

8.Bakhtiari Nejad: indeed, it closes over them (all over them)

9.Bakhtiari Nejad: in extending columns.

1.Bakhtiari Nejad: Have you not considered what your Lord did to companions of the elephant?

2.Bakhtiari Nejad: Did He not make their plot go wrong,

3.Bakhtiari Nejad: and sent flocks of birds on them,

4.Bakhtiari Nejad: throwing stones of baked clay at them,

5.Bakhtiari Nejad: then He made them like chewed up straw?

1.Bakhtiari Nejad: For protection (and keeping together) of the Quraish,

2.Bakhtiari Nejad: their protection for the winter and the summer journey,

3.Bakhtiari Nejad: so, they should serve the Lord of this house,

4.Bakhtiari Nejad: the One Who fed them in hunger and made them safe from fear.

107.SurahEnglishNames: Small Kindnesses, Almsgiving, Have you Seen, The Daily Necessaries

1.Bakhtiari Nejad: Did you see the one who denies the religion (or the Judgment Day)?

2.Bakhtiari Nejad: That is the one who pushes the orphan away,

3.Bakhtiari Nejad: and does not encourage feeding the poor.

4.Bakhtiari Nejad: So, woe to those who perform mandatory prayer (and continue their wrongful deeds),

5.Bakhtiari Nejad: those who are unmindful of (the purpose of) their mandatory prayer,

6.Bakhtiari Nejad: those who pretend (and show off what they do)

7.Bakhtiari Nejad: and withhold the small kindnesses.

1.Bakhtiari Nejad: Indeed, We gave you plenty.

2.Bakhtiari Nejad: So, perform mandatory prayer for your Lord and sacrifice (for Him alone).

3.Bakhtiari Nejad: Indeed your hater, he is cut off (and is childless).

1.Bakhtiari Nejad: Say: “You the disbelievers,

2.Bakhtiari Nejad: I do not serve what you serve,

3.Bakhtiari Nejad: and you are not servants of what I serve,

4.Bakhtiari Nejad: and I am not a servant of what you serve,

5.Bakhtiari Nejad: and you are not servants of what I serve,

6.Bakhtiari Nejad: your way of life (religion) for you and my way of life (religion) for me.”

1.Bakhtiari Nejad: When God's help and the victory comes,

2.Bakhtiari Nejad: and you see people entering into God's way of life (religion) in groups (of large number),

3.Bakhtiari Nejad: glorify your Lord with His praise and ask His forgiveness. Indeed He is acceptor of repentance.

1.Bakhtiari Nejad: May Abu Lahab's both hands (or his power) perish, and may he perish.

2.Bakhtiari Nejad: His wealth and what he has earned will be of no use to him.

3.Bakhtiari Nejad: He is going to enter (and burn in) a flaming fire,

4.Bakhtiari Nejad: and (so is) his wife, carrier of the firewood,

5.Bakhtiari Nejad: around her neck will be a rope of palm fiber.

1.Bakhtiari Nejad: Say: “He is the One God,

2.Bakhtiari Nejad: God is the eternal (and is needed and is without any need),

3.Bakhtiari Nejad: He did not father (anyone), and He was not born,

4.Bakhtiari Nejad: and there is none equal (or comparable) to Him.”

1.Bakhtiari Nejad: Say: “I seek protection of the Lord of the daybreak

2.Bakhtiari Nejad: from the harm of whatever He has created

3.Bakhtiari Nejad: and from the harm of darkness when it comes

4.Bakhtiari Nejad: and from the harm of the blowers into the knots (who practice witchcraft)

5.Bakhtiari Nejad: and from the harm of the envious when he envies.”.

1.Bakhtiari Nejad: Say: “I seek protection of the Lord of the people,

2.Bakhtiari Nejad: King of the people,

3.Bakhtiari Nejad: god of the people,

4.Bakhtiari Nejad: from the harm of the withdrawing tempter (who withdraws at the mention of God),

5.Bakhtiari Nejad: the one who tempts in people's chest/minds,

6.Bakhtiari Nejad: (whether) from Jinn or people.”
